"female">>female<<else>>[[test female|MASTER][$sex to "female"]]<<endif>> | <<if $sex == "undefined">>undefined<<else>>[[test undefined|MASTER][$sex to "undefined"]]<<endif>>There needs to be a master CYCLE passage that works for ALL stories. * CYCLE will track what day it is, what part of the day, and which passages are to control events of that day. * Each story will have a list of passage names (such as "1941-Day" or "1965-Afterschool"), so CYCLE can direct the game to refer to whatever passages are required. Since not all stories will be set in the same environment -- at work, at school -- each story can thus have its own list of required passages. Stories can also share passages for generic activities (eg, bathing, sleeping) or for certain activities that must share mechanical effects on stats (like working out). The "Working Out" passage from multiple eras can refer to a single Working Out Calculation passage to keep the code in one place. * This structure means CYCLE must have a single array that tracks the list of passages, how long that list is, and where we are now. However, it also means that we could (in theory) skip to a new day-part by manually cycling that variable. There needs to be a SETUP passage for each era. * The SETUP passage will establish the list of passages that must be consulted by CYCLE, as well as the starting date and any other relevant details. There must be a MASTER passage that controls access to the various eras. * The MASTER passage will check to see which passages are available and establish links for the ones which are. * The MASTER passage may also link to the BOOK, which puts the player's story into a medical context. There must be a BOOK which reflects the player's accumulated decisions and how they affect the future of the Zeta Wave phenomenon. The player can only refer to a BOOK passage after having completed the related scenario. * To keep track of the BOOK, I must have a shorthand for outcomes that can be boiled down to a this-or-that variable. For instance, 75% of all the players' playthroughs were MTF and ended up in pregnancy, or 95% of all playthroughs changed sexual orientation, or whatever. * The BOOK will not have any special interactivity to it, except to be able to reset all the variables (with a warning that this will start the game over from the beginning). <<display "SetBack">><<display "CycleCalc">><<display class="indent">You wake up, groggy and only half-covered by your blankets. Fortunately, there's a section in the Girl Scout guide on knot-tying, so you look up a half-Windsor knot and figure it out yourself. It takes a couple of tries to get the length right, and you still have to tuck the end of the tie into your shirt so it doesn't stick out the bottom of the sweater.</div> <div class="indent">You check yourself out in the mirror in the upstairs hallway. Instead of hunching over and trying to hide yourself, trying not to be noticed, hoping nobody sees what happened to you, you walk with confidence. You hold her head high. You can't expect to just waltz out the front door wearing your <<if $sex == "female">>mother's dress,<<else>>father's clothes,<<endif>> to say nothing of hopping on your bike and riding down the driveway. If you're lucky, you'll be able to grab the satchel, find a hedge or something to change behind, and come back later for your old clothes. It could work.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">As soon as you get home, you have to start getting ready for your date. You're still not entirely accustomed to dressing like a $girlboy[$gen], and you figure you're going to need as much time as you can get. Your whole future could depend on getting this date right tonight.</div> <<if $sex == "female">><div class="indent">You just had a bath the night before, but there's no harm in taking another. <<if $secret == true>>Besides, you're going to have to shave your legs if this disguise is going to work. It's too bad you don't have a wig or something so your hair looks more girly, but that's the way it goes. Perhaps if you wear a pretty hat, nobody will notice.<<else>>Thankfully, you already shaved your legs, so that'll save a bit of time, which you'll be able to use getting the wig on.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">After your bath, you pick out an outfit that looks fairly good: a pretty melon-colored dress with your yellow sweater, some white stockings, and dark brown shoes. It takes a little time to get your makeup right. You're still not used to it, but you're getting better.</div> <<elseif $sex == "male">><div class="indent">You just had a bath the night before, but there's no harm taking another. You seem to have more of a problem with body odor as a boy than you did before. Is that why boys smell so strongly? They just can't help it?</div> <div class="indent">After your bath, you check your face in the mirror. You're not sure what to do with it, since you don't need to wear makeup, so you give it a wash and feel a little bit scratchy stubble on your chin. Better take a razor to that — very carefully.</div> <div class="indent">The last thing to work on is your hair. <<if $secret == true>>The trouble is, boys don't wear their hair long like this, and you don't want to cut it. After all, how will you continue attending school as a girl on Monday if you chop off your hair tonight? No, a baseball cap will have to do.<<else>>Luckily, your mother cut it nice and short, so it doesn't take long to dry. There isn't much you need to do with it except give it a good comb.<<endif>></div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">It's not a bad outfit, you decide, checking yourself in the hall mirror. Luckily, $sibnick doesn't notice you preening and studying your reflection.</div> <<endif>>\ <<elseif $path.includes("SO date")>><<set _havedate to true>><div class="indent">As soon as you get home, you have to start getting ready for your date. It won't take hours, thankfully, but you are going to make to make certain your disguise stands up. You have to look like a $girlboy[$oppgen], and you just don't //feel// that much like one any more.</div> <<if $sex == "female">><div class="indent">You get dressed in your boys' clothing, <<if $secret == true>>which still doesn't feel like it fits you. The shirt is too baggy, and there's something missing in the trousers. <<if $path.includes("sock stuffing")>>You're tempted to put another sock down there, but what's the point? People would just tease you about it anyway.<<else>>You're tempted to put a sock down there, but people would probably just tease you for it.<<endif>><<else>>which doesn't feel like it fits you any more. Your shaved legs feel smooth and sensitive in your trouser legs, and the fabric keeps clinging to your skin.<<endif>> You have to wear a couple different pairs of socks to get your shoes to fit.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">You get dressed in your girls' clothing, <<if $secret == true>>which still doesn't feel like it fits you. The dress is snug around the shoulders, there's an awkward lump beneath the skirt that's hard to conceal, and you're completely flat up top. <<if $path.includes("bra stuffing")>>You're tempted to put more tissue paper in your bra, but people would probably just tease you for it.<<else>>You're tempted to put some tissue paper in your bra, but what's the point? People would just tease you for it anyway.<<endif>> At least you still have long hair, which helps to hide your face a little. Some makeup would also help complete the look, so you don't look so much like a boy in a dress.<<else>>With your hair cut boyishly short, it doesn't do much to help the overall impression that you're just a boy in a dress.<<endif>> Maybe, if you squint just right, a boyish-looking girl.</div> <<endif>><<else>><<set _havedate to false>><div class="indent">You arrive home and flop down on your bed, exhausted. It's been such a strange week.</div> <div class="indent">You want to try to relax and not think about the troubles you had at school, but your thoughts are already turning to your scout meeting tomorrow. How are you going to show up there looking like //this?//</div> <<endif>>\ <<if _havedate == true>><<set $cleanlink to "go on your date">><<display "CleanReturn">> <<else>><<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $day == 5>><<if $path.includes("skip scouts")>><div class="indent">After Mom's scout meeting is over, the house is quiet again, and you're able to sit in your room and reflect on everything that's happened over the past week. We have a party line."</div> <div class="indent">"Short interview," Floyd says. It sounds like there's a pencil in his mouth. "Got it. There's no getting out of it.</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">All day long, you considered the alternatives, but none of them seemed to solve the problem. Make her run a brush through those tangles, too."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">By the time Pop gets to the table, his tie is loosened, his shoes are off, and he's got the newspaper tucked under one arm and a highball glass with a whiskey and soda in the other hand that Mom made for him. If it isn't the Russians creeping around, or the French government collapsing again, it's the specter of Communists like Alger Hiss looming behind every headline. He doesn't even have the Seattle Pilots to fall back on, <<if $sex == "male">>because this summer they weren't much better than //bad//, and the St Louis Browns (his second love) were even worse.<<else>>at least according to his endless grumbling over the sports section this summer.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">Today, $sibnick must have missed Mom's Look, because she asks, "Why, is something bad?"</div> <div class="indent">"Nothing, sugar," Pop says to her, but he looks across the table at Mom, taps the newspaper, and mouths the word //polio.// (<<link "footnote 1" "1948 Footnotes">><<set $page to 1>><</link>>)</div> --<<link "ask about polio" "1948 Family Talk">><<set $page to 0>><</link>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 2>><<if $path.includes("reveal TG")>><div class="indent">There's already pot roast on the table when Pop gets home, and Mom rushes everyone through dinner as quickly as possible.</div> <div class="indent">"No, $sibnick," she says wearily to your younger sister. We have an important phone call to make, and if you can't finish your supper like a good girl, you'll have to take it and finish it upstairs in your room. Cold."</div> <div class="indent">Whining, instinctively realizing she's being excluded from this momentous phone call — she couldn't possibly know what it is — $sib says, "C'mon, Mom, can't I—"</div> <div class="indent">"No, not tonight. "Please, I'm trying to have a bath."</div> --<<link "shave your legs" "1948 Solo">><<set $page to 2>><<set $fact.push("shaved legs")>><<set $path.push("shaved legs")>><<set $cupsizebonus += 5>><<set $hipbonus += 2>><</link>> --<<link "don't shave, and go to bed" "1948 Solo">><<set $page to 3>><</link>> <<endif>><<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><<if $path.includes("SO date") or $path.includes("friend date")>><div class="indent">You get home from your date a little later than <<if $secret == true>>expected, changing back into your own clothes along the way.<<else>>expected.<<endif>> Luckily, the only response you get from your parents is a disgruntled look over the top edge of the newspaper from Pop, and a tapping foot in the hallway from Mom.</div> <div class="indent">"Did you have a good time?" This whole ... this whole //this// was going to happen to you every single time you tried to get hot and heavy with someone. With anyone, it seemed.</div> <div class="indent">Your thoughts go to <<if $path.includes("friend date")>><<set _comp to $fr>><<set _cgen to $fgen>><<else>><<set _comp to $so>><<set _cgen to $sogen>><<endif>>_comp, and you think about what it would be like to start kissing $acc[_cgen], except then you can't stop thinking about what it would be like to find yourself changing back and forth from boy to girl and back again.</div> <div class="indent">You think about what it would be like. And to get married. And to have kids. Maybe even get a job. Always switching back and forth.</div> <div class="indent">You can't imagine it. Sitting close ... getting warm ... feeling that inevitable magnetic attraction ...</div> <div class="indent">//Whoa, whoa, hang on,// you think, alarmed. //Watch the hormones. There's no sense letting all of this stuff get on top of you.</div> <div class="indent">Then, when you can no longer pretend to be interested in homework, you brush your teeth and start getting ready for bed.</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 9>><div class="indent">You pore over your battered copy of //The Aerie,// reading and re-reading every article in hopes that there are clues about the other students at the school who are like you.</div> <div class="indent">Eventually, you put away the newspaper and get ready for bed.</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 10>><div class="indent">You do your homework, but it's impossible to concentrate on school at a time like this.</div> <div class="indent">Eventually you give up on your books and get ready for bed.</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 11>><div class="indent">After packing for your camping trip, you get ready for bed, your mind whirling. <<if $sex == $startsex and $path.includes("new scout troop")>>You've been signed up for the //other// scout trip, but you're the wrong shape. Is it too late to switch to going on the other trip, and would that even help?<<elseif $path.includes("new scout troop")>>You've signed up for a camping trip over the weekend with that //other// scout troop. RESET THE UPDATE FLAG <<set $updated to 0>> INCREMENT DATE <<run $now.setHours($now.getHours() + 24)>> INCREMENT DAY OF WEEK <<set $weekday++>> <<if $weekday == 7>> <<set $weekday to 0>> <<endif>> <<set $mact to []>> <<set $fact to []>> THIS IS HOW WE BEGAN TODAY <<set $wakeupsex to $sex>> <<endif>>\ We must calculate which of the players' impulses is strongest. <<set $bent to "none">> <<if $forthright gte $secretive and $forthright gte $ashamed>> <<set $bent to "forthright">> <<elseif $ashamed gte $secretive and $ashamed gte $forthright>> <<set $bent to "ashamed">> <<else>> The default is SECRETIVE. <<set $bent to "secretive">> <<endif>> <<endsilently>><<if $cyc == 0>><div class="aside">[Today is <<print $now.toDateString()>>.]</div> <<endif>>\<<silently>> <<removeclass "html" "boy">> <<removeclass "html" "boydark">> <<removeclass "html" "girl">> <<removeclass "html" "girldark">> <<removeclass "html" "neutral">> <<removeclass "html" "neutraldark">> <<if $sex == "female">> <<if $mode == "dark">> <<addclass "html" "girldark">> <<else>> <<addclass "html" "girl">> <<endif>> <<elseif $sex == "male">> <<if $mode == "dark">> <<addclass "html" "boydark">> <<else>> <<addclass "html" "boy">> <<endif>> <<else>> <<if $mode == "dark">> <<addclass "html" "neutraldark">> <<else>> <<addclass "html" "neutral">> <<endif>> <<endif>> <<endsilently>>\STAT CHANGES When player is MALE +1 for every day male (28 max) +8 for every makeout session as a male (usu. 1/week, 32 max) +2 for each day with a workout (usu. weekdays, 40 max) When player is FEMALE +1 for every day female, first two weeks after menses (14 max) +2 for every day female, third week after menses (14 max) +4 for every day female, week before menses (28 max) +11 for every makeout session as a female (usu. 1/week, 44 max) EITHER +10 male, +10 female, every time player has sex. This is because sex is an in-between act for Zetas, and the player should be rewarded whether trying to get TO a particular sex, or have fun AS a particular sex. In theory, maximum possible is 100, but certain configurations can go up to 114 or so (mostly femininity). Adding in sex takes the max up to 140. PLANNED CHARACTER ARCS SO: Your significant other is conveniently bisexual. This means he (or she) is willing to continue to date you, on the condition that you keep your Zeta status secret. Your SO doesn't want to be outed. At some point, you'll have to choose between being open and breaking up with your SO. Friend: Your best friend is heterosexual. They will only have sex with you when you are in opposite-sex mode (Gary with girls, Joyce with boys). Your best friend is willing to have sex with you, but doesn't otherwise want to be seen dating you. This is a similar "secretive" route, because basically your friend will only participate in "fixing you back to normal." It only differs from SO in the sex of the participant. Another Zeta: there is always another Zeta you can try to date, namely Henry or Arlene. Both of them are capable of being open and accepting, although not at first. Neither one wants to be the only Zeta, and both have worked hard to keep their condition secret. You come along and can bring them into the light, if you try. This will require you to break up with SO and not date your friend. Bully: the bully in the school is also a Zeta and is terribly embarrassed about it. You will discover the bully's secret. If you end up dating the bully — the bully has a lot of jealousy issues about your openness and insecurity about his/her condition — then this is the "ashamed" route. Dating the bully means keeping everything on the DL. Parents: Earl and Leah. PUBLICITY ARC: Early in the game you can do an interview with the school newspaper. Because it's published in a real press, the staff gets wind of it and wants to do a "real" interview. This leads to the chance to do radio, and to film a newsreel about your condition. Doing the interview cuts off any chance of dating SO, Friend, and the Bully. If you do publicity, the Bully will stay so far away that you'll never discover the secret. SECRECY ARC: Early in the game you have the choice of creating an alternate identity, with or without the school's cooperation. This creates a fig leaf for your alternate self to continue to date SO or Friend without exposing them to ridicule. The more you work at this alternate ID (via Scouts, via schooling), the more solid your potential relationship will be with SO or Friend. The other Zeta will be put off by your cowardice. The Bully will take advantage of you for it until you discover the Bully's secret, and then will leave you alone. SHAME ARC: The more you withdraw from society, by skipping school, skipping scouts, and dodging the public, the more likely you will find support from the Bully, who has a similar problem. The Bully used to be popular, but over the past year has become exiled (in his/her own mind). CYCLE ORDER (per day) WAKE: When the player wakes up. This often (not always) means we run the SexChange script and assess any new changes. DRESS: Anything that happens before school starts. Conversations with lovers, breakfast, getting dressed, traveling to school. SCHOOL 1: The first half of the school day. M Classes: English, Health/Gym, History, Vocal Music F Classes: English, Stenography, Health/Gym, Vocal Music Instructors: Bookkeeping (Mr Vanderbilt) English (Mrs Hull) Geometry (Mr Franklin) Health/Gym (Mr Franklin / Mrs Bell) History (Mr Lester) Home Economics (Mrs Reynolds) Spanish (Mrs White) Stenography (Mrs Johnson) Vocal Music (Mrs Guildford) Wood Shop (Mr Thacker) LUNCH: The break in the middle of the school day, talk with any friends or rivals. SCHOOL 2: The second half of the school day. M Classes: Spanish, Geometry, Wood Shop F Classes: Spanish, Bookkeeping, Home Economics AFTER SCHOOL: Doing homework (often very little in 1948), play- time, talk with friends. Mom is home during the day, so this is not particularly private time, just not directly supervised. DINNER: Talking over family issues. BEDTIME: Anything after dinner and before actual sleep. This can include nighttime hygiene rituals, taking baths, brushing teeth, changing into pajamas, makeout sessions, or dates. SLEEP: A little afterthought, which can include scenes where you go to bed (that is, to fall asleep) with someone else by you. DREAM: Anything you dream about. SCHEDULE (across multiple days) DAY 11 (Friday September 17). Emergency transformation plan (back to normal only). Second transformation (when player is Secret only). Called out of class for real newspaper interview. After school: possible fight with bully. open interview: real reporter shows up, bully flees. anonymous interview: fight or friends. no interview: fight, OR flirt (non-open) (bully flees, shows up at Scouts), OR friends (non-secret) DAY 12 (Saturday September 18). SCOUTING (mandatory). DREAM: Mandatory switch (if non-secret). WAKE: Optional switch (masturbate). ORIG SCOUTS find out when Dot blabs (previously was secret). Reveal and FIGHT for your right to stay (forthright). LIE about condition (secretive), try to stay on. QUIT rather than reveal it (ashamed). NEW SCOUTS ... meet up with transformed bully (if bully fled). Not sure who it is at first. NEW SCOUTS ... save an injured scout (carry/tend). If bully fled, injured scout is bully. If not, it's someone else. DAY 13 (Sunday September 19). Real newspaper interview comes out. If open zeta and saved a scout, this is in there also. Heroism! Also, include friends and bully fleeing. PARENTS schedule new appointment for Wed. It keeps happening! Dinner: Mom had confirmation from doctor about change: it's sex. Stop it! She'll be watching from now on. DAY 14 (Monday September 20). Banners for Homecoming go up. DAY 15 DAY 16 (Wednesday September 22). SECOND DOCTOR VISIT (mandatory). DOCTOR explains that changes are difficult to avoid. Sex urge is hard to suppress. You'll have to ride it out for a few more weeks. DAY 17 (Thursday, September 23). DREAM. Transformation (mandatory) DATE. Try to switch back. DAY 18 (Friday, September 24). GYM: Water First Aid quiz. DINNER: First football game (Pep Squad, Marchind Band). DAY 19 (Saturday September 25). SCOUTING (mandatory). DAY 20 DAY 21 DAY 22 DAY 23 DAY 24 (Thursday, September 30). DATE (option to switch back). DAY 25 (Friday, October 1). HOMECOMING DANCE. DAY 26 (Saturday October 2). SCOUTING (mandatory). DAY 27 (Sunday, October 3). DREAM: Fixed transformation. "I thought we should probably talk."</div> <div class="indent">"I agree. You could feel it was long by the way it brushed your ears and tickled the back of your neck, but not this long.<<elseif $hair gt 20>>which has grown down to your chin. You could feel that it was long by the way it tickled your ears, but not this long.<<elseif $hair gt 10>>which has grown out considerably into a shaggy mop of hair. It's not a boy's length any more. This is the kind of length that makes the principal cluck his tongue disapprovingly and pull out his ruler.<<endif>> Your face is <<if $fem gt 50>>much more feminine, softer and gentler, with fuller lips and a smaller chin. Your eyes seem larger and more open, and your brow has softened.<<elseif $fem gt 35>>a lot more feminine, softer and gentler, and you can tell your lips are fuller and your chin smaller.<<elseif $fem gt 20>>a bit more feminine, softer and gentler than before.<<else>>a tiny bit more feminine, too, giving you a girlier look.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">The next thing you notice is your body. <<if $shoulders lte 32>>Your shoulders have become much narrower, and your frame is delicate and feminine.<<elseif $shoulders lte 33>>Your shoulders have become slightly narrower, giving you a more feminine frame.<<else>>Your shoulders have started to narrow, giving you a more delicate-looking frame.<<endif>> <<if $strength lt 42>>Your muscles have evaporated, and your shoulders and arms have dwindled to slender stems.<<elseif $strength lt 44>>Your muscles have melted away, and your shoulders and arms have shrunk in size.<<else>>Your muscles have started melting away, and your shoulders and arms are smaller now.<<endif>> <<if $cupsize == 5>>Your chest has popped out to a sizeable $cup[$cupsize], pushing out your pinstriped shirt with two big apple-sized scoops of female flesh, leaving you as large or slightly larger than most of the other girls in your year.<<elseif $cupsize == 4>>Your chest has swelled out to a respectable $cup[$cupsize], pushing out your pinstriped shirt with two big handfuls of female flesh, leaving you around the same size as most of the other girls in your year.<<elseif $cupsize == 3>>Your chest has grown out to a modest $cup[$cupsize], pushing out your pinstriped shirt with two small handfuls of female flesh, leaving you slightly smaller than most of the other girls in your year.<<else>>Your chest has begun to grow out to a tiny $cup[$cupsize], nudging out the fabric of your pinstriped shirt.<<endif>> Your nipples poke out, large and prominent, and you can see the darker halo of your nipples right through your shirt.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, that won't do," Mom says, noticing your shocked face in the mirror. "Come on, get that shirt off. Let's see if one of these bras will fit you."</div> <div class="indent">Mom manages to get one of the brassieres on you, but it's a bit of a struggle since you don't know what you're doing or how to help.</div> <<if $cupsize gt 3>><div class="indent">"Hmm," she says. "Maybe. The band fits, but the cups aren't -- try smoothing it out. Grab the cup like this, and fit yourself into it." She demonstrates a pinching motion with one hand, and a kind of sweep with the other, and you manage to get your breast situated properly. "Better. Now the other one. Yes, I think that'll do."</div> <div class="indent">She fishes in the bag for a suitable dress, and hauls out one in cotton-candy pink with white lace trim. "I know, it's more of a party dress, but let's just see if it fits."</div> <div class="indent">Mom makes you raise your arms so she can drop the dress over your head, and she spends a few minutes judiciously tugging at the fabric. "It fits up top," she decides. "Let's tie off the belt in a nice bow. Good! You just need some shoes and stockings to go with that, and you'll look great."</div><<set $path.push("cotton candy dress")>> <<else>>She fishes in the bag for a suitable dress, and hauls out one in cotton-candy pink with white lace trim. "I know, it's more of a party dress, but let's just see if it fits."</div> <div class="indent">Luckily, it doesn't -- Mom says you aren't big enough on top, and the dress looks too baggy on you. "Let's try this one," she says, pulling out a pale yellow dress with blue flowers. "This is a summer dress, so it might be a little chilly, but I didn't have much time to shop. Arms up."</div><<set $path.push("yellow sundress")>> <div class="indent">This one fits to your mother's satisfaction, and she gets everything in place. "There. It's not so bad with the belt tied, is it? Now you just need some shoes and stockings and you'll look great."</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">Grumbling, you take the pair of stockings from her and sit down on the lid of the toilet. Mom shows you how to roll them up into a little donut shape, then put your toes into the center so they roll up your legs easily. <<if $path.includes("shaved legs")>>"These are nylons, so they're partially sheer. Thirty denier. That's what that number is right there on the packet. I figured you'd shaved your legs, so you can get away with these, but be careful with them, because nylons are still expensive."<<else>>"These are opaque white. Fifty denier. That's what that number is right there on the packet, see? I knew you hadn't shaved your legs, so this covers that up nicely. It's a little trick to remember."<<endif>> After that, she tries a couple of pairs of shoes on your little feet. "These will do," she decides, buckling on some black patent leather shoes and tucking the other pair back into the bag. "Don't go getting them scuffed up, okay? They look much better polished like this."</div> <div class="indent">You stand up and look at yourself in the mirror. "Okay," you sigh. "I guess that's good enough."</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, no it isn't," Mom says, unsnapping her purse. "You're not going out there without any makeup on and embarrass me. Don't move, little lady, we've got work to do still."</div> <div class="indent">You have to hold still while Mom tends to your face. First the tweezers come out and stray hairs are plucked from your eyebrows, your nose, your cheeks, and your hairline. Then she sets to work applying all kinds of creams and powders to your face. Her description of each cosmetic is a blur of commentary that you can't keep up with: foundation, powder, rouge, eyeliner, lipstick, mascara, eyebrow pencil, concealer. After all that, <<if $hair gt 20>>she runs a comb through your hair several times to get the tangles out, and pulls your hair back into a metal clip to keep it out of your eyes.<<else>>she runs a comb through your hair and bundles some of it into a metal clip to make it look more feminine.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"//Now// you're done," she says, looking you over critically and fluffing your hair. "You'd better get back to class."</div> <div class="indent">You look at the clock. It's nearly lunchtime. "It's almost lunch."</div> <div class="indent">"Do that, then," she says. "I'm sure you can figure it out. You're a big girl now."</div> --<<link "go to lunch" "1948 Lunch">><<set $path.push("secret exposed")>><</link>> <<endif>><<endif>>\<<display "Update">> <<silently>> <<set $totaltgs += 1>> <<set $lastheight to $ht>> <<set $laststrength to $strength>> <<set $lastlownote to $lownote>> ALL INCREASES HAVE BEEN PERFORMED. SWITCHAROO TIME!! <<if $sex == "male">> /% Player is PRESENTLY male %/ <<set $gen to 4>> <<set $oppgen to 3>> <<set $sex to "female">> CHANGING FROM MALE TO FEMALE: set cup size We have cup sizes available from 0 (none) to 9 (GG). The raw algorithm below (fem - 6) / 28 + sc grants a change from 0 to 5 (or 1 to 6 if female). Therefore, we can grant up to 70 points in BONUS cup size before maxing out. <<set $lastcup to $cupsize>> <<if $startsex == "female">> <<set _sc to 2>> <<else>> <<set _sc to 1>> <<endif>> <<set _fem to $fem + $cupsizebonus>> <<set _c to Math.floor((_fem - 6) / 28) + _sc>> <<set $cupsize to _c>> <<if $cupsize gt 9>> <<set $cupsize to 9>> <<elseif $cupsize lt 0>> <<set $cupsize to 0>> <<endif>> : set cock size <<set $cocksize to 0>> : set strength <<set _fem to $fem + (3 * $fstrengthbonus)>> <<set _s to Math.floor(_fem / 10)>> <<set $strength to 50 - _s>> For a range of 0 to 140, the algorithm gives a possible range of 50 to 36. Strength gradually diminishes as $fem increases. The BONUS (worth 3x equivalent in fem) can be up to 70 points and drops strength to a minimum of 15. : set hair length minimum <<set _f to Math.floor($fem / 2) + 5>> For a range of 0 to 140, this gives a range of 5 cm to 75 cm (2 to 29 inches). There is no bonus. <<if $fhair lt _f>> When the hair length is less than the minimum feminine style, adjust the female hair variable. At the start of the game when $fem == 0, this results in default boy- hair length of 5 cm. <<set $fhair to _f>> <<endif>> <<set $hair to $fhair>> /% now has minimum length %/ : set height A range of 0 to 140 gives height results from 172 cm (5'7") to 165 cm (5'4"). Height decreases as femininity increases. The BONUS takes us down to 151 cm (4'11"). <<set _fem to $fem + (4 * $fheightbonus)>> <<set _h to Math.floor(_fem / 20)>> /% height in cm %/ <<set $ht to 172 - _h>> Shoulder and hip width is based on height, so they must be done first. : set shoulder width A range of 0 to 140 gives shoulder width results from 34 cm (13.3") to 31 (12.2"), which isn't much of a change, but it will be something the player can take note of. There is no bonus. <<set _hbase to Math.floor($ht / 5)>> <<set _sh to Math.floor($fem / 50)>> <<set $shoulders to _hbase + _sh>> : set hip width For a range of 0 to 140, this gives results of 28" to 35". We can therefore grant up to 70 points of BONUS hip size. <<set $lasthips to $hips>> <<set _fem to $fem + (2 * $hipbonus)>> <<set _h to Math.floor(_fem / 20)>> <<set $hips to 28 + _h>> <<set $hipdiff to $lasthips - $hips>> : set voice <<set $lownote to 50 + Math.floor($fem / 7)>> <<elseif $sex == "female">> /% Player is PRESENTLY female %/ <<set $gen to 3>> <<set $oppgen to 4>> <<set $sex to "male">> CHANGING FROM FEMALE TO MALE: set cup size <<set $cupsize to 0>> /% None by default. %/ : set cock size For a range of 0 to 140, this gives results of 4 to 7". The BONUS takes us up over 12". We can grant up to 70 points in bonuses. <<set $lastcock to $cocksize>> <<set _masc to $masc + (4 * $cocksizebonus)>> <<set _p to Math.floor(_masc / 20)>> <<set $cocksize to 10 + _p>> : set strength For a range of 0 to 100, this gives a range of 50 to 120. Strength gradually increases as $masc increases. The BONUS takes us up to 120. We can grant up to 70 points in bonuses. <<set _masc to $masc + (4 * $mstrengthbonus)>> <<set _s to Math.floor(_masc / 6)>> <<set $strength to 50 + _s>> : set hair length <<set $hair to $mhair>> /% no min or max length %/ : set height A range of 0 to 140 gives height results from 172 cm (5'7") to 179 cm (5'10"). Height increases as manhood increases. The BONUS takes us to up to 193 cm (6'3"). We can grant up to 70 points of bonus. <<set _masc to $masc + (4 * $mheightbonus)>> <<set _h to Math.floor(_masc / 20)>> /% height in cm %/ <<set $ht to 172 + _h>> Shoulder width is based on height, so that must go first. : set shoulder width A range of 0 to 140 gives shoulder width results from 34 cm (13.3") to 42 (16.5"). The BONUS takes us up to 46 cm (18.1"). We can dole out 70 points of bonus. <<set $lastshoulders to $shoulders>> <<set _hbase to Math.floor($ht / 5)>> <<set _masc to $masc + $shoulderbonus>> <<set _sh to Math.floor(_masc / 15)>> <<set $shoulders to _hbase + _sh>> <<set $shoulderdiff to $lastshoulder - $shoulders>> : set hip width <<set $hips to 28>> /% nothing special %/ : set voice <<set $lownote to 50 - Math.floor($masc / 5)>> <<endif>> SET NEW BODY SCORE The Body Score is an amalgam rating of how transformed you are. It is used to track in a general way whether you look very different from the last time an NPC saw you. <<if $sex == "male">> <<set $bodyscore to $masc + $cocksizebonus + $mheightbonus + $mstrengthbonus + $shoulderbonus>> <<elseif $sex == "female">> <<set $bodyscore to $fem + $cupsizebonus + $fheightbonus + $fstrengthbonus + $hipbonus>> <<set $bodyscore to $bodyscore * -1>> <<endif>> <<set $lastmasc to $masc>> <<set $lastfem to $fem>> SCOOP UP ANY LAST UP AND FUP <<set $minc += $mup>> <<set $finc += $fup>> <<set $masc += $minc>> <<set $fem += $finc>> <<set $minc to 0>> <<set $finc to 0>> <<set $mup to 0>> <<set $fup to 0>> <<set $htdiff to $lastheight - $ht>> <<set $strengthdiff to $laststrength - $strength>> <<set $cupdiff to $lastcup - $cupsize>> <<set $cockdiff to $lastcock - $cocksize>> <<set $lownotediff to $lastlownote - $lownote>> <<set $updated to -1>> /% Update has run today. %/ <<set $totaltgs += 1>> <<endsilently>>\<<if $page == 0>><div class="indent">You stuff a sock into your trousers. It doesn't look exactly right, even when it's balled up. You try pushing one sock inside another, and that's a little better, but still not quite right.</div> <div class="indent">Getting the sock to stay in place is a little harder. It keeps wanting to drift this way and that as you walk. That problem is solved by tying the sock to your underwear with a rubber band.</div> <div class="indent">It works. For now.</div> <<set $seeing to [3]>><<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">You stuff some toilet paper into your A-cup bra. It doesn't take much to fill out the cups. It doesn't look exactly right, and it takes some rearranging so the shape is correct.</div> <div class="indent">You can't decide whether you're glad your boobs are still so small, or whether you're disappointed in your lack of development. On the one hand, it makes it much easier to pull off the right look. On the other hand, all the other girls at your high school have developed much more than you have. Now you have nothing at all, and you're not sure how to feel about that.</div> <<set $seeing to [3]>><<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 2>><div class="indent">"Where are we going to get a uniform?" you ask, as Mom climbs into the Packard and starts the engine. "I thought we bought uniforms out of a catalog."</div> <div class="indent">"Normally, yes, but there isn't time." Mom pulls out of the driveway and heads in the direction of downtown. "We're going to stop by the thrift store to see if anybody has any second-hand uniforms that fit."</div> <div class="indent">The neighborhood Goodwill store is large and satisfyingly empty of people when you arrive, and the shelves are stuffed with donated merchandise. You remember it from years past as a bustle of activity, with crowds of shoppers picking over bare shelves, but perhaps that was just because of the Depression and the war years that followed. Your mother, never one to pass up a bargain, and not too proud to poke her nose in the door to find one, drags you straight for the children's clothing section, while you try to cover your face in case anybody is looking.</div> <<if $sex == "male">><div class="indent">"There, you see?" Mom says, plucking a few uniform shirts from the rack and hanging them to one side. "We did find a few that might fit. Good thing we came by early."</div> <div class="indent">You suspect these shirts would still have been available at a more reasonable hour, but there's no point. Once Mom has convinced herself that she found a bargain, she'll twist an arm patting herself on the back for it.</div> <div class="indent">"And trousers, too!" she says, flipping through hanger after hanger of identical beige slacks. "This one's frayed. No, this one has an ink stain on the pocket. Some boy tried to keep a pen in his pocket, no doubt. Oh, this one's good — a little long," she says thoughtfully, holding them up to your waist. "I can take those in. Oh, and look, this one's very cheap. We should get both. You never know."</div> <div class="indent">"Do I have to wear a boy's uniform?" you ask.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">"There, you see?" Mom says, plucking a few sea-green dresses from the rack and hanging them to one side. The skirts look awfully short to you. "We did find a few that might fit. Good thing we came by early."</div> <div class="indent">You suspect these dresses would still have been available at a more reasonable hour, but there's no point. Once Mom has convinced herself that she found a bargain, she'll twist an arm patting herself on the back for it.</div> <div class="indent">"This one's nice," she says, flipping through hanger after hanger of identical dresses. "This one's starting to fray at the pockets, do you see? This one's got the wrong button — I can fix that. Oh, that's too small for you," she says thoughtfully, holding it up against your body. "Oh, but it's very cheap. I'll get both. I might be able to take it out a little, you never know."</div> <div class="indent">"Do I have to wear a girl's uniform?" you ask.</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">"Shush, keep your voice down," she says. "And yes. Now come on, let's go try these on, and I'll see if they have hats and scarves."</div> <div class="indent">After an embarrassing half an hour at the Goodwill, you emerge with a new uniform tucked discreetly into a paper shopping bag. On the ride home, you find yourself sincerely hoping that nobody recognized you.</div> <<set $seeing to [3]>><<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\SCHOOL CURRICULUM The attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941 interrupted a decades-long progressive education movement emphasizing science, engineering, and math, and which focused on critical analysis of American institutions. After Pearl Harbor, when fear and paranoia set in, such progressive notions were scrapped in favor of the "lifestyle adjustment curriculum." This was designed to teach life skills to the 60% of students who would not go on to post-secondary education. About 30% of students would graduate, and there were plenty of jobs available for this level of education. It proposed to teach American students to be good, patriotic (and pliable) citizens, claiming that the old progressive education taught children to be materialistic and gave them bankrupt morals. The "lifestyle" curriculum was criticized (at the time, and also later) for being too soft and non-academic, emphasizing daily life skills (like literacy) over rigorous study (like understanding and questioning what you read). Part of the reason for this focus was a renewed interest in integrating American education with national defense priorities. While recruiting soldiers for World War II, the Army had to reject hundreds of thousands of applicants for being illiterate. They also discovered how disorganized and non-standardized the curriculum could be across various states; the quality of education varied widely. There was also a shortage of people skilled in modern foreign languages. Homework was fairly unknown, especially at lower age levels; most high school students had less than 2 hours per evening. When the Soviets launched Sputnik in 1957 it forced a massive re-think of education in America vis-a-vis national defense priorities, and the burden of nightly homework began to ramp skyward. Courses: reading, grammar, written and mental arithmetic, social studies, science, family life, hygiene, health, religion, speech. Geography (maps), languages, gym, home economics, biology, shop ("industrial arts"). Photography. There would also be an emphasis on geography (especially map familiarity). Biology and home ec courses would start to teach first aid and nursing. During the war, schools would hold drives for paper and scrap metal. Intra-varsity athletics were emphasized, along with calisthenics drills, to increase student health in the event of national need. Social Studies courses focused on problems that related directly to national welfare -- unlike before the war, when the courses focused on critical problems within the US. (Our player in 1948 would have seen both of these techniques.) https://scholarworks.gsu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1074&context=mse_facpub Sample report card, 10th grade: art, gym, geometry?, study, world history, English, biology Sample report card, 12th grade: art, English, stenography, P.D.?, bookkeeping II, Law, Health-Gym-Study-Gym-Study Sample report card, 10th grade: English II, stenography I, Typing II, Bhp? Bkp? (could be Bookkeeping), Biology, Health Sample report card, 12th grade (1953-54): English, History PD, Health, Phys Ed., Chemistry, Spanish 2, Vocal Music Sample report card, gr unk (1943-44): English, typing, stenography, American history, Band, Orchestra, Vocal Music, Gym/Hygiene Sample report card, 12th grade (1944-45): English, Spanish, History, Civics, Economics, Mathematics. Commercial (Bookkeeping). Vocational (blank). BILLY: English, Health/Gym, History, Geometry, Vocal Music, Spanish, Home Economics BETTY: English, Health/Gym, Stenography, Bookkeeping, Vocal Music, Spanish, Home Economics Note: up until 1970 or so, it was common for boys to swim naked in gym class; suits "of the simplest type" were mandatory for girls. This is a fascinating sidelight into education in the 1940s, so I'll use it. <<set $classing to 0>><<if $day == 2>><<set $newknowns to [45]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">Your first class of the day is English with Mrs Hull, who takes your name during roll call ($name <<textbox "$lastname" $lastname>>) without batting an eye. She starts everybody off with a copy of //As You Like It//, and explains about the assignment that will be due in one week's time.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">"You will select some suitable classmates," Mrs Hull says in that precise, mannered way of hers, "and perform for the class a short scene from the play. Get out your pencils, and I will read you the list of approved scenes."</div> <div class="indent">Everyone in the class dutifully copies down the list.</div> <div class="indent">"Each scene may be performed by only one group," Mrs Hull continues. "That way, we will cover most of the important parts of the play. You may find that there are more parts for men than for women. If that is the case, and your group does not have enough boys, girls are permitted to read the boys' parts, or boys to read girls' parts, if it must come to that."</div> <div class="indent">Around you, your classmates exchange embarrassed titters. Nobody wants to be //that// unfortunate soul, who has to read a part for the opposite sex. They have //no// idea what that would be really like, you decide.</div> <<if $startsex == "male">>--<<link "go to Gym" "1948 Gym">><</link>><<else>>--<<link "go to Stenography" "1948 Stenography">><</link>><<endif>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true>><div class="indent">When you first walk into class, nobody seems to notice anything unusual. You find your assigned desk and set your books down, then slip into the attached wooden chair. <<if $sex == "female">>//Knees together, knees together,// you remind yourself,<<else>>//Don't forget to unbutton the blazer,// you remind yourself,<<endif>> remembering the way Mrs Decker had admonished you earlier.</div> <div class="indent">Then, naturally, $eng has to go and announce your presence to the entire class, and your anonymity is gone forever.</div> <div class="indent">"I require your attention, class," $eng says coolly. "Endeavor to calm yourselves." She adjusts her spectacles and peers at a note on her clipboard. "I understand we have a student in our class who has come down with ... a peculiar condition. If you have not been assiduously following the news, you may be unaware of it, but we now have a student among us who is afflicted by it, so we must strive to treat the situation with grace.</div> <div class="indent">She gestures toward you. "$name $lastname, as you can see, has contracted a condition that has caused $acc[$oppgen] to become a $girlboy[$soppgen]. It is a rare disease that is not yet fully understood, but it is not, as far as we know, contagious, so there is no imminent peril that any of //you// will contract it also."</div> <div class="indent">An interested murmur goes around the class as people inspect you carefully.</div> <div class="indent">"You must understand that this is a medical syndrome," $eng continues in that cool, detached way of hers. "This is neither $poss[$oppgen] fault, nor should we assume it is $poss[$oppgen] choice. The rest of us must therefore be as accommodating as we can. Meanwhile, $currname is expected to adhere to all the usual rules and dress codes as any other $girlboy[$gen] in the school. Is that clear?"</div> <div class="indent">Her look is so stern and unforgiving that it is a few moments before any student dares raise their hand. One girl says, "Is $nom[$gen] going to be reading a boy's part or a girl's part?"</div> <div class="indent">"A $girlboy[$gen]'s part, of course," $eng says, "just the same as anyone else. Unless there are not enough $girlsboys[$oppgen] to go around. Now, in reference to your assignment: you will be forming reading groups on Friday, so start thinking about whom you would select to partner with..." and she's off the subject of your strange transformation and onto ordinary class business.</div> <<elseif $newid == true>><div class="indent">When you first walk into class, nobody seems to notice anything unusual. You find your assigned desk and set your books down, then slip into the attached wooden chair. <<if $sex == "female">>//Knees together, knees together,// you remind yourself,<<else>>//Don't forget to unbutton the blazer,// you remind yourself,<<endif>> remembering the way Mrs Decker had admonished you earlier.</div> <div class="indent">Then, naturally, $eng has to go and announce your presence to the entire class.</div> <div class="indent">"I require your attention, class," $eng says coolly. "Endeavor to calm yourselves." She adjusts her spectacles and peers at a note on her clipboard. "We have a new student among us. Please welcome $currname $lastname. Oh, <<if $sex == "male">>Mr<<else>>Miss<<endif>> $lastname, that seat is already assigned to your cousin $name. If you would like to take a seat there near the window, that would be better. Thank you."</div> <div class="indent">You have to shuffle your books and things to the other desk. Of //course// that's not your seat any more. You should have remembered.</div> <div class="indent">"You wouldn't happen to know where $name is today, would you?" $eng asks, checking her roll list.</div> <div class="indent">"No, ma'am, I don't," you say, as truthfully as you can.</div> <div class="indent">"Very well. I assume you do not object to taking $poss[$oppgen] homework to $acc[$oppgen]."</div> <div class="indent">"No, ma'am."</div> <div class="indent">"Good. You will find a copy of //As You Like It// on the table in the back of class. Please select one and return to your seat. Before we get to the assigned reading, class, let's discuss your reading groups. Your groups will be signing up for your scene selection on Friday, so begin thinking about whom you would like to partner with..."</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">You slip into class without drawing any attention to yourself. Nobody seems to notice anything unusual. They all still seem to think you're just an ordinary $girlboy[$oppgen].</div> <div class="indent">$eng takes roll, looking over all the students' faces in their assigned seats and trying to recall each name. When she comes to you, she pauses before recalling your name.</div> <div class="indent">//She didn't notice anything, did she?// you wonder. //How could she? I'm the same as I was yesterday, right?//</div> <div class="indent">Then she's speaking. "I require your attention, class. Endeavor to calm yourselves. Before we begin with the assigned reading from last night, permit me to remind you that your groups will be signing up for your scene selections on Friday. Now is the time to begin thinking about whom you would like to partner with..."</div> <div class="indent">//Whew. I guess it was nothing.//</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self again. Technically, this is IMPOSSIBLE on Day 3. If this comes up, it is an error.) <<endif>>\ <<set $newknowns to [8, 23, 27]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">She then turns to the first act of the play. "You may have had some difficulty at first with Shakespeare's use of language and meter," she explains, "but I assure you that, with sufficient practice, it will become almost second nature to you. Now: who can tell me the two main characters of Act One?"</div> <div class="indent">"Orlando?" asks Doris Thacker, a cute brunette in glasses.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, Orlando is one," $eng replies. "Orlando has been ill-treated at the hands of his cruel brother, Oliver, who has denied Orlando the education and privilege accorded to him by rank. Who is the other central character?"</div> <div class="indent">"Oliver?" guesses Harold Giles, one of the boys who is usually found on the baseball field.</div> <div class="indent">"No, not Oliver. Alice, do you know?"</div> <div class="indent">Alice Whitfield puts her hand down, folding it in front of her. "The other main character is Rosalind," she says. "Rosalind and Orlando are the central romantic figures. They meet at first and fall in love, but then later on Rosalind is disguised as a boy." She looks a little smug. "I did this play over the summer so I know it really well. I played Celia."</div> <div class="indent">"Very good, Alice," $eng says. <<if $openzeta == true>>"You might notice that this particular play resonates with <<if $sex == "male">>Mr<<else>>Miss<<endif>> $lastname's situation, where a female character is disguised as a male character.<<else>>"You may find it unusual that the author chose to have a female character disguised as a male character.<<endif>> This was actually a common element of Shakespeare's plays, because ... why? Maybe later.<<endif>></div> <<endif>>\ <<display "NextClassLink">><<if $sex == "male">><<set $mact.push("workout")>><<set $mstrengthbonus += 3>><<set $shoulderbonus += 1>><<endif>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 10>><div class="indent">Midway through learning about the backstroke, $thisgym announces that next Friday there will be an important quiz. "It's all about water safety," $nom[$gen] says. "Starting on Monday we will be going over the Silvester method for artificial respiration. We will be going over the Holger-Nielsen method. We will be going over the use of lifesavers //are you paying attention, <<if $sex == "female">>Miss Murphy? I thought so.<<else>>Turner? Eyes front.<<endif>>// These are things that can save your life, or save the life of another, if you find yourself going into the water."</div> <div class="indent">Still, there's enough time left in class to get good and tired of doing the backstroke. At least with your head half-submerged, you don't have to hear anybody talking about Dimorphic Zeta Chromosome Syndrome.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">><<if $sex == "male">><<set $mact.push("workout")>><<set $mstrengthbonus += 3>><<set $shoulderbonus += 1>><<endif>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 11>><<if $path.includes("emergency TG")>><div class="indent">You get a distinct sense of //deja vu// as you return to the swimming pool, this time dressed as a $girlboy[$gen].</div> <div class="indent">It's diving lessons. You are hardly surprised.</div> <div class="indent">$thisgym lines everybody up by the diving board. You yawn.</div> <div class="indent">A couple of the girls in the class give you strange looks, as if they can't figure out how come you've developed so suddenly over the past week. You smile at them and wave back -- you're not about to tell them your secret.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<elseif $path.includes("SO emergency date") or $path.includes("friend emergency date")>><div class="indent">You can't stop thinking about stolen kisses in the hallway.</div> <div class="indent">Gym class starts with a brief introduction to diving safety: how to enter the water, how to come back up, how to keep water out of your nose. $thisgym lines everybody up at the diving board and settles in to a lifeguard's chair to evaluate your form.</div> <div class="indent">Still, you can't clear your head. You have kisses on the brain. And you can feel your body start to warm up. Even though you're standing <<if $sex == "male">>naked<<else>>in a flimsy see-through swimsuit<<endif>> in a chilly indoor swimming area, you still feel like someone has built a glorious fire inside you.</div> <div class="indent">//Oh jeez, not here!// you think. //If I transform here, right now...//</div> <div class="indent">Desperately, you wave to the gym teacher. "Sick," you blurt out, holding your stomach. "Gotta go to the nurse."</div> <div class="indent">$thisgym glowers at you, but points toward the exit. "Go! Don't you do anything in my pool."</div> <div class="indent">You rush for the safety of the locker room, bare feet slapping on the wet tiles.</div> <div class="indent">The heat keeps generating inside of you, and you can't make it subside. You feel like your body is blazing, and your head seems to be cracking in half.</div> <div class="indent">"No no no," you chatter to yourself, bent double in front of your locker. //Gotta get dressed. Can't change yet.//</div> <div class="indent">But you //are// changing, and you have to get somewhere safe. You grab your lumped-up clothes out of your locker. Maybe you could get as far as the bathroom area and lock yourself into one of the stalls.</div> --<<link "run to the bathroom" "1948 Solo">><<set $page to 11>><</link>> <<display "SexSwitch">> <<else>><div class="indent">Today, the class begins a course on diving safety. This means a lot of standing around <<if $sex == "male">>naked,<<else>>in those flimsy, see-through suits,<<endif>> waiting in line for the diving board, while the gym teacher evaluates everyone's form.</div> <div class="indent">You're not sure what the point is. Of all the valuable things you //could// be learning about right now — like how to cure a mysterious virus so your life isn't turned upside down — you don't imagine that diving would rank very high on any list. At least, no list that you can think of.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>><<endif>>\<<set $classing to 2>><<if $day == 2>><<set $newknowns to [37]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">History class passes uneventfully, which is a relief. $hist passes out textbooks — they're all brand new, and all have patriotic flags imprinted in black on the canvas covers.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">"We have new textbooks this year," $hist announces. He's a rumpled-looking man with a brown blazer that has patches on the elbows. "We want to make sure all of our students have a firm grounding in American history, and that we all understand what a unique and special country this is."</div> <div class="indent">It strikes you as a little strange. You remember your teachers in previous history classes weren't afraid to criticize social issues in America. This textbook seems filled with nothing but abject praise for everything about America, and no mention of any issues or problems that might need improvement. (<<link "footnote 4" "1948 Footnotes">><<set $page to 4>><</link>>)</div> <div class="indent">$hist's reasoning soon becomes clear. "The government wants to make certain that we all know what it takes to be good citizens, in light of the Communist threat which stretches around the world," he says. "That means Congress is taking a much greater interest in any possible Communist threats to our way of life, including how we teach subjects like this one. We can't be too careful. Now, this might be a little different from history classes you have taken in the past--" he coughs nervously-- "but if any of you has any questions, feel free to see me after class."</div> <div class="indent">At least nobody says anything about the way you look.</div> --<<link "go to Vocal Music" "1948 Vocal Music">><</link>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true>><<set $newknowns to [37]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">$hist is a rumpled-looking man with a brown blazer that has patches on the elbows. He doesn't make any kind of announcement either, which you hope is the beginning of a trend. He simply says, "Mr $lastname, since you weren't in class yesterday, would you please get a textbook from the cupboard to the left of the chalkboard?" and that's it.</div> <<elseif $newid == true>><<set $newknowns to [37]>><div class="indent">$hist is a rumpled-looking man with a brown blazer that has patches on the elbows. He doesn't draw any undue attention your way either, which you hope is the beginning of a trend. He simply says, "Mr $lastname, since you weren't in class yesterday, would you please get a textbook from the cupboard to the left of the chalkboard?" and that's it.</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">$hist starts class by droning through roll call, checking off names. He passes by your name without any comment. You can't help but feel you've escaped again.</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self. This is impossible on Day 3. If this shows up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">For the remainder of class, $hist delivers a lecture covering a thousand years of history covering the whole of Egypt, and then has the class answer questions at the end of the chapter. "We're only covering Egypt and the Arab lands during this first week," he says. "Next week we'll move on to the Greeks and Romans, if we get to it."</div> <div class="indent">You look down at your notes. The flooding of the Nile, pharaohs, gods. Agriculture. Geometry. Building. And lots of personal opinions given by $hist about how much better America does these things, thanks to the early efforts of faraway people. It's a bit of a one-sided look, if you're being honest with yourself. It's a very //American// perspective.</div> <div class="indent">You never thought so much about the value of having a new perspective before.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">All throughout History class, $hist drones on and on about the Egyptians, and you start to lose track of all the names. Akhenaten. Ramses. Hatshepsut. Tutankhamun. Nefertiti (a name that makes the boys in the class giggle).</div> <div class="indent">You listen <<if $secret == true and $sex == "female">>in mounting dread, thinking of the look of glee on Gerald Myers' face as he pointed at your dickless trousers. This won't be good.<<elseif $path.includes("SO date") and $sex == "male">>with one ear, thinking of your date with $so tonight. What will you wear? Will $so still want to make out with you? //Will it work?//<<else>>with one ear, doodling pyramids on the edge of your note paper.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">The clock ticks by with maddeningly measured strokes.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 8>><<if $openzeta == true or $newid == true or $secret == true>><div class="indent">True to his word, $hist starts lecturing on the Greeks today, starting with a brief discussion of the Hittites, the early Iron Age, and the Mycenaeans, and concluding with the alphabet and the introduction of democracy. It's a whirlwind.</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>><div class="indent">$hist launches into a new lecture about the Greeks today, covering so many topics in the hour that it makes your head spin. Something about the Iron Age, and some people who came before the Greeks, and some other stuff, and then the alphabet. Or something. Last thing you knew was the Egyptians. You've been keeping up on the reading, but it's hard to make it all stick when you're out of class so much.</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">You have //got// to find time to study your history more.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 9>><div class="indent">$hist moves on to the Romans today. His lecture moves so quickly you can't keep up with it. The Roman kingdom — no, the Roman Republic — wait, now it's an Empire. All these terms float past you: tribunes, consuls, dictators, senators.</div> <div class="indent">You copy everything down like mad, hoping that it'll make sense later when you do your reading.</div> <div class="indent">The only respite from the lecture is when two students from the Journalism department drop off a stack of freshly-printed school newspapers in the back of the room. <<if $path.includes("open school interview") or $path.includes("anonymous school interview")>>You make a note to pick one up on your way to Vocal Music. It should have your interview in it.<<else>>You debate for a moment about picking one up on your way to Vocal Music, but the moment of distraction makes you miss $hist teaching about Caesar Augustus. You have to scribble quickly to catch up.<<endif>></div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>> <<if $day == 10>><div class="indent">Today is review day in history class, where $hist goes over everything that will be on the test on Friday.</div> <div class="indent">For most of the class period, $hist is writing down various subjects on the board that he says "might" appear on the test. "You never know," he says. "Anything on this board might appear on the test, so be sure to study carefully."</div> <<if $path.includes("open school interview")>><div class="indent">During the review, he calls on various students to go to the board and copy down their notes on a given topic. Apparently your story in the newspaper is still circulating.</div> <<else>><div class="indent"><div class="indent">During the review, he calls on various students to go to the board and copy down their notes on a given topic. You haven't spent as much time studying as you should, because of everything you've had to deal with, but you feel very confident.<<else>>You arrive in class, remembering with a sense of dread that you have an exam today. You have tried to spend more time studying, and you feel like you've done your best, but you still aren't sure how it's going to go.<<endif>> $hist closes the door to the hallway and passes out tests as soon as everyone is seated.</div> <div class="indent">For the next forty-five minutes, you sweat over the exam, trying to keep your pharaohs and your tyrants and your tribunes straight. Akhenaten was fourteenth century -- but did that mean the 1300s or the 1400s? What did he have in common with Constantine, anyway?</div> <div class="indent">At last the exam is over. Another class period has slipped away.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\<<set $classing to 8>><<if $day == 2>><<set $newknowns to [40]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">The first day of stenography class is pretty dull. You're bundled into a stuffy, warm classroom with a crowd of other girls — it's hard not to think of them as //other// girls, in spite of what has happened to you — to listen to $steno, a boring old woman with a droning voice that makes you want to fall asleep. She spends most of the first class babbling on about how useful stenography is.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">"Many of you girls will go on to become secretaries," she says. "Or you might work for someone important, like a doctor or a lawyer, where note-taking is very useful. Even if you don't go on to a career of your own, you will find stenography is very valuable for taking notes over a telephone, because shorthand enables you to write very quickly so you don't miss anything."</div> <div class="indent">//Maybe I won't become a secretary,// you think to yourself, trying to ignore the cock you're carrying under several concealing layers of fabric. //Not with one of __these.__ I could be the doctor or the lawyer, I bet.//</div> --<<link "go to Gym" "1948 Gym">><</link>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true>><<set $newknowns to [40]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">$steno is a boring old woman in a boring old dress with an //extremely// monotonous voice. She seems to think you're a //new// student, rather than a transformed one. She introduces you to the other girls in class with an unfocused, genial kind of smile, and then drifts vaguely into an explanation of the first chapter of the book: proper posture.</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">$steno takes roll in her usual boring fashion, reading from her roll list with a kind of dreamy, semi-concussed quaver. Then she drifts vaguely into her explanation of the first chapter of the book: proper posture.</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self again. This is impossible on Day 3. If this pops up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <<set $newknowns to [7, 26, 13]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">"I have always found," $steno says, seating herself with dignity and crossing her legs, "that the ideal table for stenography is one's own knee. Cross your legs at the knee, and place your steno pad, thus. Now your hand is in the proper position to write, but your view of the proceedings is unobstructed. Try it."</div> <div class="indent">You and the girls attempt to mimic $steno's posture, placing your writing pads properly and holding the pencil poised just so. <<if $sex == "male">>Your balls feel crushed between your legs, and your hips feel a little stiff, but you manage to approximate the correst posture.<<else>>You feel a little strange with your legs crossed, because it's so //easy.// There's nothing in the way. And your hips are wider, and your thighs thinner, so you get a better angle. It's actually quite comfortable.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"Very good, girls," she says to all of you, moving around the room. "Miss Morris, straighten your skirt, it's bunched up. Excellent form, Miss Watson. Miss Foster, don't hunch over, it's unladylike."</div> <div class="indent">"But I can't see the page," says one young woman. She doesn't say it, but everybody is thinking it: her boobs are in the way.</div> <div class="indent">"You don't need to see the page, Miss Foster," $steno says. "That is the whole point of stenography. You watch what is happening, and feel your way across the page with your hand. Even if a lady has a larger chest than other girls, that shouldn't be any kind of hindrance at all. There! You look like a perfect little steno pool. Let's begin with the first letters of the alphabet: S, F and V. In shorthand, these look very similar to one another."</div> <div class="indent">She proceeds to demonstrate the shorthand for safe, face, save, faces, and saves on the chalkboard. They look almost exactly the same.</div> <div class="indent">//Just like me,// you think. //Almost exactly the same, but not quite.//</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">All throughout Stenography class, $steno drones on and on about the phonetic spelling of words with your whole //seven// letters — S, F, V, A, E, N, and M. You start to lose track of the different squiggles. Straight lines, long lines, shorter lines, vertical, horizontal. Big loops, smaller loops. It's all a mess on the chalkboard.</div> <div class="indent">You listen <<if $secret == true and $sex == "male">>alertly for any signs that people are talking about you, but you hear nothing.<<elseif $path.includes("SO date") and $sex == "female">>with one ear, thinking of your date with $so tonight. What will you wear? Will $so still want to make out with you? //Will it work?//<<else>>with one ear, writing hurtful comments about $steno's unstylish dress on the edge of your note paper.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">The clock ticks by with maddeningly measured strokes.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 8>><div class="indent">The first thing $steno says to the class is that there will be a surprise quiz sometime during the week.</div> <div class="indent">Jean Morris raises her hand and asks, "But then it isn't a surprise."</div> <div class="indent">$steno contemplates this for a moment, then says, "Would you rather I did not announce them?"</div> <div class="indent">"I just wondered why you were calling it a //surprise,//" Jean said. "If you tell us about it, it's not."</div> <div class="indent">"Shut up, shut up," whispers Florence Foster under her breath.</div> <<if $openzeta == true or $newid == true or $secret == true>><div class="indent">The quiz will be dictation practice on the letters you have already learned, which still aren't very solid in your mind. Even her //surprises// are boring.</div> <div class="indent"><<if $startsex == "male">>You find, to your surprise, that you've done fairly well. //I'm pretty good at this,// you think, looking down at the squiggles on the page, over which is $steno's red ink: A minus. //I'd make a really good secretary or something.//<<else>>You find, to your disappointment, that you've done fairly well. //How much time did I spent working on this?// you ask yourself, looking down at the squiggles on the page, over which is $steno's red ink: A minus. //I guess I'm never going to use it, now.//<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">It's a few moments before you realize that you <<if $startsex == "male">>don't //have// to<<else>>//still// might<<endif>> end up a secretary.
