"Girls, I was disappointed by the lack of clarity and precision in your quizzes yesterday, especially when it comes to vowel sounds. Spelling in the Gregg shorthand system is mostly by //sound,// not by the usual rules of spelling." She allows herself a simpering half-smile. "I admit when I first learned shorthand, I was unable to spell worth beans. My English teacher was so vexed with me." She turns to the chalkboard, chalk in hand. "Now write it with me: the E group. //Bit, bet,// and //beet.// If you're not careful, they will start to look very similar and you won't be able to tell them apart."</div> <div class="indent">"Like the Morris girls," says Audrey Price under her breath.</div> <<if $path.includes("open school interview")>><div class="indent">"Or like $name, when $nom[$sgen] comes to school as a $girlboy[$soppgen]," whispers Jean in return.</div><<else>><div class="indent">"Or like those boys who secretly turn into girls, like in the paper," says Alice Whitfield with a grin.</div><<endif>> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 11>><div class="indent"><<if $path.includes("friend emergency date") or $path.includes("SO emergency date")>>You arrive in Stenography a few minutes late, pink in the face and out of breath. It's a lot longer from the weight room to the Business Arts wing than you figured, and most of your would-be travel time was spent making out. Luckily,<<else>>You arrive in Stenography and take your seat.<<endif>> $steno is in the central office of the Business department, talking with one of the other instructors.</div> <div class="indent">After a few moments, she returns to the classroom and begins to lecture on the next letters you're going to learn. The air is filled with her droning, sleep-inducing voice, but this time you're not lulled by it. You spend most of the class period thinking //I can't believe it's Stenography already.//</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\<<set $classing to 3>><<if $day == 2>><<set $newknowns to [41, 15, 16]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">Vocal Music takes place in a large, spacious room built into several levels, so the singers can stand or sit in raked rows. At the lowest part of the room is the conductor's pit, where there is an old Wurlizter piano and a lectern. The chalkboards have been painted with blank musical staves.</div> <div class="indent">Your teacher for Vocal Music is $music, the same instructor you had last year for 9th grade, and the year before that in junior high school. She usually has this bright, frazzled look about her, as if she has too many students and not enough brain power to keep track of it all.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">This year, she seems a little calmer. "I'm so glad to see so many of your lovely faces again this year," she says warmly. "If any of you has a younger brother or sister, you might have heard that the school district has finally hired another music teacher for elementary and junior high, which will leave me more time for all of my high school students."</div> <div class="indent">You remember the teacher shortages of 1946. After the war, there just weren't enough teachers to go around.</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, that's great!" says Henry Murphy, and his sister Irene agrees. "Congratulations, $music."</div> <div class="indent">"Thank you, Henry. The first thing we're going to do is sing the national anthem, and then the school song," she says. "I'll go around the room as you're singing and listen to your voices, because I think some of them might still be changing. Then I can separate you into your proper registers."</div> <div class="indent">Nervously, you seek out $fr and try to stand next to $acc[$oppgen], just in case. $fr gives you a look. You lean over and whisper, "Meet me at lunch?" and $fr nods back.</div> <div class="indent">The lucky thing is, it doesn't sound like your voice has changed much so far. <<if $startsex == "female">>It might be a //little// deeper, but lots of girls' voices dropped at least a tiny bit.<<else>>It might be a //little// higher, but not so much that $music is likely to notice.<<endif>> None of the other students around you mention anything, anyway.</div> --<<link "go to lunch" "CYCLE">><<set $cyc++>><</link>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true>><div class="indent">$music is delighted to call everybody's attention to your condition, and begins the class by gushing about how wonderful it must be to get to sing soprano //and// bass on different days. "Why, if they could put that condition in a bottle, I bet every singer in America would love to choose how to sound each morning!" she says brightly. "We'll just have to see how your voice develops as we go along. I've never heard of anybody that's so lucky to get to choose."</div> <div class="indent">"I //didn't// choose," you try to say, but $music sweeps on past this objection and starts calling roll, separating people into their official vocal registers as she goes.</div> <<elseif $newid == true>><div class="indent">$music is delighted to introduce you to the class as a new student. "I'm sure you're going to have a wonderful time at Renton Comprehensive," she says, unaware that you attended this school last year, too. "I'm going to separate the class into registers, $currname, but just stand over by the piano for now. As soon as we get started, I'll try to place you where you belong." She then starts calling roll, separating people into their official vocal registers as she goes.</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">$music begins the class with your usual brightness and energy, taking roll and sorting people into their official vocal registers as she goes.</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self again. This is impossible on Day 3. If this pops up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">"There we are," she says at last. "Sopranos and altos on the lower levels, tenors above. Basses with the baritones. I'm going to pass out sheet music for our first song, 'America the Beautiful,' which I'm sure you all know. We'll get a good vocal warm-up, and then we're going to sing."</div> <div class="indent">Ever since the war, there's been a lot more patriotic music in schools. You wonder why. Did people suddenly forget what country they were in?</div> <div class="indent">As class ends, $fr nudges you. "I'll see you at lunch, okay?"</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">After three days of singing, your voice hasn't changed in any direction at all. It's still somewhere in the middle range between tenor and alto. You can hit the D below middle C, up through the D above it.</div> <<if $openzeta == true>><div class="indent">"It looks like you're a <<if $sex == "male">>countertenor, which is very much like a contralto in women,<<else>>contralto, which is very much like a countertenor in men,<<endif>> and that's good," $music tells you. "Given your circumstances, I think you're going to choose whether you're more comfortable standing with the girls and singing the alto part, or stand with the boys and sing tenor. It's up to you."</div> --<<link "sing with the girls" "1948 Vocal Music Chat">><<set $path.push("alto")>><<set $page to 0>><</link>> --<<link "sing with the boys" "1948 Vocal Music Chat">><<set $path.push("tenor")>><<set $page to 1>><</link>> <<else>><div class="indent">"Not quite <<if $sex == "male">>a full tenor,"<<else>>in the alto range,"<<endif>> $music says critically after one rehearsal. "I could hear you straining a little. We'll keep working on some exercises to stretch your range. I'm afraid I don't have a contralto or a countertenor harmony part for you, because that would be perfect."</div> <div class="indent">"That's okay," you say. <<if $path.includes("stuffing tease")>>You wish you could just disappear right now. <<if $sex == "male">>After the incident in Pep Squad, it's been a pretty awful day.<<else>>After the incident in Marching Band, it's been a pretty awful day.<<endif>><<else>>"I'll keep working on it."<<endif>></div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $day == 8>><div class="indent">$music starts the class on another patriotic song, enthusiastically accompanying the class on the piano.</div> <<if $lownote gt 50>><<if $path.includes("tenor")>><div class="indent">"Very interesting," $music says as you're singing with the group. "You're gaining some range in the high end, but you're losing some of it down below."</div><<set _feedback to -1>> <<else>><div class="indent">"Good, good!" $music congratulates you as you're singing with the group. "You're stretching your range. I can see you're not straining quite as much on those higher notes. Well done!"</div><<set _feedback to 1>> <<endif>>\ <<elseif $lownote lt 50>><<if $path.includes("tenor")>><div class="indent">"Good, good!" $music congratulates you as you're singing with the group. "You're stretching your range. I can see you're not straining quite as much on those lower notes. Well done!"</div><<set _feedback to 1>> <<else>><div class="indent">"Very interesting!" $music says as you're singing with the group. "You're losing some range on the high and, but you're gaining some of it back in the lower registers."</div><<set _feedback to -1>> <<endif>>\ <<else>><div class="indent">"Keep practicing," $music tells you as you sing with the group. She's <<if _feedback == 1>>praising<<elseif _feedback == -1>>making comments on<<else>>criticizing<<endif>> your voice without even checking to see what shape you are today. She //can't// be that oblivious.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 9>><div class="indent">"Newspapers away, boys and girls," $music says, with a bright and frazzled smile. "I swear, it's the same every time these newspapers come out. We're //singing// now. Has everyone practiced their music from last time? Ready, and--"</div> <div class="indent">But even the most ardent music-loving professor couldn't keep students from sneaking looks into the newspaper. When her eyes went to the piano in front of her, copies of //The Aerie// came out from underneath sheet music.</div> <div class="indent">You can hear the whispering: there's a committee forming for the Homecoming dance; the football team is playing its first game in a week; Miss Lester, the science teacher, is getting married; the girls' toilet on the south side of the school is being fixed, and someone thought they heard someone mention that the janitor it was because of too many cigarette butts. <<if $openzeta == true>>And there are some whispers about //you.//<<elseif $path.includes("known zeta")>>And there are some whispers about a special student in the school who is sometimes a girl and sometimes a boy, and you wonder if someone in the principal's office ratted you out.<<else>>Then you hear someone whisper about a special student in the school who is sometimes a girl and sometimes a boy, and you start to get a sick feeling in your stomach.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">$music's ears were better than her eyes. "Newspapers away, I said, I can hear the pages rustling," she announces without missing a beat on the piano. "And that should have been an F sharp, Miss Lewis, not an F natural."</div> <div class="indent">$fr nudges you. "Did you hear that?" $nom[$fgen] whispers.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, of course."</div> <div class="indent">"Have you read the article yet?"</div> <div class="indent">"No, I haven't had time."</div> <div class="indent">"I have a copy," $fr says. Over by the back doors of the gym."</div> <div class="indent"><<if $bent == "forthright">>"Why so secret?"<<else>>"Why there?"<<endif>></div> <div class="indent"><<if $path.includes("open school interview") or $path.includes("anonymous school interview")>>"I want to talk about the article, and if everybody sees you in the cafeteria, they'll crowd around."<<else>>"I want to talk about the article without anybody listening. Maybe somebody found out about you."<<endif>></div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 10>><div class="indent">Nobody brings up the article in //The Aerie// today, at least not out loud. But you can still hear the word //zeta// being whispered in the ranks. Someone in the bass section mentions the word a couple of times, pointing over toward the sopranos. In between songs, you can see someone re-reading the article, with her friend looking over one shoulder.</div> <div class="indent">Maybe you'll get lucky, and everyone will be tired of the news before next week's newspaper rolls out.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 11>><<if $path.includes("emergency makeout")>><<if $openzeta == true>><div class="indent">You walk into Vocal Music to some amused and interested looks — some smiling, some shocked — as you take your place on the risers.</div> <div class="indent">"Don't //you// look different today!" says Jane Morris, clapping her hands in glee. "Did it happen again?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes," you admit. "Not too long ago."</div> <div class="indent">Jane and Irene Murphy come over to check out your changes. <<if $sex == "male">>"You look good," Jane says, looking you over. "I like your tie. It's so cute when you wear a tie."<<else>>"You look good," Jane says, looking you over. "That's a nice dress. Is it new? It looks good on you."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"Yes, looking good," $fr says, giving you a quick grin. <<if $path.includes("friend emergency date")>>"I guess you worked it out after all."<<else>>"A little different from the last time I saw you."<<endif>></div> <<else>><div class="indent">You walk into Vocal Music and unobtrusively take your place on the risers. As she sits at the piano, she calls out instructions: "Stand up straight!" or "Sing from the diaphragm!" or "Very good, Henry!"</div> <<if $path.includes("alto")>><div class="indent">At one point, she calls to you, <<if $lownote lte 48>>"I think you should consider moving over with the tenors, $name! Your voice is lower today."<<elseif $lownote lte 48>>"Good work on your range, $name! Your voice is higher today!"<<else>>"Keep working on that range, $name!"<<endif>></div><<endif>> <div class="indent">If only that were your biggest problem.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\<<set $classing to 4>><<if $day == 2>><<set $newknowns to [39]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">Spanish class with $span is right after lunch, and all the students file into the classroom with a festive, first-day exuberance. They've met all their old friends at the cafeteria, just like you and $fr did, and they're not quite ready to go back to learning.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">$span gets everybody started with some basic introductions in Spanish, and you and your classmates are chatting again. You pair up with $fr, who agreed to take this class with you so you could speak Spanish together.</div> <div class="indent">"¡Hola!" you say to $fr, trying on your Spanish pronunciation. "Me llamo $name."</div> <div class="indent">"Mucho gusto," $nom[$oppgen] says back. "Me llamo $fr."</div> <div class="indent"><<if $startsex == "male">>"Encantada,"<<else>>"Encantado,"<<endif>> you reply politely.</div> <div class="indent">$span is nearby and happens to hear. It means you're male.<<else>>//encantada//, with an A. It means you're female.<<endif>> Now try again."</div> <div class="indent">"That was close," $fr murmurs to you as $span walks away.</div> <div class="indent">Blushing bright pink, you correct yourself. How could you have gotten that mixed up, today of all days? You're //definitely// a <<if $startsex == "male">>boy.<<else>>girl.<<endif>> Definitely.</div> <div class="indent">Right?</div> <<if $startsex == "male">>--<<link "go to Geometry" "1948 Geometry">><</link>><<else>>--<<link "go to Bookkeeping" "1948 Bookkeeping">><</link>><<endif>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true>><div class="indent">By the time lunch is over and Spanish class rolls around, half the school has already heard a rumor about your strange condition. Your classmates are buzzing with talk, and you hear your name mentioned in every corner of the room.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes," $span says loudly, cutting through the chatter. <<if $sex == "male">>Señorita $lastname ... or should I say, Señor $lastname<<else>>Señor $lastname ... or should I say, Señorita $lastname<<endif>> has contracted an unusual condition, but we will not take up any class time gossiping about it, is that understood? Now: please find your partner from yesterday and review your greetings and introductions."</div> <<elseif $newid == true>><div class="indent">By the time lunch is over and Spanish class rolls around, half the school has already heard about the new student in their midst.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes," $span says loudly, cutting through the chatter. "All right, quiet down," $span says loudly, cutting through the chatter. Let's not waste valuable class time getting settled in our seats. Find your partner from yesterday and work on your greetings and introductions."</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self again. This is impossible on Day 3. If this pops up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">You huddle with $fr again, finding a quiet corner of the class where you won't be overheard. Keeping an eye on $span, who is roving around the room listening to students practice, you murmur to $fr, "It's still going on. You know, the ... the thing."</div> <div class="indent">$fr nods at you. "You know, I've been thinking," $nom[$fgen] says. "You said you were necking with $so the night before? And you had a ... a night dream about S-E-X?"</div> <div class="indent">"It didn't go that far," you whisper.</div> <div class="indent">"Then maybe what you have to do is repeat the experiment," $fr says. "Do it again. Invite $so over and make out. See what happens."</div> <div class="indent"><<if $sex == "female">>"But $so and I have made out loads of times before.<<else>>"But $so and I have made out before. I mean, not //loads// of times, but we're not //brand new// at it.<<endif>> And I've had dreams like that before and nothing like this ever happened."</div> <div class="indent">"Maybe not," $fr says. "But in my Biology class--" $nomcap[$fgen] breaks off suddenly and switches to Spanish as $span wanders by, listening. When she's gone, $fr leans in again. "It got me thinking. Maybe this is a stage of development or something. This didn't happen before because you weren't //ready.//"</div> <div class="indent">"I'm not ready //now,//" you point out. "Besides, this is just some temporary disease. I must have caught it somewhere."</div> <div class="indent">"There's one way to test it," $fr says with a nervous smile. "If you and I make out, maybe you'll have another dream and flip back to normal. If it doesn't work, then it's probably something you caught."</div> <div class="indent">"But what if you catch it?"</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, I don't think so," is $fr's breezy reply. "Look at the facts. $so hasn't changed, right?"</div> <div class="indent"><<if $openzeta == true>>"No, I saw $acc[$sogen] today."<<else>>"No, not that I ever noticed."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"There you go. You would have noticed. So that's all you have to do."</div> <div class="indent">"Look at you, you're a regular detective."</div> <div class="indent">$fr grins. "Yes, we're a regular Nick and Nora Charles. Like from that movie, //The Thin Man.//"</div> <div class="indent">"Except <<if $sex == "male">>you get to be Myrna Loy, and I'm stuck being William Powell,"<<else>>you get to be William Powell, and I'm stuck being Myrna Loy,"<<endif>> you grumble.</div> <div class="indent">"Well, think about it," $fr urges you quietly. "Let me know what you decide. We could try tomorrow night. My old man won't be home. Or maybe it should be you and $so, to really recreate the event."</div> <div class="indent">"Yeah," you say. "If $nom[$sogen]'ll even let me."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">There's a pop quiz in Spanish about greetings and introductions, and a brief lecture on the new vocabulary for next week's chapter, so you don't get much of a chance to talk to $fr until halfway through class.</div> <<if $path.includes("friend date")>><div class="indent">"Are we still on for tonight?" $nom[$fgen] asks quietly, leaning in.</div> <div class="indent">"Definitely," you say. "If I could write a story about your condition — everybody's talking about it, it's all over the school — maybe that would be a story people would want to read about."</div><<set $page to 0>> --<<link "agree to an interview" "1948 Spanish Chat">><<set $path.push("open school interview")>><<set $forthright += 10>><</link>> <<if $secretive gt 0>>--<<link "agree to an anonymous interview" "1948 Spanish Chat">><<set $path.push("anonymous school interview")>><<set $secretive += 10>><</link>> <<endif>><<if $ashamed gt 0>>--<<link "angrily decline an interview" "1948 Spanish Chat">><<set $path.push("reject interview")>><<set $ashamed += 10>><</link>> <<endif>>\ <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">One of the kids in your Spanish class, Floyd Bailey, nudges over toward your group with a sheepish look on his face. "Hey," he begins. "Can I ask--"</div> <div class="indent">"No, you can't, Floyd," you say, turning red. I mean //gracias.//"</div> <div class="indent">"//De nada.//"</div> <div class="indent">$fr nudges you. "It's your turn."</div> <<if $path.includes("open school interview") or $path.includes("anonymous school interview")>><div class="indent">You're looking through the list of words for class names you haven't used yet, when Floyd nudges into your little circle of two.</div> <div class="indent">"Hey, thanks for the help with my article," he tells you. He is teamed up with Ray Barnes, and is practicing the new vocabulary: emotions. The example sentences are all about whether you find certain situations interesting, difficult, or boring, and so on. "You change back and forth?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yeah, didn't you ever notice?" grumbles Ray. "$span talked about it on the second day or something."</div> <div class="indent">"I was out sick that day," Glenn says.</div> <div class="indent">"No, you weren't. How did you know I have ketchup on my hot dog, then?"</div> <div class="indent">"Because you always do," Glenn says. "So, is it true?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, it's true," you admit.</div> <div class="indent">You are gratified to see that most of the class aren't all that concerned about your condition. Somehow, you had expected much more drama and rejection. Your confession even draws some interested looks, and many more questions.</div> <<if $startsex == $sex and $sex == "male">><div class="indent">"Do you really wear dresses?"</div> <div class="indent">"Ha ha! I know I would!"</div> <<elseif $startsex == "male" and $sex == "female">><div class="indent">"Did a boy really ask you to Homecoming?"</div> <div class="indent">"I wonder if he has to shave his legs like we do."</div> <div class="indent">"I bet you don't miss how long it takes to get ready! It takes me //forever.//"</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">"Which do you like better?"</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, //please,//" Ray groans. "Lay off. This kid's all wet. I know — $nom[$sgen]'s in my English class. <<if $path.includes("Harold and Ray")>>We had to read stupid Shakespeare <<if $path.includes("Jaques")>>together today.<<else>>together, and I had to pretend to flirt with $acc[$sgen], playing Rosalind.<<endif>><<else>>I had to watch $acc[$sgen] reading Shakespeare today, playing <<if $path.includes("Rosalind")>>Rosalind<<else>>Orlando<<endif>> and trying to flirt with Arlene Stewart.<<endif>> It's no big deal."</div> <div class="indent">But the questions and the attentions don't stop.</div> <div class="indent">"Come on," you say. "You're embarrassing me."</div> <div class="indent">"//¡Atención, por favor!//" says $span, finally interrupting the clamor. She had been watching with mild interest, evidently curious herself about your condition. "You are embarrassed. //Dilo en español.//"</div> <div class="indent">"Uh," you say, "//estoy <<if $sex == "male">>avergonzada.<<else>>avergonzado.<<endif>>"//</div> <div class="indent">$span half-smiles, amused. "Close," she says. "//¿Eres un niño o una niña?//"</div> <div class="indent">"Fiddlesticks!" You sigh, as the class laughs. "I did it again."</div> <div class="indent">"Class, be careful with your endings," $span says. Glancing your way, she adds, "You, I think, more than anyone."</div> <<else>><div class="indent">"Who do you suppose it is?" asks Glenn, one of the Baker twins. He is teamed up with Ray Barnes, and is practicing the new vocabulary: emotions. The example sentences are all about whether you find certain situations interesting, difficult, or boring, and so on.</div> <div class="indent">"I dunno," says Ray Barnes sourly. "I bet you can tell, though. Just by looking at 'em."</div> <div class="indent">"Tell how?" asks Glenn.</div> <div class="indent">"Like ... all their boy clothes are red, and all their girl clothes are blue, or somethin'," says Ray with great confidence. "Or it'll be some boy who does a lot of sports, an' a girl who does a lot of, you know, girl things, like baking and such."</div> <div class="indent">"Why's that?"</div> <div class="indent">"To throw people off the scent," Ray declares. To you, he says, "Hey, $currname, what do you reckon? Pretty nutty story, huh? Wouldn't you like to know who it is?"</div> <div class="indent">"Sure, I'm interested," you say.</div> <div class="indent">"//Dilo en español, por favor,//" says $span, passing by your group of tables.</div> <div class="indent">"Uh," you say. "//Estoy <<if $sex == "female">>interesado.<<else>>interesada.<<endif>>//"</div> <div class="indent">"Yeah, interesting," Ray says, and turns back to his partner Glenn.</div> <div class="indent">$fr leans close. "You said it wrong. You're <<if $sex == "female">>a girl, so it should be //interesada//."<<else>>a boy, so it should be //interesado//."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">You sigh. "Fiddlesticks. I did it again."</div> <<endif>>\ <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 10>><div class="indent">Today is all about the difference between //ser// and //estar.// There are two forms of //to be// in Spanish, and they're used for very different things. Permanent conditions are states are used with //ser//, while temporary states, like emotions, are attached to //estar.//</div> <div class="indent">In your personal practice duo with $fr, you get a chance to apply the different verbs in sentences.</div> <div class="indent">"So would you say <<if $startsex == "male">>//soy hombre,// or would you say //estoy hombre?//<<else>>//soy mujer,// or would you say //estoy mujer?//<<endif>> Is it temporary or permanent?"</div> <div class="indent">"Very funny," you mutter.</div> <div class="indent">"I was just trying to lighten the mood," $fr says.</div> <div class="indent">"Thanks, but it's not helping," you say. "I've got $bully breathing down my neck. I think $nom[$bgen]'s serious about beating me up after school tomorrow. What am I supposed to do?"</div> <div class="indent"><<if $startsex == "male" and $sex == "male">><<set $path.push("friend says switch")>>"Maybe if you were a girl tomorrow, $bully wouldn't hit you. Sure, he probably //would,// but -- I mean, then you'd -- okay, maybe that's a bad idea," $fr says. "I guess I don't know what that would prove."<<elseif $startsex == "female" and $sex == "male">><<if $openzeta == true>><<set $path.push("friend says switch back")>>"Maybe you should try to switch back before tomorrow," $fr suggests. "I mean, she's accusing you of not being a girl. Maybe you should try to //be// one. Then everyone would see you're you."<<elseif $secret == true>><<set $path.push("friend says switch back")>>"Maybe you should try to switch back before tomorrow," $fr suggests. "I mean, she's accusing you of not being a girl. Maybe you should try to //be// one. That would take some of the sting out of her accusations."<<else>>"I wish there was some way you could //both// show up tomorrow," $fr says. "That'd prove $acc[$bgen] wrong, wouldn't it?"<<endif>><<elseif $startsex == "male" and $sex == "female">><<if $openzeta == true>><<set $path.push("friend says switch back")>>"Maybe you should try to switch back before tomorrow," $fr suggests. "I mean, she's accusing you of not being a boy. Maybe you should try to //be// one. Then everyone would see you're you."<<elseif $secret == true>><<set $path.push("friend says switch back")>>"Maybe you should try to switch back before tomorrow," $fr suggests. "I mean, she's accusing you of not being a girl. Maybe you should try to //be// one. That would take some of the sting out of her accusations."<<else>>"I wish there was some way you could //both// show up tomorrow," $fr says. "That'd prove $acc[$bgen] wrong, wouldn't it?"<<endif>><<elseif $startsex == "female" and $sex == "female">><<set $path.push("friend says switch")>>"Maybe if you were a boy tomorrow, $bully wouldn't try to fight you. Sure, she probably //would,// but -- I mean, then you'd -- okay, maybe that's a bad idea," $fr says. "I guess I don't know what that would prove."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"I've got to do //something,//" you sigh.</div> <div class="indent">"Tell the principal, maybe?"</div> <div class="indent">"Then I'll just be chickening out."</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, and you won't get your <<if $bgen == 3>>face smashed in by that caveman,<<else>>hair pulled out by that witch,<<endif>> either," $fr points out.</div> <div class="indent">"I can see the appeal, yes," you grin. "But ratting $bully out to a teacher wouldn't make $acc[$bgen] stop ragging on me, would it? It'd probably just make it worse. I'd look like I have something to hide or be ashamed of."</div> <div class="indent">"That's true."</div> <div class="indent">"I have to come up with //something.//"</div> <div class="indent">"And it'd better be by tomorrow," $fr warns.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 11>><<if $path.includes("open school interview")>><div class="indent">$span informs the class that there will be a test next Friday on the first four chapters of the book, including greetings, the use of //ser// and //estar,// emotions, and school-related vocabulary.</div> <div class="indent">"For part of your test grade, you will also be doing a dialogue with a partner," she says, "where you will make use of time and days of the week. She hands $span a note, and leaves. The Spanish teacher unfolds it and looks it over. "$currname?" she says, looking up. <<endif>><<endif>><<endif>><<endif>>\<<set $classing to 5>><<if $day == 2>><div class="indent">After Spanish comes Geometry. Hopefully, there's no way you can embarrass yourself in //this// class.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">Unfortunately, the instructor, $geom, is the same one you have for gym class. As if carrying on directly from his previous speech in the gymnasium, he goes on and on about how the Army needs good, brave men to step up and learn to become engineers and cartographers. "Geometry is a useful skill," he tells the class. "In this class, we will help you to read maps and triangulate distances, to find areas and make calculations for all kinds of construction, and we'll even do some experiments in the field. I have some lessons planned where you must follow directions on a map, and then calculate the distance to a hidden gun emplacement."</div> <div class="indent">Some of the boys raise a cheer. $fr gives you an excited thumbs-up sign at the idea of traipsing around with a map and compass, but you just feel a little ill. Somehow, even mathematics has been turned into a boys-only club, and you're not quite sure whether you belong to that club any more.</div> --<<link "go to Wood Shop" "1948 Wood Shop">><</link>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true>><<set $newknowns to [34]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">The Geometry class is taught by $geom, a heavyset man with a florid face, slightly bulging eyes, and a bushy mustache. He's the same instructor for boys' gym class, apparently.</div> <div class="indent">He welcomes you to the class with obvious discomfort, and briefly explains your presence to the others. By this late in the day, the reaction is more subdued. You've already had classes with some of these boys, and they already know the story. "Miss $lastname will be joining us in Geometry for the duration," he says, "owing to changes in her schedule. I have my doubts about whether geometry is an appropriate class for a young lady, but I'm sure one of you boys will be able to assist her if she has difficulty."</div> <div class="indent">You can't help but seethe a little at that. You're not an //idiot,// you're just a girl. Well ... not at the //moment//, but usually. Of all the reactions anyone could have to this strange week you've been having, you didn't expect anyone to just //ignore// it all and pretend it wasn't happening.</div> <div class="indent">Not only that, you can see $so on the other side of the classroom, wincing visibly as two other boys whisper in his ear. This has to be as hard on $so as it is on you.</div> <<elseif $newid == true>><div class="indent">The Geometry class is taught by $geom, a heavyset man with a florid face, slightly bulging eyes, and a bushy mustache. You recognize him as the same instructor for boys' gym class.</div> <div class="indent">$geom barely makes mention of your arrival in his class except to comment "new student" after he reads your name from the roll list.</div> <div class="indent">It's nice to feel completely invisible again. $so gives you a small nod from across the room, and that's reassuring, too, even though he has no idea who you really are.</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">$geom starts off the class period by reading roll call. He announces your name with all the others, as if nothing has changed about you.</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self again. We may assume the player is start-male. This is impossible on Day 3. If this pops up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <<set $newknowns to [17, 3, 4]>><div class="indent">"We are going to begin today with the principles of plane geometry as devised by the Greek mathematician Euclid, in the 4th century BC. Euclid gave us several axioms — who knows what an axiom is?"</div> <div class="indent">Harold Giles, the popular baseball player, raises his hand. "Something that is always true."</div> <div class="indent">"Very close. It is //presumed// to be true," $geom corrects him. "It cannot be proven, but its truth is self-evident. Geometry begins with several axioms -- fundamental definitions that form a foundation that everything else rests upon. Can anyone give an example of an axiom?"</div> <div class="indent">"East is east and west is west," offers Gerald Myers, grinning broadly.</div> <div class="indent">"And never the twain shall meet," $geom says, finishing the Kipling quote. "Very good. The logical principle of self-identity. Anyone else?"</div> <div class="indent">One of the Baker twins raises his hand. "Boys will be boys?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, Glenn, although that's the //same// principle, stated a different way. Anyone else?"</div> <div class="indent">//Except sometimes boys __aren't__ boys,// you think, copying down the word //axiom// and scowling at it.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">Geometry is a bit of a struggle. The class isn't difficult, but you can't get the incident with $bully off of your mind.</div> <<if $path.includes("SO date") or $path.includes("friend date")>><div class="indent">Besides, you've got a date tonight, and it's occupying a large part of your brain. Could this be the secret method for changing back to normal?</div><<else>><div class="indent">Besides, you're still thinking about what $fr suggested, about finding a way to turn back to normal. There's //got// to be a way.</div><<endif>> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 8>><div class="indent">"A lot of you may be wondering," $geom says at the beginning of class, "what use it is to study mathematics. You may think you'll never use these skills in real life. What difference does it make if you can find a congruent triangle, you might say. Or compute the Pythagorean theorem. Well, I'll tell you.</div> <div class="indent">"Learning do to math speedily and well is of vital importance in everyday life," he goes on expansively. "From calculating the price of a new car, to adjusting the proportions of a chemical formula, to computing the amount of seeds you need for your lawn or garden, you need mathematics. How many people here have used tools around the house?"</div> <div class="indent">A couple of hands go up, including yours.</div> <<if $openzeta == true and $sex == "female">><div class="indent">$geom's eyes land on you, sitting there in your dress. "You, uh, $name," he says, consulting his classroom seating chart. "What kind of tools have you used at home? A mixer? An iron?"</div> <div class="indent">"No, I mean carpentry tools," you say indignantly. "I'm helping my old man build a fence out back. And I'm going to get my Carpentry badge in scouts."</div> <div class="indent">"The Girl Scouts?"</div> <div class="indent">"The //Boy// Scouts," you explain. "I have this condition, remember?"</div> <<else>><div class="indent">$geom's eyes land on you. "$name," he says, without a glance at the seating chart. "What kind of tools have you used at home? A saw? A hammer?"</div> <div class="indent">"Sure," you nod. "And my old man was going to show me how to use a chalk line this weekend. We're building a fence. And I'm getting my Carpentry badge in scouts."</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">"Ah, yes." His eyes go unfocused as he tries to recall, and he glances at his classroom seating chart again. "Right. Well." A brief cough, and he moves on. "Now's the time to show all of you the value of excellence. You'll notice I have rolled in another chalkboard in the back of the room. For the rest of the semester, students will be competing for the prize of //doing less homework.//"</div> <div class="indent">There is a buzz of interest at that.</div> <div class="indent">"Every column in the class is a team," he goes on, gesturing with a flat hand to show the line of desks before him. "You will compete as a team. I will give you an easy problem to solve, and the boy who solves it gets a point for his <<if $openzeta == true and $sex == "female">>team. Or //her// team," he adds condescendingly in your direction. "The<<else>>team. The<<endif>> team with the most points only has to do every //other// problem in the assignment."</div> <div class="indent">The class is definitely interested now.</div> <<if $openzeta == true and $sex == "female">><div class="indent">"To show the value of a good grasp of mathematics," $geom says, "our first competitors today will be Miss $lastname, who is such an //expert// in building fences--" you cannot ignore the superior, mocking tone in his voice-- "and Mr Myers, who apparently thinks it's amusing to turn in his homework late every day so far."</div> <div class="indent">Gerald, the class clown, stands and bows, while some of his classmates rag on him for having to compete against a girl.</div> <div class="indent">You fume silently. The intention is clear. $geom doesn't think girls //belong// in geometry class. Or maybe he just doesn't think //you// do. But if you beat Gerald, then his buddies are going to ride him all year about losing to you.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">"To show the value of a good grasp of mathematics," $geom says, "our first competitors today will be Mr $lastname, the Boy Scout who is helping his father build fences, and Mr Myers, who apparently thinks it's amusing to turn in his homework late every day so far."</div> <div class="indent">Gerald, the class clown, stands and bows, while some of his classmates rag on him for having to compete against a girl.</div> <div class="indent">The teacher's intention is clear. He's pitting the Eagle Scout against the layabout in hopes that you beat Gerald soundly and prove something about the value of geometry. But you know that it won't end well for Gerald. If you defeat him badly, his friends will tease him, and he won't learn anything.</div> <<endif>>\ <<if $sex == "male">>--<<link "try as hard as you can to win" "1948 Geometry Chat">><<set $mheightbonus += 2>><<set $shoulderbonus += 2>><<set $page to 0>><</link>> --<<link "try to help Gerald" "1948 Geometry Chat">><<set $page to 1>><</link>> <<elseif $sex == "female">>--<<link "try as hard as you can to win" "1948 Geometry Chat">><<set $page to 0>><</link>> --<<link "try to help Gerald" "1948 Geometry Chat">><<set $fheightbonus += 2>><<set $hipbonus += 2>><<set $page to 1>><</link>> <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $day == 9>><div class="indent">You're grateful to get into Geometry class. Nobody except for $geom cares whether you're a boy or a girl. All they want to know is whether your math skills can earn your row a coveted half-free assignment.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 10>><div class="indent">Today in Geometry, $geom explains a number of rules about parallel lines, and sketches some proofs for them on the chalkboard. For some reason, they do not occupy your full attention. You're more invested in solving the problem of how not to get your clock cleaned by $bully after school tomorrow.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>> <<if $day == 11>><<if $path.includes("oops")>><div class="indent">You attract a certain amount of attention entering Geometry class in your <<if $path.includes("cotton candy dress")>>cotton-candy pink dress,<<else>>your yellow floral sundress,<<endif>> your stockings, and your patent-leather <<if $cupsize gte 4>>shoes, with your boobs bouncing and pushing against the top of your dress.<<else>>shoes, with your little girly breasts pushing out the top of the dress.<<endif>> Everybody is staring.</div> <div class="indent">"What happened to //you?//" asks Gerald with a smirk. "Did the Zeta bite you?"</div> <div class="indent">"Obviously," says Harold Giles, with a disapproving look at Gerald.</div> <div class="indent">"Yeah, it's //really// obvious. I mean, look at her," Gerald says, demonstrating two sizeable cups in front of his chest.</div> <div class="indent">"It's not funny, Gerald," you say.</div> <div class="indent">"Of //course// it's funny," he retorts. "It's funny that it's not me."</div> <div class="indent">This time the laughter is louder. Gerald looks as if he's quite enjoying the attention. The baseball player, Harold, looks as if he's about to say something, but thinks better of it.</div> <div class="indent">$geom stares at you as he tries to bring the class to order, giving you a look as if you're an unwelcome kind of smudge on his slide rule. "Principal Fordyce advised me there would be a student with Zeta in my class today," he says after a long, penetrating look. "I had no idea it would be so ... //noticeable.//"</div> <div class="indent">There is another titter, and you turn pink.</div> <div class="indent">"Very well," he says, "let us proceed." With a last scowl, he goes on to demonstrate some more proofs that can now be possible with parallel lines.</div> <div class="indent">The class doesn't seem to be paying attention. As much as you try to ignore it, you get the feeling that everybody is talking about //you.//</div> <<else>><div class="indent">It's Geometry already. Where did the time go?</div> <<endif>>\ <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\<<set $classing to 11>><<if $day == 2>><<set $newknowns to [32]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">Bookkeeping is taught by $bkp, an older man with a military bearing and a no-nonsense haircut.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">"In this class, you will learn the basics of business math skills. These are applicable skills for any kind of business, whether you are planning to take over your father's shoe store, or if you're going to start your own construction business. You young ladies may also use these math skills for running a household and making a budget for you and your husband," he adds, as an afterthought.</div> <div class="indent">//Oh really? Then my husband is going to be in for a surprise,// you think with a mixture of humor and dread.</div> <div class="indent">"Those of you who graduate high school and go on to college," $bkp continues, "will be able to take courses in higher mathematics later on. This course will focus on the practical, every-day life skills that you'll need to be a prosperous businessman. Or even a savvy homemaker."</div> <div class="indent">He passes out textbooks after that, and you're left to wonder which one of those two things you're likely to be.</div> --<<link "go to Home Economics" "1948 Home Economics">><</link>> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true>><<set $newknowns to [32]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">It's getting fairly late in the day, so by this time most of the girls in your new Bookkeeping class have already heard about your "condition." Some of them are whispering between themselves and pointing in your direction.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, it's true, we have a new young man among us," $bkp says briskly, clasping his hands together. He's an older man with a military bearing and a no-nonsense haircut. "If you haven't already heard, this is Mr $lastname, whom you may recall. He will be continuing in Bookkeeping, due to a, uh, a kind of medical condition, apparently. Luckily for you, it means you don't have to take any higher mathematics," he adds with a condescending smile. "But that's all right, our girls do very well in basic business math, and I'm sure you'll be able to keep up. You //might// even have an advantage!" His eyes twinkle with merriment.</div> <div class="indent">You can't help but feel a little stung by this. You used to be a girl, sure, but that doesn't mean you used to be an imbecile. You're pretty sure you could do math no matter what you looked like.</div> <<elseif $newid == true>><div class="indent">It's getting fairly late in the day, so by this time most of the girls in your new Bookkeeping class have already heard about the new student in class. Some of them are whispering between themselves and pointing in your direction. You can see $so Young among them, glancing your way with a kind of pesky familiarity, as if she's trying to recollect something to her mind.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, it's true, we have a new student among us," $bkp says briskly, clasping his hands together. He's an older man with a military bearing and a no-nonsense haircut. "If you haven't already heard, this is Miss $lastname, who will be joining us in Bookkeeping this semester. But don't worry," he adds with a condescending smile. "A lot of girls do very well in basic business math, and I'm sure you'll be just the same."</div> <div class="indent">You can't help but feel a little stung by this. You've been turned into a //girl//, not an imbecile. You're pretty sure you could still do math if you wanted.</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">A lot of the students in class are becoming tired and bored by this part of the day. $bkp watches the girls file in and sit down, yawning, at their desks.</div> <div class="indent">"No yawning, ladies," he says with a condescending smile. "You'll want your wits about you for today's lesson."</div> <div class="indent">You can't help but wonder if he'd treat you the same way if he knew you weren't a girl any more.</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self again. The player is start-female. This is impossible on Day 3. If this pops up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">When everyone is settled, $bkp draws some lines on the board. "All right, girls, today we're going to be going over the basics of a balance sheet, which is what we'll be using all year. This is important, so be sure to take very good notes. If you don't understand this concept, you're going to find yourself struggling later on."</div> <div class="indent">//It's adding and subtracting,// you sigh to yourself. //We've been doing this for years. How difficult does he think this is?//</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">Bookkeeping is a bit of a struggle. The class isn't difficult, but you can't get the incident with $bully off of your mind.</div> <<if $path.includes("SO date") or $path.includes("friend date")>><div class="indent">Besides, you've got a date tonight, and it's occupying a large part of your brain. Could this be the secret method for changing back to normal?</div><<else>><div class="indent">Besides, you're still thinking about what $fr suggested, about finding a way to turn back to normal. There's //got// to be a way.</div><<endif>> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 8>><div class="indent">"Today, we are going to talk about the adding machine," $bkp announces at the start of class. "You will be given the opportunity to use the school adding machines, because they are valuable tools of the modern workplace. We have several Marchants, a couple of Burroughs, and a Victor. All good machines. Perhaps a little older, but typical of what you'll find in the office.</div> <div class="indent">"There are not enough machines to go around, I'm afraid. Some of you will get them, and others will not. We will rotate these devices throughout the class throughout the semester. However, I am going to award them based on whichever students need them the //least.// If you don't get a machine, that is because you need //more practice.// Remember, the best adding machine in the world cannot compete with your brain. If you do not understand what you are doing, the adding machine won't fix your mistakes, and if you understand and apply yourself to the mathematics, you can do it //without// the machine."</div> <<if $openzeta == true and $sex == "male">><div class="indent">He looks around the class, trying to choose student volunteers. "You," he says, pointing to Evelyn Cox, "and the young man there. Up to the board please. What's your name, sir?" $bkp asks you.</div> <div class="indent">"$name," you reply.</div> <div class="indent">"Forgive me," he says. "I said young man, but I forgot — you're the one who came to our class with a medical condition. Actually, let's see if being a man has given you an advantage in mathematics. You never know, do you, girls?" He smiles at the class, amused at his own bigotry, and hands you a piece of chalk as you go to the board.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">He looks around the class, trying to choose student volunteers. "You," he says, pointing to Evelyn Cox, and turning to you, he says, "and you. To the board, please."</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">When you are in place, he says, "I'm going to read off a column of two-digit numbers. I want you to add them up as quickly as you can. Ready?"</div> <div class="indent">Before he even begins, Evelyn is so flustered, she drops her chalk. She's pretty and popular, but not terribly bright, and very unsure of herself. Maybe you could find a way to give her a boost. But then again, you don't want to be one of the students slogging through the semester adding things up //by hand.//</div> <<if $sex == "male">>--<<link "do your best to win" "1948 Bookkeeping Chat">><<set $page to 0>><<set $mheightbonus += 2>><<set $shoulderbonus += 2>><</link>> --<<link "try to help Evelyn" "1948 Bookkeeping Chat">><<set $page to 1>><</link>> <<elseif $sex == "female">>--<<link "do your best to win" "1948 Bookkeeping Chat">><<set $page to 0>><</link>> --<<link "try to help Evelyn" "1948 Bookkeeping Chat">><<set $fheightbonus += 2>><<set $hipbonus += 2>><<set $page to 1>><</link>> <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $day == 9>><div class="indent">Fortunately, most of the students in Bookkeeping aren't interested in whether you're a boy or a girl. They're far more focused on which student is going to win the math competition and earn the right to use the adding machines for their in-class assignments.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 10>><div class="indent">Today in Bookkeeping, $bkp explains about double entries, and writes down several uses for a double-entry system on the chalkboard. For some reason, this do not occupy your full attention. You're more invested in solving the problem of how not to get your clock cleaned by $bully after school tomorrow.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 11>><<if $path.includes("oops")>><div class="indent">You draw a certain amount of attention entering Bookkeeping wearing a shirt, trousers and tie, and with your strange new buzz cut that only serves to accentuate the more masculine shape of your head. A number of the girls turn to each other, whispering and giggling, as you take your seat among them.</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, a new boy in class?" asks June Morris, looking at you with interest.</div> <div class="indent">"Better keep away from this one, Juney," says Jo Gray. "That's $name."</div> <div class="indent">"Is it? No, it can't be--" But June can't finish the sentence. Her eyes pop open wide. "Wait, it //is!// What happened? Did you catch that Zeta thing?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, it looks that way," says Arlene Stewart.</div> <div class="indent">"Ooh, that hair," Jo says, with a shudder. "I don't want that to happen to //me.//"</div> <div class="indent">June isn't dismayed. <<if $ht gt 175>>"He's tall, though.<<elseif $strength gt 57>>"He's strong, though.<<elseif $shoulders gte 36>>"He's pretty handsome, though.<<else>>"He looks pretty good, though.<<endif>> I like that."</div> <div class="indent">"But would you want to wake up like that tomorrow?" asks Ruby Russell snidely. "I wouldn't."</div> <div class="indent">There is a murmur of agreement and disapproval among the girls. Arlene Stewart, from English class, looks as if she's about to say something in your defense, but she changes her mind.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">It's Bookkeeping already. Where did the time go?</div> <<endif>>\ <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\<<set $classing to 10>><<if $day == 2>><<set $newknowns to [38, 23, 6]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">The girls gather for Home Economics in a brightly-lit room filled with home appliances: stoves, ironing boards, sewing machines, and all kinds of household tools. The instructor is $homeec, a youthful woman with a cheery smile, a Midwestern twang, and a frilly apron over her day dress. She assures the class that she has a science degree in Household Management from the University of Iowa.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">"In order to run a successful home," $homeec says in a clear voice, "the modern woman is going to have to know not only how to //use// all of her labor-saving machines, but how to conduct her own repairs. Imagine it, ladies: you're cooking dinner for your husband, and you're making a nice aspic. Let's say you're making jellied eggs. You're mixing up the gelatin. Suddenly, the Mixmaster breaks. How are you going to manage?"</div> <div class="indent">The girls exchange concerned looks. "Use a hand beater?" asks Doris Thacker in a timid voice. You remember her from your English class.</div> <div class="indent">"Possibly, yes. That's one way to do it. But after this class," $homeec says, "you'll be able to take apart your own Mixmaster and see what's wrong. You'll be able to repair that loose wire, or change out a frayed cord, or replace a bad fuse, all by yourself. Not only is it economical, and it will save your family money, but you'll never have to worry your husband about little household chores like this. That aspic will come out of the refrigerator on time!"</div> <div class="indent">A girl named Evelyn Cox raises her hand, with a worried look on her face. "$homeec," she says, "aren't these machines full of oil and grease and such?"</div> <div class="indent">"Some of them, yes," $homeec says gravely, "but with the right soaps and detergents, you'll be able to clean up any messes. We don't want you girls to worry about getting your hands dirty. Remember, most of your mothers worked in the factories during the war!" She gives the class an encouraging smile. "And just in case we ever need you young ladies to march off to the factory floors again, we need to make sure you're familiar with basic household tools."</div> <div class="indent">Somehow, you think another fate might be in store for you, if anybody ever finds out what's happened underneath your skirt.</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true or $newid == true>><<set $newknowns to [38]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">You made it to the last class of the day. By now, practically everyone in the school knows about you. That's good //and// bad, you suppose.</div> <div class="indent">The girls in Home Ec are no exception. A small knot of girls approaches you to say hello, blushing and staring, before retreating back to the other side of the room. Josephine Gray comes over, examining your outfit archly, to comment that she used to have a dress like yours ... when she was twelve. Evelyn Cox helpfully points out that your stocking seams aren't straight, and fixes them for you.</div> <div class="indent">The instructor, a cheerful young woman with a Midwestern twang named $homeec, seems almost too enthusiastic about Home Economics for her own good. "Good afternoon, my fabulous little stars!" she says brightly. "Is everybody excited to start thinking about your very first project?"</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">Even though it's the last class of the day, $homeec comes bounding into the room with energy and good cheer. "Good afternoon, my fabulous little stars!" she says brightly. "Is everybody excited to start thinking about your very first project?"</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self again. The player is start-female. This is impossible on Day 3. If this pops up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <<set $newknowns to [6, 23, 9]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">She proceeds to announce that the first project is sewing, and that every girl in the class will be making herself a new dress. "Or something else if you'd like," she adds. "This is really just a refresher for all your sewing skills."</div> <div class="indent">Evelyn raises her hand. "$homeec, what if we aren't very good at sewing?"</div> <div class="indent">"That's only natural," she says, waving one hand reassuringly. "I know a lot of you gals didn't get a lot of instructions from your mothers during the war years. Mom was away making shells and airplanes, and didn't have any time to show you the basics. It's all right." Her broad Midwestern twang shows through on the word //right.// "If you don't know how to baste, or how to do a running stitch or a backstitch, we'll cover those in class. Chain stitches, blanket stitches, buttons, you name it. Your project is going to have to show that you've mastered each and every one of them, and we'll also be using my electric Singer sewing machine I brought from home."</div> <div class="indent">"What kind of dresses can we make?" asks Doris Thacker, the girl from your English class.</div> <div class="indent">"Any kind you like," $homeec says encouragingly. "I suggest you bring one from home so you can figure out the pattern. That gives you something to go from. You'll draw up your design and make your changes, choose a fabric, and when you're all done, you'll have a brand-new dress that's entirely your own."</div> <div class="indent">The girls seem enthusiastic about the idea.</div> <div class="indent">"Doesn't that sound great?" $homeec says, practically bubbling with delight. "But first things first: we're going to have to take proper measurements for all you gals, in order so you can make your dress the right size. Write these down, because these are the basic measurements we'll need for all of you."</div> <div class="indent">The rest of the day is spent with cloth tape measures: around waists and hips, around arms, around wrists, measuring the lengths of arms and legs, even — it's ticklish to think about — having another girl reaching under your skirt to measure your thighs.</div> <div class="indent">All around you, the girls are comparing their numbers. "Nineteen inch thighs, Ruby? That's amazing!" gushes Evelyn. "Mine are twenty-four. I feel like a big cow."</div> <div class="indent">"I //can't// have a twenty-three inch waist, I just //can't//," Doris wails to her partner, Josephine. "Scarlett O'Hara's waist was only seventeen inches!"</div> <div class="indent">"Scarlett O'Hara?" asks Jo blankly. "What school does she go to?"</div> <div class="indent">It looks like it's going to be a long semester.</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">Today, $homeec takes the entire class period to talk about different kinds of fabrics, the different ways fabrics can be joined, and what kind of stitches are best. "We can't cover all of them in one day," she tells the class, "but I can make sure you gals have a good solid understanding of the right ways to create a seam. It's the most basic of stitches, and it will be used for ... does anybody know?"</div> <<if $openzeta == true or $newid == true>><div class="indent">After that, it's threading needles and practicing your stitching. "I hope you win."</div> <<endif>>\ <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 11>><div class="indent">Everyone is turned loose on their projects today, starting with a simple paper pattern.</div> <div class="indent">"A paper cutout can be very helpful," $homeec tells the class. "If your sizes aren't just right, or your seams don't line up, this is where you're going to notice. Don't forget you're going to want to do left and right sides separately, so you can set them out on the fabric to make sure you have enough. And //label// them, girls! The last thing you want is to cut out your expensive velvet or silk and realize it's the wrong side out!"</div> <<if $path.includes("oops")>><div class="indent">You sit at your worktable in your shirt and tie, trying to ignore the way the girls in the class circulate around you. Walking past. Brushing your muscula arms as they go by. Sitting at your table to pick through the jar of pencils and pens. Saying hello. It seems like they're taking every opportunity to inspect the Zeta Chromosome's handiwork. The ringleaders are Evelyn, Jo, and Ruby, who were also in your Bookkeeping class. And it doesn't end until the bell rings.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">You sit at your worktable, cutting out paper patterns for your project, staring at the scissors and unable to concentrate. School is almost over.</div> <<endif>>\ <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\<<set $classing to 6>><<if $day == 2>><<set $newknowns to [42, 25, 21]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">The Wood Shop teacher is a grizzled old man with a cast eye named $shop, who is missing the first two fingers on his right hand.</div><<display "LastClass">> <div class="indent">"This!" he calls out gruffly, holding up his disfigured hand. "This, boys, is the kind of thing that can happen to you, if you don't listen carefully to me and you don't use the proper safety equipment in this class. I will be signing you off on every piece of equipment in my shop before you are allowed to touch it. You see the yellow lines on the floor? Right there, around the band saw, and the lathe? Those are your safety lines. If you're not using that tool, you must stand behind that yellow line. Yes, you," he says, pointing to a boy with a raised hand.</div> <div class="indent">"How did you lose your fingers?" asks Ralph Ward. He's a tall, blond young man who happens to be the new quarterback this year.</div> <div class="indent">"In the war," $shop says, looking down. "It's a story for later. I'll tell you boys some other time." He seems uncomfortable, and moves on quickly. "Believe me, you do not want to lose part of your hand! Imagine not being able to go fishing, or shoot a bow at summer camp. Imagine not being able to work at your father's store because you can't carry anything heavy."</div> <div class="indent">//I can imagine it,// you think to yourself.</div> <div class="indent">"And that is why I expect each one of you to pay close attention. If I see you daydreaming or lollygagging, I will send you out of class for the day, and you will get a zero on attendance. No exceptions."</div> <div class="indent">"Are we going to work on any metals this year?" asks one boy.</div> <div class="indent">"Raise your hand first, Paul. No, we are not doing any metals this year. The Industrial Arts program has expanded to a second course, just for metalworking and machining, so if you would rather be in that course, talk to the school secretary and get your class changed. Yes, you."</div> <div class="indent">Ralph speaks, his eyes still fixed on $shop's mangled right hand. "What if we don't want to take shop any more? I don't want to injure my throwing hand."</div> <div class="indent">"It's mandatory," $shop says curtly. "These are skills every boy should learn. You can't be much of a man unless you can fix things up around the house."</div> <div class="indent">//There's another qualification,// you think. //And right now, I don't meet it.//</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 3>><<if $openzeta == true or $newid == true>><<set $newknowns to [42]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">You made it to the last class of the day. By now, practically everyone in the school knows about you. That's good //and// bad, you suppose.</div> <div class="indent">The boys in Wood Shop are no exception. A couple of them are eyeing you suspiciously, as if searching for signs that you might not belong. Apparently they don't see anything that provokes them, because mostly the reaction you receive is total indifference.</div> <div class="indent">The teacher is a grizzled old man with a cast eye named $shop, who is missing the first two fingers on his right hand, and who has a habit of emphasizing the rules of wood shop safety by recalling gruesome shop accidents. He has a story for every machine, a foolhardy and errant young lad for every occasion. It's morbidly fascinating somehow.</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">$shop begins today's lessons with another round of his favorite hobby, wherein he illustrates the need for wood shop safety by recalling gruesome shop accidents. He has a story for every machine, a foolhardy and errant young lad for every occasion. It's morbidly fascinating somehow.</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(You are your old self again. We may assume the player is start-male. This is impossible on Day 3. If this pops up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <<set $newknowns to [25, 10]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">"A couple of years ago, some kid, who wasn't following the rules about safety near the band saw, he stepped across the yellow line, and turned around too fast without looking and cut off the tip of his thumb. Now you boys," $shop says sternly, glaring around with rheumy eyes, "you //listen// when I tell you to be careful with this equipment, or that could happen to you."</div> <div class="indent">After that, he passes out a short quiz about shop safety regarding the band saw. The pages are damp and smell of fresh mimeograph ink, and most of the questions are crudely phrased, multiple-choice, and obvious. You doubt whether he spends much time writing them. Or grading them.</div> <div class="indent">"All right, boys," he says, when he has collected the pages, "you are going to be working on several projects this semester, but you should start thinking about your final project now. Maybe you want to build a new box for your tools, or for fishing tackle. You could make a wooden rack for your father's easy chair, to hold his pipe and newspapers. Maybe you'd like to make your best girl a jewelry box for her pretty things. It's up to you. Your project has to be sanded and finished, it has to have hardware attached — a hinge or a latch or a lid, something like that. Tt has to have at least one seamless joint. And it has to have at least one fitted angle and one curve. It can't all be easy straight lines. Yes — Ralph."</div> <div class="indent">"Can I do a glass case for a football?" asks Ralph Ward, the new sophomore quarterback.</div> <div class="indent">"Why, you planning on //winning?//" asks Paul Sanders with a nasty grin.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, a case will be fine, if it has a hinged lid. Anyone else? Yes, you —" $shop consults his sketch of the students at their workbenches. "Jack Kelly?"</div> <div class="indent">The boy with the raised hand nods. "Y-yes. Uh, what about a n-new, a n-n-new b-butt for my b-b-BB gun?"</div> <div class="indent">"No join on that," $shop says disapprovingly. "No hardware. Unless you take a flat bit and drill out a space in the back, make a little carrying space for extra BBs." The old man rubs his whiskered chin. "If you take a couple smaller pieces of walnut and laminate them together..." He shrugs. "Talk to me after class about that one."</div> <div class="indent">After that, all the boys are calling out their ideas, often forgetting to raise their hands. It becomes a free-for-all discussion forum on various things they could build, if only they had the knowledge.</div> <div class="indent">"I know you're all excited," $shop says at last. "Most of you grew up, your fathers were off in Europe fighting. They didn't have time to raise you good and teach you proper tool use. Well, we're going to take care of that in this class, give you boys a firm foundation on what it means to be a man."</div> <div class="indent">You're not sure whether that's possible at this point, but given the week you've had, you wouldn't rule it out.</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">Today, $shop spends the entire day talking about different kinds of wood, different grains and hardness, and things to watch out for. "Green wood," he says, "that's going to warp on you as it dries out. It'll get you every time, bend all over the place, like it's moving on its own. Always check your wood. You want good, hard wood, nice and straight, no curves or bends or twists."</div> <div class="indent">The way $shop keeps talking about "wood" causes all the boys in class to stiffle a snicker.</div> <div class="indent">"$shop," says Glenn Baker with a straight face, "what if your wood is too big?"</div> <div class="indent">Another round of snorts goes around the room. Paul Sanders hides his face to conceal a smirk.</div> <div class="indent">"You should always look for wood that's close to the right size," $shop replies, oblivious. "It minimizes waste. But make sure to measure. Better too big than too small."</div> <<if $openzeta == true or $newid == true>><div class="indent">For the first time, it occurs to you to wonder whether your "wood" is too big or too small. Do all boys worry about this?</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">You wonder for a moment whether your "wood" is too big or too small, before it occurs to you that you have no way to measure it. Your wood is AWOL at the moment.</div> <<elseif $oldid == true>>(Could be male or female. This is impossible on Day 4. If this pops up, it is an ERROR.) <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">Then $shop starts talking about nailing and screwing, and you begin to despair of learning anything in this class.</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 8>><div class="indent">Today in shop class, $shop goes over the basics: drawing, drafting, measuring, and marking.</div> <div class="indent">"This," he says, holding up a metal triangle, "is a speed square. This one's a, er, it's a Swanson, I think--" he checks the markings on the side-- "yes, a Swanson, but there are other kinds hanging up on the tool rack in back. Mr Kelly, point to the speed squares for the class, please." After Jack sits down again, $shop continues. "You've all heard the old saying. Measure..." he pauses, working it out. "Measure twice, cut once. Yes. I get that backward sometimes, which is why the saying is there. Think before you act. If you're marking an angle too quickly and you're not squared up -- hand me that piece of scrap there, would you? -- and you're not squared up, you get a crooked line, like this." He demonstrates, then holds up the board. "Always make sure when you're using a speed square that you're flush up against the side, grasp your wood firmly and hold it down on the table, and //then// make your mark."</div> <div class="indent">"Grasp our wood firmly," says Paul Sanders, as he writes it down.</div> <div class="indent">"Think you can handle that?" murmurs Gordon Baker.</div> <div class="indent">"I'm an //expert,//" Paul whispers back.</div><<set $newknowns to [4, 21]>><<display "NewKnowns">> <div class="indent">"Today, I've got both our table saws set up with a miter attachment. I want you all to mark down a thirty degree angle two inches from the end of your board, and you're going to make that cut. I will check your work with a ... let's see ..." He fishes around under the papers on his worktable, then holds up a little wooden contraption. "It's a little jig I made, you see, you just put the wood in the slot like that, and you move this peg if you want to check the angle. The peg is attached here on this leather thong so I don't lose it. That way I can check your work very quickly."</div> <div class="indent">"So we're //all// supposed to stick our wood in the slot?" asks Gordon with a smirk.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, you should all finish this before the end of class," says $shop, oblivious.</div> <<if $openzeta == true and $sex == "female">><div class="indent">"All except //her,//" says Paul, pointing to you. You're the only one watching the clock.</div> <<endif>>\ <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\<<silently>> Here we have to choose which schedule the player will adhere to on any specific day. This means we calculate the following: boy schedule: player is boy or dickgirl; participates fully as a male in that class girl schedule: player is pussyboy or girl; participates fully as a female in that class pussyboy schedule: player is pussyboy; school excludes certain classes while the player is unable to participate dickgirl schedule: player is dickgirl; school excuses certain classes when the player is unable to participate secret girl schedule: player is pussyboy; participates in class but has to hide certain things or bring a note secret boy schedule: player is dickgirl; participates in class but has to hide certain things or bring a note <<if $startsex == "male" and $sex == "male">> Player was MALE, and currently is MALE. <<if $path.includes("pussyboy schedule")>> <<set $sched to "pussyboy schedule">> Player is back to normal, but is still an open Zeta. <<elseif $path.includes("girl schedule")>> <<set $sched to "boy schedule">> Player is back to normal, and resumes old ID.
