$classlist to []>> <<set $classlinks to []>> <<set $currentclass to 0>> When on day 3 and beyond, we want to adjust the schedule on the fly, so we're not constantly repeating the same logic on multiple days per multiple classes. <<if $sched == "boy schedule">> The BOY schedule. Standard class list for when the player is a boy (either born that way, or in secret identity mode). <<set $classlist to [ "1948 English", "1948 Gym", "1948 History", "1948 Vocal Music", "CYCLE", "1948 Spanish", "1948 Geometry", "1948 Wood Shop" ]>> <<set $classlinks to [ "go to English", "go to Gym", "go to History", "go to Vocal Music", "go to lunch", "go to Spanish", "go to Geometry", "go to Wood Shop" ]>> <<elseif $sched == "secret girl schedule">> The SECRET GIRL schedule. The school doesn't know you're a Zeta, and you're trying to hide it. You swap out the most high-risk classes for some alternative. <<set $classlist to [ "1948 English", "1948 Marching Band", "1948 History", "1948 Vocal Music", "CYCLE", "1948 Spanish", "1948 Geometry", "1948 Wood Shop" ]>> <<set $classlinks to [ "go to English", "go to Marching Band", "go to History", "go to Vocal Music", "go to lunch", "go to Spanish", "go to Geometry", "go to Wood Shop" ]>> <<elseif $sched == "pussyboy schedule">> The PUSSYBOY schedule. The school knows you're a Zeta, your classmates also know, so you're going to end up substituting a few hyper-masculine or hyper-feminine classes for some alternates. Gym > Pep Squad Wood Shop > Home Economics <<set $classlist to [ "1948 English", "1948 Stenography", "1948 Pep Squad", "1948 Vocal Music", "CYCLE", "1948 Spanish", "1948 Geometry", "1948 Home Economics" ]>> <<set $classlinks to [ "go to English", "go to Stenography", "go to Pep Squad", "go to Vocal Music", "go to lunch", "go to Spanish", "go to Geometry", "go to Home Economics" ]>> <<elseif $sched == "girl schedule">> The GIRL schedule. Standard class list for when the player is a girl (either born that way, or in secret identity mode). <<set $classlist to [ "1948 English", "1948 Stenography", "1948 Gym", "1948 Vocal Music", "CYCLE", "1948 Spanish", "1948 Bookkeeping", "1948 Home Economics" ]>> <<set $classlinks to [ "go to English", "go to Stenography", "go to Gym", "go to Vocal Music", "go to lunch", "go to Spanish", "go to Bookkeeping", "go to Home Economics" ]>> <<elseif $sched == "dickgirl schedule">> The DICKGIRL schedule. The school knows you're a Zeta, your classmates also know, so you're going to end up substituting a few hyper-masculine or hyper-feminine classes for some alternates. <<set $classlist to [ "1948 English", "1948 Marching Band", "1948 History", "1948 Vocal Music", "CYCLE", "1948 Spanish", "1948 Bookkeeping", "1948 Wood Shop" ]>> <<set $classlinks to [ "go to English", "go to Marching Band", "go to History", "go to Vocal Music", "go to lunch", "go to Spanish", "go to Bookkeeping", "go to Wood Shop" ]>> <<elseif $sched == "secret boy schedule">> The SECRET BOY schedule. The school doesn't know you're a Zeta, and you're trying to hide it. You swap out the most high-risk classes for some alternative. <<set $classlist to [ "1948 English", "1948 Stenography", "1948 Pep Squad", "1948 Vocal Music", "CYCLE", "1948 Spanish", "1948 Bookkeeping", "1948 Home Economics" ]>> <<set $classlinks to [ "go to English", "go to Stenography", "go to Pep Squad", "go to Vocal Music", "go to lunch", "go to Spanish", "go to Bookkeeping", "go to Home Economics" ]>> <<endif>> <<endif>> CLASS LIST BOOKKEEPING is taken by GIRLS, DICKGIRLS and SECRET BOYS. The equivalent of GEOMETRY. ENGLISH is universal. All students take this. GEOMETRY is taken by BOYS, PUSSYBOYS and SECRET GIRLS. The equivalent of BOOKKEEPING. GYM is taken by BOYS and GIRLS. HISTORY is taken by BOYS and PUSSYBOYS. Equivalent of STENOGRAPHY. HOME ECONOMICS is taken by GIRLS, PUSSYBOYS and SECRET BOYS. Equivalent of WOOD SHOP. MARCHING BAND is only taken by DICKGIRL and SECRET GIRL schedules. Either the player is a known Zeta living openly, or a secret Zeta trying to hide. Equivalent of PEP SQUAD. PEP SQUAD is only taken by PUSSYBOY and SECRET BOY schedules. Either the player is a known Zeta living openly, or a secret Zeta trying to hide. Equivalent of MARCHING BAND. SPANISH is universal. STENOGRAPHY is only taken by GIRL and SECRET BOY schedules. Equivalent of HISTORY. VOCAL MUSIC is universal. WOOD SHOP is taken boy BOYS, DICKGIRLS and SECRET GIRLS. Equivalent of HOME ECONOMICS. <<endsilently>><<if $page == 0>><div class="indent">True to her word, Mom returned the castor oil, her all-purpose remedy for any kind of stomach ailment, and she made you drink two spoonfuls. It means you'll have to spend the next several hours close to the toilet, and that makes you reconsider the idea of playing sick. You can't keep this up forever or you'll have to sleep in the bathroom until you turn eighteen.</div> <div class="indent">Apart from that, however, she leaves you to your own devices. At eight-thirty, she announces that she's leaving to drive $sibnick to school, which starts a little later than yours. "And then I'll go to the grocery store," she calls up the stairs. "If I'm making chicken soup, we'll need a few things."</div> <div class="indent">"Thanks, Mom!" you call back.</div> <div class="indent">"If you're feeling up to it," she says, "you might have a hot bath while I'm out. I find that helps me sometimes."</div> <div class="indent">"Okay!" You feel strange shouting, as if Mom is going to recognize some change in your voice.</div> <div class="indent">But she doesn't say anything about it. A few minutes later and you hear $sib thundering down the stairs, then back up to retrieve her forgotten satchel, then back down again. The front door closes with a click. You hear the sound of Mom's old Packard starting fitfully to life. It drives away.</div> <div class="indent">The house falls eerily silent.</div> --[[go check yourself in the hall mirror|1948 Skip First Day][$page to 1]] --[[sneak downstairs for some breakfast|1948 Skip First Day][$page to 2]] <<set $seeing to [3]>><<display "LastSeen">><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">You haven't really had a proper chance to do this. A brief survey, if that, in the bathroom. Now that the house is yours and there's no danger of anyone walking in on you, you rush to the full-length mirror hanging at the top of the stairs. <<if $startsex == "female">>You have a vanity mirror, but it's fairly small, and it's set at desk height.<<else>>You have a small facial mirror for combing your hair, but it's small and doesn't show much.<<endif>> The mirror in the hall is better.</div> <div class="indent">You peel off your <<if $startsex == "female">>nightgown, your girdle, and all your layers of underwear,<<else>>pajama top and bottom, kick off your underwear, <<endif>> and get a good look at what you're dealing with.</div> <<if $startsex == "female">><div class="indent">You're a boy, all right. There's no doubt about it. Your whole body says so.</div> <div class="indent">Your shoulders are about the same width, maybe a bit broader, and you have slightly more muscle. There's even a faint trail of hairs on your belly leading downward from your navel. And hairs on your shoulders. And hairs on your forearms. If you didn't know better, at first glance you'd say this was the face of a teenage boy. But it's still you. You frown at your face closely, running your fingers on your chin. No signs of stubble, but maybe just a few wipsy hairs on your upper lip.</div> <div class="indent">And the penis, of course. It hangs there, getting in the way, a shaft and a hanging sack containing your testicles, sitting there like a new student in class you've never met before. It's hard to stand in the usual way, feet close, thighs pressed together. You feel pinched up, like your balls need a little room to breathe. When your feet are spread apart, it's much more comfortable.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">You're a girl, all right. There's no doubt about it. Your whole body says so.</div> <div class="indent">Your shoulders are a fraction more narrow, and your arms seem to have lost some muscle. They look like pipestems. You weren't all that strong before, but now you look practically anemic. The wisps of chest hair that you had been carefully cultivating are gone, as is the hair on your lower belly. Even the hair on your arms is finer and fainter than before. And your nipples seem prouder. Puffier. Your chest, never in the league of a Charles Atlas to begin with, seems oddly squishy.</div> <div class="indent">Your hands are a tiny bit smaller and more slender. Not so much that you'd notice unless you knew what to look for. Your chin seems less prominent, your jaw more delicate. If you didn't know better, at first glance you'd say this was the face of a teenage girl. But it's still you. You frown at your face closely, running your fingers on your chin. No signs of stubble. None at all. Not even those telltale little hairs on your upper lip.</div> <div class="indent">And your cock is missing, of course. It used to just //be// there, like an old friend, whenever you glanced at yourself. Now it's absent, like a student suddenly missing from class who leaves an empty desk behind. There's nothing there except a small breeze between your legs that makes you feel peculiarly vulnerable. If you stand with your feet close and your thighs pressed together, that feeling is a little less bothersome.</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">"Okay, $name," you tell your naked reflection. "Now what?"</div> --[[take a bath|1948 Skip First Day][$page to 3]] <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 2>><div class="indent">You've been ravenously hungry ever since you woke up. It's time for some breakfast.</div> <div class="indent">Checking to make sure the coast is clear, even though you're positive that Mom has already left, you creep down the stairs. There's no sign of anyone, so you relax and head for the kitchen.</div> <div class="indent">There's a little Malt-O-Meal left on the stovetop, although all the rest of the breakfast dishes have been scrubbed and tucked away in the drainage rack beside the sink. You manage to eat some — cold, unfortunately — and that helps a little. Now you don't feel quite so empty.</div> <div class="indent">The remains of Dad's morning newspaper are strewn about the kitchen table. All the sections have been separated, folded backward, and turned this way and that. This is usually how he leaves the newspaper in the morning. Mom has a look through the headlines and flips through the classified ads, then she tidies it away. Eventually the newspaper ends up in the firewood storage bin next to the kindling.</div> <div class="indent">As you glance over the newspaper, the word //polio// catches your eye.</div> --[[check newspaper about polio|1948 Skip First Day][$page to 4, $path.push("polio newspaper")]] <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 3>><div class="indent">Since your mother mentioned it, you decide a hot bath might help you throw off some of this worry. Watch out, lady Eagles!<<endif>><<endif>></div> <div class="newspaper">_name <<if $path.includes("friend date")>>even says $nom[$soppgen] has kissed a $girlboy[$sgen] or two! Of course, $nom[$soppgen] was too shy to admit who the lucky $girlboy[$sgen] was.<<set $path.push("kiss and tell")>><<else>>says $nom[$soppgen] has not had the nerve to kiss any $girlsboys[$sgen] yet. Of course, that may change by the Homecoming dance in three weeks' time!<<endif>></div> <div class="newspaper">The exact nature of _name's medical condition is not yet known. Research among local physicians shows there are a number of patients in the Puget Sound area with a similar condition, which is being called Dimorphic Zeta Chromosome Syndrome. It is not yet known how many of them attend Renton Comprehensive, but according to rumor the number may be as high as <<if $path.includes("known zeta")>>three<<else>>two<<endif>>.</div> <<else>><div class="indent">The article is on the third page, in the Features section. It reads:</div> <div class="newspaper">''NEW CONDITION FOUND AT RCHS''</div> <div class="newspaper">A strange new medical condition that causes <<if $startsex == "male">>boys to become girls<<else>>girls to become boys<<endif>> has been discovered right in our very own Renton Comprehensive High School.</div> <div class="newspaper">Mr Fordyce, the principal of RCHS, confirms that at least <<if $path.includes("known zeta")>>three<<else>>two<<endif>> students at our school have been identified as having this new medical condition, which is previously unknown to science. According to rumor around the school, the number may be even higher!</div> <div class="newspaper">The staff of the "Aerie" has been unable to identify any of these students on the record, but rest assured, fellow Golden Eagles: they're out there.</div> <div class="newspaper">One local physician, Dr Malcolm Heard, said he was personally aware of several cases of Dimorphic Zeta Chromosome Syndrome, but due to his Hippocratic Oath he was unable to reveal their names, or which high schools they attended.</div> <div class="newspaper">When asked if this condition posed a danger to the public, Dr Heard said more research would be needed.</div> <div class="newspaper">The Zeta Chromosome condition has been traced to an experimental polio vaccine that was produced in the 1930s by the University of Washington, which some parents of Renton Comprehensive students may have participated in. If you turn into a girl or a boy tomorrow, blame your old man!</div> <div class="newspaper">According to Dr Heard, the condition appears to lie dormant for many years until it "awakens," in his words, in the person's teenage years. This means there could be many more victims out there that don't even know who they are.</div> <div class="newspaper">Meanwhile, the number of identified Dimorphic Zetas continues to grow in the Puget Sound area. Keep your eyes open, fellow Eagles! The next victim of this queer new contition might be sitting next to you!</div><<set $path.push("other zetas")>> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">$fr arrives with a lunch for each of you: a hamburger in aluminum foil, a turkey sandwich wrapped in wax paper, and two apples. "It was a madhouse in there," $nom[$fgen] says. "So, what's it say?"</div> <div class="indent">When you are done with the article, you hand the newspaper over to $fr and start eating your turkey <<if $path.includes("open school interview") or $path.includes("anonymous school interview")>>sandwich, grumbling to yourself. The article wasn't accurate //at all.// You don't remember saying half of those things, and the whole thing was written in such a sensational way, trying to engage the reader, that it makes your recent struggles look like a joke.<<else>>sandwich. The article has given you a lot to think about.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent"><<if $path.includes("open school interview") or $path.includes("anonymous school interview")>>"Oh boy," $fr says when $nom[$fgen] finishes the story. "That's worse than I thought."<<else>>"Interesting," $fr says when $nom[$fgen] finishes the story. "What do you think about that?"<<endif>></div> <<set $page to 0>><<display "1948 Newspaper Talk">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 16>><div class="indent">You wait for the operator to connect you to ELliot-6251.</div> <div class="indent">"Hello?" $fr asks.</div> <div class="indent">"Look, I think you're right," you say. "I think I should try to switch before that fight tomorrow."</div> <div class="indent">"Mmm, okay," $fr says uncertainly. "Before you say anything, I didn't promise this was a //good// idea."</div> <div class="indent">"I know," you say. "But it's a chance I'm willing to take."</div> <div class="indent">"Fair enough," $fr says. What've you got?"</div> <div class="indent">"English, with $eng."</div> <div class="indent">"I've got <<if $fgen == 3>>History.<<else>>Stenography.<<endif>> That's not too far away. How about we meet up near the music department and find a piano practice room?"</div> <div class="indent">"Perfect," you say. "I'll be there."</div> <<display "CleanReturn">><<set $path.push("friend emergency date")>> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 17>><div class="indent">You only have five minutes between first and second period, so you run as fast as you can to the short hallway between the gymnasium and the weight room. It's around a short bend, so nobody is going to see you unless they're actually heading into the weight room. Also, it's pretty convenient.</div> <div class="indent">"I made it," $fr says, panting and puffing.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, yes," you say. "Come on, we have to hurry."</div> <div class="indent">You put your hands to $poss[$fgen] waist and pull $acc[$fgen] in for a kiss, and $nom[$fgen] returns your embrace. It's a little awkward, what with your book satchel and $poss[$fgen] heavy coat, but you make do.</div> <div class="indent">You aren't even able to feel much more than a tingle of awakening inside you, when $fr breaks way. "Is anything happening" $nom[$fgen] asks you.</div> <div class="indent">"No," you say. "Fiddlesticks. I was hoping this would work! I had extra clothes here and everything."</div> <div class="indent">"Nuts," $nom[$fgen] says. "Maybe we try again later?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yeah, maybe at lunch," you say. "Sorry about that -- I'll see you later!" Then you're dashing off down the hall toward your next class.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">><<if $sex == "male">><<set $mact.push("makeout")>><<else>><<set $fact.push("makeout")>><<endif>><<set $path.push("emergency makeout")>> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 18>><div class="indent">"Sure," you say. "We can go on a date."</div> <div class="indent">"Like this?" $nom[$fgen] asks, grinning.</div> <div class="indent">"If you want," you say.</div> <div class="indent">"Quiet," $span says to the class, to still the murmuring. "We will be choosing partners next week. There is no need to talk amongst yourselves."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 19>><div class="indent">"Not right now," you say. "I've got a lot going on."</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, sure," $fr says dismissively. "I know how crazy things are right now."</div> <div class="indent">"Quiet," $span says to the class, to still the murmuring. "We will be choosing partners next week. There is no need to talk amongst yourselves."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 20>><div class="indent">"I don't think I'm into $girlsboys[$fgen]," you say apologetically. "Not right now, at least."</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, sure," $fr says dismissively. "I meant ... you know, sometime. I know how crazy things are right now."</div> <div class="indent">"Quiet," $span says to the class, to still the murmuring. "We will be choosing partners next week. There is no need to talk amongst yourselves."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 21>><div class="indent">"I don't think I'm the right shape for that right now," you say apologietically.</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, sure," $fr says dismissively. "I meant ... you know, sometime. I know how crazy things are right now."</div> <div class="indent">"Quiet," $span says to the class, to still the murmuring. "We will be choosing partners next week. There is no need to talk amongst yourselves."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\THE ZETA CHROMOSOME From 1930 to 1938, a researcher named Horace Kind attempted to produce a polio vaccine, using as test subjects a number of high school students in the area of King County, Washington. These experiments were ultimately unsuccessful in preventing polio, but they had an unexpected side effect. The children of those vaccine test subjects were born with a new kind of dimorphic sex chromosome, designated Z or Zeta. The Zeta chromosome can transform its shape and chemical nature from X to Y and back, changing an XX into an XY pair, or vice-versa. It rarely does so when this would result in a non-viable combination, such as YY, although this is mostly because I (the author) don't want to complicate things unnecessarily. Some other author who is better versed in genetics can tackle this variation. What the Zeta chromosome actually _does_ apart from change biological sex is up to the player. The intention is to permit the player to play through each of the scenarios and keep track of the player's decisions. The changes wrought by the Zeta chromosome and the way these affect society depend on what the player chooses. THE CHOICES There are five basic axes along which the player's choices matter. Major decisions from each story are added to the saved calculations, which persist across multiple playthroughs. (The player will have the option to wipe the history and start fresh.) * Sex. Does the Zeta chromosome only affect AFAB or AMAB? If the player always selects "male" to start, then Zeta becomes a condition only of children born and identified as male at birth. The choice of starting character could become constrained to that single sex. If the player chooses a mixture of male and female starting points, the game will allow both AMAB and AFAB characters to be Zetas. * Social. Does society accept or reject these changes? If the player is more open, more forthright, more bold, and more accepting of the changes, society will shift in that direction. Zetas will get more good publicity as role models emerge on early radio and newsreels, and later in the golden age of television. If the player is more secretive or shameful about these changes, and pushes less against the grain, then society will have a less-good view of Zetas; and Zetas of the future are more likely to conceal their natures or face consequences. The world thus becomes the kind of place that the player creates. * Orientation. Does the Zeta chromosome change your orientation or sex drive? If the player chooses to engage in new sexual behaviors (for instance, going from hetero male to hetero female), then at least sometimes the Zeta chromosome makes this happen. If the player chooses to remain with one sexuality (eg, hetero male to lesbian female) then the Zeta chromosome is _not_ known for changing orientation. The game will keep track of how often this happens and make assumptions about later characters' sexuality. * Mental. Does the Zeta chromosome change the way people think? Is the brain itself altered, setting aside matters of orientation? Do Zetas think differently in each state? * Procreation. Since a Zeta always changes during sex, it makes normal methods of proliferation for the Z chromosome impossible. Therefore, one of two methods must be favored. Either the chromosome is _transmissible_ (you can catch Zeta from somewhere), or the chromosome is _lockable_ (your form can be fixed in one state somehow, either temporarily or permanently). All of the above contribute to the kind of world the player creates. If Zetas are looked down upon, and the state is Lockable, then Zetas may try to fix themselves in a favored shape. If Zetas are disfavored and the condition can be caught, then the condition might be inflicted on others out of spite, and transgender people may secretly aspire to catch the condition. And so on. THE ZETA WAVES <<if $day == 3>><<if $page == 0>><<set $newknowns to [45]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">You head for the principal's office to get your new schedule. Nobody seems to take much notice of you, which is good, but it's still a little creepy to realize that people you know don't seem to recognize you at all. There's not a single friendly wave, not a single smile, no nods of recognition, no little moments of friendly eye contact. You're a stranger.</div> <div class="indent">The principal's office is a quiet little nest of interconnected offices with a tall counter up front and several desks arranged behind where secretaries answer phones, go over paperwork, and speak with other new students -- like you, apparently.</div> <div class="indent">Eventually, one of the secretaries finds you at the counter. You recognize her as Mrs Decker, the mother of one of the $girlsboys[$oppgen] in your scout troop. "Can I help you?" she asks you, with a polite, blank smile.</div> <<if $openzeta == true>><div class="indent">"I'm here for my schedule," you say quietly. "I'm $name. We called and talked to the principal last night."</div> <<if $sex == "female">><div class="indent">Mrs Decker blinks in surprise, taking in your makeup, your wig, your yellow cardigan, and your frilly blue dress. "Oh! Oh, yes, Mr Fordyce said—" She shakes her head. "I'm sorry, I didn't recognize you at all. Well, I wouldn't, would I?"</div> <<elseif $sex == "male">><div class="indent">Mrs Decker blinks in surprise, taking in your boyishly short haircut, your slacks, your blazer, and your broader physique. "Oh! Oh, yes, Mr Fordyce said—" She shakes her head. "I'm sorry, I didn't recognize you at all. Well, I wouldn't, would I?"</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">"I am a //little// different," you concede. "It's this condition I have."</div> <div class="indent">"Does it have a name? What happened?"</div> <div class="indent">"I'm not sure, ma'am," you say. "We'll find out when I see Dr Bennett on Monday."</div> <div class="indent">"Well, come around to my desk," Mrs Decker says, folding up part of the countertop to allow you through. "Let's get your schedule sorted out."</div> --[[follow her behind the counter|1948 Principal][$page to 1]] <<else>><div class="indent">"I'm here for my schedule," you say awkwardly. "I just enrolled yesterday."</div> <div class="indent">Mrs Decker nods at you, smiling gently. "Very good. Let me get your card and I'll show you which classes your mother asked to sign you up for."</div> --[[follow her behind the counter|1948 Principal][$page to 2]] <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">You go behind the counter. Mrs Decker folds the countertop back down behind you and leads over to her desk. There's a wooden chair with an uncomfortable slatted back beside her desk, and she directs you to sit.</div> <div class="indent">"No, no, dear," she admonishes you, seeing the way you seat yourself. <<if $sex == "female">>"Knees together. And hook your ankles together. That's more ladyl—er, I mean," she says, hesitating, "you should try to look ladylike."<<else>>"Unbutton the blazer when you sit down, or it'll just look rumpled and untidy. That's how a gentleman would—I mean," she says, hesitating, "now that you //are// one, you should try to look the part."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">She turns her attention to some long typewritten forms that have been placed under the heavy glass surface of her desk. "Here we are. First semester, 1948. Let's see..." She compares the list to your hand-written student schedule card in her other hand.</div> <div class="indent">You crane your neck to look.</div> <div class="indent">Mrs Decker whips a pencil out from behind her ear and starts to make notes on your student card. "Well, Mr $lastname — I mean Miss $lastname — er, $name. You know what I mean. How very confusing this is!" She looks flustered. "We'll have to change some of your classes around, but I think we can manage to devise a schedule for you that fits your current condition."</div> <div class="indent">She pushes your altered student card across the table. It's a half-sheet of thick cardstock with a pre-printed grid: classes down the left side, and space for grades across the middle.</div> <<if $sex == "female">><div class="indent">"We'll have to take you out of second period Gym class," she says, pointing at the card with her pencil. "Normally, the state requries you to take some kind of physical fitness class, but there //are// alternatives. I've written in Pep Squad for you, which is third period. That's one of the classes they allow us to use instead."</div> <div class="indent">"Pep Squad?"</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, yes," she says. "You'll love it. There's dance and choreography, and you do drills and routines with the marching band, you perform at the football games. It's very physical. A lot of girls your age—" She falters. "Well, anyway. It's co-ed, so there are some boys in the class too, but there's no worries about locker rooms or anything, so Mr Fordyce should approve."</div> <div class="indent">"Is there a uniform?"</div> <div class="indent">"Not for every day, just for game days. Now, since Pep Squad is third period, we had to take you out of History and put you in second-period Stenography instead. That's for taking shorthand, which is very useful for young ladies to know." She shows you some squiggles on a steno pad. "And your seventh-period class, Wood Shop, Mr Fordyce and $shop decided there might be too much lifting and carrying of wood and boards and so on, and you might prefer that we switch you into $homeec's Home Economics class."</div> <div class="indent">"I thought boys didn't have to take Home Economics."</div> <div class="indent">"Normally, no," Mrs Decker says apologetically, "but it isn't just baking cookies and sewing dresses any more. There's some home repair, too. Knowing how to fix your home appliances. You'll like it. And there's those other home skills, too, and I think every girl should—" She stops, with a polite but confused cough. "At any rate, I think that will do nicely."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<elseif $sex == "male">>"We'll have to take you out of third period Gym class," she says, pointing at the card with her pencil. That's one of the classes they allow us to use instead."</div> <div class="indent">"Marching Band?"</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, yes," she says. "You'll love it. She goes down the list. Follow the pretty green tiles in the floor, then keep going until you smell the cafeteria. "Let us know if you have any questions, and welcome to Renton Comprehensive High School."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 3>><<display "SetBack">><div class="indent">$pep marches you into the principal's office and right around the counter without stopping. The school secretary, Mrs Decker, rises from her desk with a flustered look. "Earlyse!" she cries. "What's this? A boy -- wait, isn't that --"</div> <div class="indent">"Buzz Gabe," $pep says sternly. "And call the staff nurse. I've got to get back to class. This one's got Zeta Syndrome. A pretty bad case, I'd say."</div> <div class="indent">Mrs Decker puts her silk scarf up over her nose and mouth. Over the top of the scarf, her eyes are huge. "Right away," she says, muffled, and presses a desk intercom. A distant buzzing sounds. "Gabe, get out here right away. We've got another student with Zeta in the office."</div> <div class="indent">"Be there in a minute," a voice crackles back.</div> <div class="indent">$pep regards your altered physique with a frown. "I think it goes without saying that we can't have you on the Pep Squad in this condition," she says. "I'm not saying I couldn't //use// two boys on the squad, but I need to be able to plan our routines, and I //don't// want what just happened, happening again during a performance."</div> <div class="indent">"I can't go back to gym class like this, can I?" you ask. "Please don't make me do that. The girls would laugh."</div> <div class="indent">"No, that's true," $pep says thoughtfully. "We can't have you in your gym class looking like //this.// There would be a riot." The corners of her mouth twitch in amusement. "There's a Health and Hygiene class, but Mrs Whitmire shows ... er, certain films to the girls, so I don't think you'd fit in there either. Frankly, I don't think there //is// a class for you."</div> <div class="indent">Mr Fordyce, the principal, arrives. He's polishing his silver spectacles on the end of his tie. "Another Zeta, Irma? We do seem to be finding a lot of them since that article got printed. I told you it was a bad idea to let them run that story."</div> <div class="indent">"Gabriel, I have to take $name out of Pep," $pep says in a brisk voice. "I can't have this happening to any of my other girls. Do you know anywhere else we can put her?"</div> <div class="indent">"I've talked to the state, and we can waive the Phys Ed requirements if the student is on an athletic team," the principal says. He doesn't bother looking you over; he's seen this before. "I think we give him to $geom and put him on the wrestling team for now."</div> <div class="indent">"Wrestling isn't a class," $pep says.</div> <div class="indent">"No, you're right. He'll have to go to the meetings after school. During class time, Mr $lastname can lift weights, I suppose. Put it down as independent study." For the first time, the principal glances at you. "Are you doing okay? You don't look very surprised."</div> <div class="indent">"No, it's ... happened before," you admit.</div> <div class="indent">"I thought as much. Well," he sighs, turning back to $pep and Mrs Decker. "Fetch the nurse, although I don't really see why. Confirm this case and get it in the record, but for God's sake, try to keep a lid on it."</div> <div class="indent">When the principal has gone, $pep leaves for class and Mrs Decker invites you to her desk to adjust your schedule.</div> <div class="indent">"Where do I go now?" you ask.</div> <div class="indent">"You can't go anywhere wearing //that.// I'm going to call your mother and have her bring in a change of clothes," the secretary says. "After that, you're going back to class."</div> <<set $secret to false>><<set $oops to true>><<set $path.push("oops")>><<set $cleanlink to "wait for your mother">><<set $currentclass to 3>><<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 4>><<display "SetBack">><div class="indent">$band escorts you kindly to the principal's office and raps on the counter with his knuckles. The school secretary, Mrs Decker, rises from her desk with a flustered look. "Oscar!" she cries. "What's this? A girl -- wait, isn't that --"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, I'm afraid so," $band says. "My first case of Zeta. Looks like a bad one, I'm guessing."</div> <div class="indent">Mrs Decker puts her silk scarf up over her nose and mouth. Over the top of the scarf, her eyes are huge. "Let me get Gabe. And the nurse, too," she adds in a muffled voice. She presses a desk intercom. A distant buzzing sounds. "Gabe, get out here right away. The triplet who led you here, whichever one it was, joins her sisters on the lowest bench, where they huddle their heads and giggle about something.</div> <div class="indent">The class is under the instruction of a youthful, athletic woman named $pep, who is so slender and has such muscular calves that she practically floats on air when she walks. She's very lean and has a no-nonsense attitude.</div> <div class="indent">"Welcome to Pep Squad, ladies," she says briskly, adding, "//and// gentleman. We have a cheer king on the squad, at last. The first one I've seen since before the war. Well done. Thanks for joining us." She holds up her hands to still the sudden rush of tittering conversation. "Girls, girls. Before 1939, cheerleaders were //all// men. Until the draft. They all went away to war, and that left open some space for we ladies to take over. Let's all be welcoming to Mr Bailey, shall we?"</div> <div class="indent">Floyd Bailey essayed a little wave from the front row of the bleachers.</div> <div class="indent">"Now as I'm sure you know," $pep goes on, "this is a substitute for your regular Gym class, but it is not open to any and all. There isn't the space. Instead, I will be evaluating each of you during the first few weeks of class for enthusiasm, ability, balance, poise, and participation. Those of you who do not make the Pep Squad will have to go back to your regular physical education class, or find a new alternative. Is that clear to everyone?"</div> <div class="indent">Everybody nods, especially you. It's hard to imagine showing up in your regular Gym class and getting undressed in front of all the $girlsboys[$oppgen] there. You //can// imagine the teasing that would follow, however.</div> <div class="indent">"Excellent," $pep says. "All right, I'm going to go down my list. When you hear your name, call out 'present!'"</div><<set _lst to [$lastname, "Lenford"]>><<set _lst to _lst.sort()>><<if _lst[0] == $lastname>><<set _first to 0>><<else>><<set _first to 1>><<endif>> <<if $openzeta == true>><<set $path.push("SO informed")>><<set $path.delete("SO no contact")>><<set $fact.push("workout")>><<if _first == 0>><div class="indent">As $pep calls out your name, you hear a squeal from the crowd of girls. "My goodness," a voice says. "$name? I didn't know //you// were doing Pep Squad this year!"</div> <<elseif _first == 1>><div class="indent">When $pep calls out '$so Lenford' you aren't really paying attention, but then she announces //your// name and there's a sudden squeal from the crowd of girls. "My goodness," a voice says. "$name? I didn't know //you// were doing Pep Squad this year!"</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">But then $sonick //sees// you in your frilly blue dress and stockings and your yellow cardigan, and her mouth falls open. You can visit after class."</div> <<elseif $openzeta == false>><<set $mstrengthbonus += 3>><<set $shoulderbonus += 1>><<set $mact.push("workout")>><<set $newknowns to [28]>><<display "NewKnowns">><div class="indent">You wait for your name to be called out. $pep reads it, and you respond with 'present.'</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, hey," says a girl in the front called Judith Young. "Good to see you again! I didn't know you were doing Pep Squad this year."</div> <div class="indent">"It's kind of a last-minute decision," you say weakly.</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">$pep gets everybody on the gym floor doing warm-up stretches. She demonstrates each one at the front of the group, delivering stern warnings about what happens to girls who don't stretch properly before athletic activity. "You could get hurt, so pay attention," she says. "If you pull a muscle, you won't be able to perform at the games."</div> <div class="indent">It takes all of the first lesson to go over stretching exercises and safety rules. Since you're completely new to this, she takes special delight in correcting your form on the stretches. "From now on, when you girls get to class, I want you to start right away on stretches. Don't wait for me. I want us to be ready to go as soon as possible, so we get the maximum amount of time."</div> <<if $openzeta == true>><div class="indent">After class, $so corners you, with the Morris triplets backing her up. "How come you didn't tell me you were coming to class like this?" she asks irritably.</div> <div class="indent">"I heard $nom[$oppgen] has some kind of condition," one of the triplets says from behind her.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, June, me too," says another. "It's so something new, the doctors don't even know what it is. You never know who it's going to be next!" She looks gleefully wicked for a moment, then calms herself down. "I woke up like this yesterday morning."</div> <div class="indent">"Yesterday //morning//?" she demands. <<if $path.includes("shameful TG")>>"Is that why you were out sick on the first day of school, when I //know// you weren't sick the night before?<<else>>"Is that why you didn't come find me on the first day of school?<<endif>> Why didn't you call me? "I'm so sorry, $so, I really am, but there was so much going on."</div> <div class="indent">"All right, I suppose." She looks at you with lingering suspicion.</div> <div class="indent">"Maybe should talk about it later," you say. "Call you tonight?"</div> <div class="indent">At last, $so relents. Tonight, right after dinner?"</div> <<endif>>\ <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 4>><div class="indent">After completing warm-ups for the day, $pep claps her hands. I have lists of measurements we need! If anybody doesn't know how to measure yourself, don't ask your neighbor -- ask me. We have to get the uniforms right for the first game and there's no time to send any back to the seamstress for adjustments." She has a very formal mid-Atlantic accent and always speaks with precision.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 34>>The Geometry teacher is also the boys' PE teacher. He's ex-Army and believes in the practical application of mathematics: maps, forward observation of enemy position, and triangulation.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 35>>She's healthy, fit, and seems to be made of leather. She's been the girls' gym teacher for years and takes no excuses.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 36>>You remember him as a rumpled man in an untidy jacket that has patches on the elbows. He teaches history, but he looks like he came from there, too.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 37>>$homeec is a young teacher with a peppy Midwestern twang to her voice and an abnormal amount of enthusiasm for domestic sciences.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 38>>The Spanish teacher calls herself Señora Blanco, although everybody knows she's not really from Mexico. More likely she's from Southern California.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 39>>If ironing board covers could teach stenography, that would be $steno. Her dresses are boring, her voice is boring, and the way she stands is dull-O-rama.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 40>>Until recently, the only Vocal Music instructor for the school district at all grade levels. She's got an assistant now, so she's less frazzled, but only slightly so.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 41>>The grizzled old shop teacher lost two fingers on his right hand. He claims it happened during the war. The rumor at the school is that he was trying to repair his roof while drunk, fell off, and tried to catch himself on the way down with the claw of his hammer. Either way, it's pretty impressive.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 42>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 43>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 44>>Mrs Decker is the school secretary. No matter how harried she becomes by student requests, she is always very kind. Nevertheless, students tend to be terrified of her, because she mails the grade cards.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 45>>A perennial bully who roams the 10th grade and pushes people around. He's never been all that happy to see you. Or anybody else, for that matter.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 46>>A perennial bully who roams the 10th grade and finds people to pick on. She's never been all that happy to see you. Or anybody else, for that matter.<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 47>>(no description yet)<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 48>>(no description yet)<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 49>>(no description yet)<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 50>>(no description yet)<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 51>>(no description yet)<<endif>>\ <<if $page == 52>>(no description yet)<<endif>>\<<if $gen gt 0>><<link "Cast" "Dramatis "Whitfield, Alice"]>> <<if $startsex == "male">> <<set $castlist.push("Zimmerman, Ronald")>> <<else>> <<set $castlist.push("Young, Judith")>> <<endif>> <<set _castlist2 to [$lastname + ", " + $sib, "Warnock, Mr", "Decker, Mrs"]>> <<set $castlist to $castlist.concat(_castlist2)>> <<set _castlist3 to ["King, Vernon", "King, Vivian", "Mckinney, John", "Norton, Dale", "Porter, Melvin", "Cook, Lorraine", "Parsons, Bonnie", "Todd, Sylvia"]>> <<set $castlist to $castlist.concat(_castlist3)>> <<endif>> <<endsilently>><<silently>> <<for _i to 0; _i lt $newknowns.length; _i++>> <<set _thisknown to $newknowns[_i]>> <<if not $knownpeople.includes(_thisknown)>> <<set $knownpeople.push(_thisknown)>> <<endif>> <</for> <<endif>> <<endsilently>><<if $page == 0>><div class="indent">"We'll pick you two," you tell Ray and Harold.</div> <div class="indent">"That's right," Ray gloats at the two girls. "You stink. Go find some other team!"</div> <div class="indent">"That's not very nice, Ray," Harold says mildly.</div> <div class="indent">You go up to $eng's desk to see what scenes are available. Unfortunately, there's only one. It says: "Act IV, Scene i. Rosalind, disguised as a shepherd named Ganymede, tries to teach Orlando about love by __pretending__ to be Rosalind and asking Celia to marry them."</div> <div class="indent">"Aw, fiddlesticks!" grumbles Ray when he sees the list. "It's a love scene. I //knew// nobody was going to want to do that one."</div> <div class="indent">"You could be Jaques," Doris points out. "He leaves on the first page."</div> <div class="indent">"Then I don't get no lines at all."</div> <div class="indent">"Celia doesn't have many lines."</div> <div class="indent">"Celia's a //girl,//" says Ray in a withering voice.</div> <div class="indent">"Fine, then," you say, fed up with Ray's complaints. "You can be Rosalind, the girl pretending to be a boy pretending to be a girl. Or you can be Orlando, the man who falls in love with her."</div> <div class="indent">"Orlando's the hero?" he asks, his eyes narrowing suspiciously. "All right, I'll be Orlando."</div> <div class="indent">"What part do you want?" Harold asks Doris politely.</div> <div class="indent">She looks at him blankly. "What do you mean? Celia is the only girl left."</div> <div class="indent">"And you?" Harold asks, looking to you. <<if $openzeta == true>>"Maybe you should play Rosalind, given ... you know, your condition.<<else>>You'd be better at playing Rosalind than me, I bet.<<endif>> But I will, if you'd rather be Jaques. It doesn't matter to me."</div> --<<link "play Rosalind" "1948 English Talk">><<set $path.push("Rosalind")>><<set $page to 2>><</link>> --<<link "play Jaques" "1948 English Talk">><<set $path.push("Jaques")>><<set $page to 3>><</link>> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">"We'll pick you two," you tell Alice and Arlene.</div> <div class="indent">"Well, sucks to you, too," Ray mutters, leading Harold away.</div> <div class="indent">"This will be excellent," Alice says happily. "I'll be the director, of course. I know this show backwards. We should all try to memorize our parts, don't you think? And I bet we could find some costumes, too."</div> <div class="indent">"Let's just pick a scene first," Arlene says, irritated. "Before they're all gone."</div> <div class="indent">You go up to $eng's desk to see what scenes are available. Unfortunately, there's only one. It says: "Act IV, Scene i. Rosalind, disguised as a shepherd named Ganymede, tries to teach Orlando about love by __pretending__ to be Rosalind and asking Celia to marry them."</div> <div class="indent">"Nobody took this scene? Or Orlando, even."</div> <div class="indent">"Why would you want to play a boy's part?" Arlene asks acidly.</div> <div class="indent">"Well, one of us has to play a boy," Alice says, brushing the matter aside. "As director, I nominate Doris to play Celia, <<if _fcount == 3>>$currname to play Orlando, Arlene to play Rosalind,<<else>>$currname to play Rosalind, Arlene to play Orlando,<<endif>> and I'll be Jaques. He's hardly in the scene, so that way I get to direct. What do you say?"</div> <<if _fcount == 3>>--<<link "agree to play Orlando" "1948 English Talk">><<set $path.push("Orlando")>><<set $page to 4>><</link>> --<<link "you'd rather play Rosalind" "1948 English Talk">><<set $path.push("Rosalind")>><<set $page to 5>><</link>> <<else>>--<<link "agree to play Rosalind" "1948 English Talk">><<set $path.push("Rosalind")>><<set $page to 5>><</link>> --<<link "you'd rather play Orlando" "1948 English Talk">><<set $path.push("Orlando")>><<set $page to 4>><</link>> <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 2>><div class="indent"><<if $appsex == "female">>Ray barely registers your request, having already turned to sneer at Harold. "Let's do less fighting and more reading."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 6>><div class="indent">Your group starts reading the scene, which begins with Jaques and Celia and Rosalind. After a page, Jacques exits and you enter as Orlando.</div> <div class="indent">It's fun reading the scene. Buried beneath the antiquated language is a lot of flirting between Rosalind and Orlando. You get to declare how wonderful Arlene is, how virtuous and wise, and Arlene gets to give you advice on how to flirt with girls — and the advice is mostly about kissing and getting Orlando out of his suit. Since Rosalind is a girl, dressed as a boy, pretending to be a girl, it's a bit confusing, but Arlene plays her part with conviction.</div> <div class="indent">"And wilt thou have me?" you read.</div> <div class="indent">"Ay, and twenty such!" says Arlene.</div> <div class="indent">"Pray thee, marry us," you say, turning to Doris.</div> <div class="indent">"I cannot say the words," Doris reads, while offstage, Alice is exhorting her silently //more feeling!// "Will you, Orlando, have to wife this Rosalind?"</div> <div class="indent"><<if $sex == "female">>There are a few quiet //ooh-la-la// noises from the students in the audience.<<else>>There are a few quiet catcalls from the students in the audience.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"I will. I take thee, Rosalind, for wife," you read aloud.</div> <div class="indent">There would have been some more juvenile snickering had $eng not interrupted your group. "Very well done," $eng says. "Rosalind has some things to say about unfaithful wives, Orlando declares he must leave for two hours, and Rosalind tells her friend Celia that she's deeply in love with Orlando."</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, deeply," drawls Arlene with heavy irony, looking at you as if you're some kind of insect.</div> <div class="indent">"Next group!" says $eng, as your group goes back to your respective seats.</div> --[[tell Arlene she did well|1948 English Talk][$page to 9, $path.push("praise Arlene")]] <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 7>><<if $path.includes("Alice and Arlene")>><div class="indent">Your group starts reading the scene, which begins with Jaques and Celia and Rosalind. After a page, Jacques exits and Arlene enters as Orlando.</div> <div class="indent">It's fun reading the scene. Buried beneath the antiquated language is a lot of flirting between Rosalind and Orlando. Arlene declares with great passion how wonderful you are, how virtuous and wise, and you get to give her advice on how to flirt with girls — and the advice is mostly about kissing and getting Orlando out of his suit. Since Rosalind is a girl, dressed as a boy, pretending to be a girl, it's a bit confusing for the audience, but you've had experience with this sort of thing.</div> <div class="indent">"And wilt thou have me?" Arlene pleads.</div> <div class="indent">"Ay, and twenty such!" you tell her.</div> <div class="indent">"Pray thee, marry us," she says, turning to Doris.</div> <div class="indent">"I cannot say the words," Doris reads, while offstage, Alice is exhorting her silently //more feeling!// "Will you, Orlando, have to wife this Rosalind?"</div> <div class="indent"><<if $sex == "female">>There are a few quiet //ooh-la-la// noises from the students in the audience.<<else>>There are a few quiet catcalls from the students in the audience.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"I will. I take thee, Rosalind, for wife," Arlene reads aloud.</div> <div class="indent">There would have been some more juvenile snickering had $eng not interrupted your group. "Very well done," $eng says. "Rosalind has some things to say about unfaithful wives, Orlando declares he must leave for two hours, and Rosalind tells her friend Celia that she's deeply in love with Orlando."</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, good," drawls Arlene with heavy irony, looking at you as if you're some kind of insect.</div> <div class="indent">"Next group!" says $eng, as your group goes back to your respective seats.</div> --[[tell Arlene she did well|1948 English Talk][$page to 9, $path.push("praise Arlene")]] <<display "NextClassLink">> <<elseif $path.includes("Harold and Ray")>><div class="indent">Your group starts reading the scene, which begins with Jaques and Celia and Rosalind. Jacques has a few long speeches as he and Rosalind make friends. Then, after a page, Jacques exits and Ray enters as Orlando.</div> <div class="indent">Reading opposite Harold is fun. The characters of Rosalind and Jaques are becoming friends, and beneath the antiquated langauge you can really feel that they're a lot alike.</div> <div class="indent">"I prithee, pretty youth," Harold reads aloud, "let me better acquainted with you."</div> <div class="indent">'They say you are a melancholy fellow," you reply.</div> <div class="indent">"I am so," Harold says. "I do love it better than laughing."</div> <div class="indent">"Those that are in extremity of either are abominable fellows, and betray themselves to every modern censure worse than drunkards."</div> <div class="indent">"Why, 'tis good to be sad and say nothing."</div> <div class="indent">"By my faith," you say to Harold, "you have great reason to be sad. I fear you have sold your own lands to see other men's. Then to have seen much and to have nothing is to have rich eyes and poor hands."</div> <div class="indent">"Yes," Harold says mournfully. "I have gained my experience."</div> <div class="indent">"And your experience makes you sad," you read. "I had rather have a fool to make me merry than experience to make me sad."</div> <div class="indent">Shortly after that, Harold exits as Jaques and Ray stumbles in, his eyes glued to the page. <<if $sex == "male">>He cannot look at you as he reads line after stilted line that is meant to sound light-hearted and flirtacious.<<elseif $sex == "female" and $openzeta == true>>His eyes are fixed resolutely on the words, and he refuses to look at you as he reads. He struggles through line after stilted line that is meant to sound light-hearted and flirtacious, but ends up sounding like a man reading a train schedule.<<else>>He keeps trying to ogle you as he fumbles through his lines. Orlando is meant to sound flirtacious, but Ray just sounds like he picked up a stutter, because he can never find his place again after looking up.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"Pray, thee ... marry ... us," Ray reads in a flat, unconvincing voice, struggling over the text.</div> <div class="indent">"I do not know the words," Doris says, as Celia, managing to convey profound skepticism of the prospect. The class laughs.</div> <div class="indent">Finally, mercifully, $eng calls a halt to the madness. "Yes. Yes, do practice your oral recitation, Harold," she says. "The rest of you, well done. Next group!"</div> <div class="indent">Your group breaks up and heads for your respective seats.</div> --[[tell Harold he did a good job|1948 English Talk][$page to 10, $path.push("praise Harold")]] <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 8>><div class="indent">Your group starts reading the scene, which begins with Jaques and Celia and Rosalind. Jacques has a few long speeches as he and Rosalind make friends. Then, after a page, Jacques exits and Ray enters as Orlando.</div> <div class="indent">Reading opposite Harold is fun. The characters of Rosalind and Jaques are becoming friends, and beneath the antiquated langauge you can really feel that they're a lot alike.</div> <div class="indent">"I prithee, pretty youth," you read aloud, "let me better acquainted with you."</div> <div class="indent">'They say you are a melancholy fellow," Harold replies.</div> <div class="indent">"I am so," you say. "I do love it better than laughing."</div> <div class="indent">"Those that are in extremity of either are abominable fellows, and betray themselves to every modern censure worse than drunkards."</div> <div class="indent">"Why, 'tis good to be sad and say nothing."</div> <div class="indent">"By my faith," Harold says with great sympathy, "you have great reason to be sad. I fear you have sold your own lands to see other men's. Then to have seen much and to have nothing is to have rich eyes and poor hands."</div> <div class="indent">"Yes," you read. "I have gained my experience."</div> <div class="indent">"And your experience makes you sad," he says. "I had rather have a fool to make me merry than experience to make me sad."</div> <div class="indent">Shortly after that, you exit as Jaques and Ray stumbles in, his eyes glued to the page. He cannot look at Harold as he reads line after stilted line that is meant to sound light-hearted and flirtacious.</div> <div class="indent">"Pray, thee ... marry ... us," Ray reads in a flat, unconvincing voice, struggling over the text.</div> <div class="indent">"I do not know the words," Doris says, as Celia, managing to convey profound skepticism of the prospect. The class laughs.</div> <div class="indent">Finally, mercifully, $eng calls a halt to the madness. "Yes. Yes, do practice your oral recitation, Harold," she says. "The rest of you, well done. Next group!"</div> <div class="indent">Your group breaks up and heads for your respective seats.</div> --[[tell Harold he did a good job|1948 English Talk][$page to 10, $path.push("praise Harold")]] <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 9>><div class="indent">"Good job," you tell Arlene on the way to your desk. The next group is still trying to get organized. Someone needs to borrow a copy of the lines.</div> <div class="indent">To your surprise, Arlene isn't her usual sour self. <<if $openzeta == true>>She actually gives you a smile.<<else>>She actually gives you a half-hearted smile.<<endif>> "Thanks," she says. <<if $path.includes("Rosalind")>>"I really like this scene. I think it's because I understand Rosalind. She can't speak the truth ... I don't know, it just really touches me."<<else>>"I really like this scene. It speaks to me. Boy meets girl ... I don't know, it just seems to speak to me."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"No wonder you did so well," you say.</div> <div class="indent">"And so did you," she says.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 10>><div class="indent">"Good job," you tell Harold on the way to your desk. The next group is still trying to get organized. Someone needs to borrow a copy of the lines.</div> <div class="indent">Harold is a baseball player, not the kind of guy who would ever <<if $startsex == "male">>talk to you,<<else>>look twice your way,<<endif>> but to your surprise, he flashes a charismatic grin. "Hey, thanks," he said. <<if $path.includes("Rosalind")>>"I guess I really click with Jaques. He's seen things, right? And he's got experiences. I feel like I really understood him, so acting him wasn't all that hard."<<else>>"That was more fun than I thought it would be. Playing a girl, I mean. Those old-time actors probably got really good at it. Not so hard, is it?"<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"You sure made it look easy," you say.</div> <div class="indent">"And so did you!" he answers.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 11>><div class="indent">You wait around outside the door to the English classroom, waiting to see who turns up.</div> <<if $path.includes("praise Arlene")>><div class="indent">To your surprise, it's Arlene Stewart, one of your reading partners. Her usual frosty look of condescension has been replaced with an uneasy smile. There is a copy of //The Aegis// under one arm.</div> <div class="indent">"I just wanted to say," Arlene says, "that I thought — I really liked reading with you. For class yesterday."</div> <div class="indent">"Thanks," you say. "You did very well."</div> <div class="indent">"Thank you," she says. Plucking up her courage, she seizes the newspaper under her arm and holds it out to you. Your interview is showing on the cover. "Did you ... did this //really// happen to you?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes," you say, "but Floyd did get some of the details wrong. Other than that, it's more or less true."</div> <div class="indent">"And you just ... admitted it to everyone?"</div> <div class="indent">"I suppose I did. I don't think it's really my //fault// that I was born with this thing, whatever it is."</div> <div class="indent">"No!" she says, agreeing with sudden passion. "No! No, of course. It isn't //your// fault that this happened. It just //happened.// Right?"</div> <div class="indent">You lower your voice. "Have you been having this problem too?"</div> <div class="indent">Arlene hesitates. "I—I know someone who is." Her reluctance could not have been clearer if she had written it on her forehead. "Just ... someone I know. She turns into a boy sometimes. She's never told anyone."</div> <div class="indent">"Except you."</div> <div class="indent">"Right," she says, turning pink. "Except me. It's only happened a couple of times. I — she's been trying to keep it secret all summer."</div> <div class="indent">"I understand," you say. <<if $path.includes("shameful TG")>>"I tried to hide it, too. I stayed home the first day of school.<<else>>"I tried to hide it, too. I dressed as a $girlboy[$sgen] the first day of school.<<endif>> Then I realized it wasn't going to just ... stop, you know? So we decided to tell the school, and I'd just come to school as I am."</div> <div class="indent">"You told the //school?//" she asks, eyes going wide.</div> <div class="indent">"Of course. As long as I meet the dress code, they don't care. I had to change my schedule a bit, to get out of gym."</div> <div class="indent">"Uh huh, right. Makes sense." Arlene seems to be clinging to your words like a woman who's trying not to drown. "And ... and your parents?"</div> <div class="indent">"They're okay with it. Mom took me to see the doctor, and we found out what it is."</div> <div class="indent">"From a medical experiment on polio?" she asks, and she turns her eyes to the page again, skimming madly. "A vaccine. Your mother had a vaccine, and you were born like this."</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, that's it exactly."</div> <<if $sex == "male">><div class="indent">Arlene Stewart heaves a sigh of relief. "Wow. So it really is just ... not anybody's fault." Her nervous face creases into a smile. "Thank you. Thanks for staying to talk to me."</div> --[[offer to talk more with Arlene|1948 English Talk][$page to 12, $path.push("meet Arlene")]] <<else>><div class="indent">Arlene Stewart heaves a sigh of relief. "Wow. So it really is just ... not anybody's fault." Her nervous face creases into a smile. "Thank you. Thanks for staying to talk to me. Would, uh ..." She goes pink again. "Would you like to talk some more about it? Later, I mean?"</div> --[[agree to talk more with Arlene|1948 English Talk][$page to 12, $path.push("meet Arlene")]] <<endif>>\ <<elseif $path.includes("praise Harold")>><div class="indent">It's Harold Giles, one of your reading partners. He doesn't look like a confident athlete now; he has uncertainty written all over him.</div> <div class="indent">"So," he begins. "Was that ... was that //you// in the newspaper yesterday?"</div> <div class="indent">You nod. "That was me."</div> <div class="indent">"And it's all true?"</div> <div class="indent">"It's true enough," you say. "Floyd make up some of it."</div> <div class="indent">"Hmm, yeah," Harold says, his brows folding in unaccustomed thought. "So that actually happened to you?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes. Last Wednesday. Why?"</div> <div class="indent">Harold leans in and lowers his voice. "It happened to me too, last month. It was during the baseball season. I woke up one day and I was a girl."</div> <div class="indent">"What did you do?"</div> <div class="indent">"Nothing. I played baseball," Harold says. "I didn't tell anyone. And two days later I changed back, and it hasn't happened since. Until I saw your article in the paper, I thought I was the only person it ever happened to."</div> <div class="indent">"There's more," you say. "Apparently it's going around."</div> <div class="indent">He nods. "Yes, I read your interview. Gosh, do you know how //glad// I am to know I'm not the only one?"</div> <div class="indent">"I can imagine!"</div> <div class="indent">"So they just ... they //let// you come to school however you want?"</div> <div class="indent"><<if $sex == $startsex>>"Sure. As long as I meet the dress code."<<else>>"Well, yes," you say, gesturing to your outfit. "As long as I meet the dress code."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"I bet if I tried that, I'd get kicked off the baseball team," he says glumly.</div> <div class="indent">"Maybe," you say. "I had to change my gym class. But you know, women play baseball, too. There's that All-Women's Baseball League, right? I'm sure you could play if you wanted to."</div> <div class="indent">"Yeah, maybe. I'd sure feel pretty peculiar going out on the field in a skirt."</div> <div claass="indent"><<if $startsex == "female">>"You'll get used to it," you say. "But I'm with you — I'd rather wear trousers out there."<<else>>"I'm with you," you say with a grin. "Skirts are all right, but trousers are much better for sports."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">Harold looks cheered up with your camaraderie. "Hey, do you think we could get together some time and talk more about this?" he asks. $openzeta == true>> <<set $path.push("anonymous school interview", "tenor")>> <<endif>> <<endsilently>> <<endif>>\<<if $page == 0>><div class="indent">You sit down on the sidewalk in your uniform and wait for the others to arrive.</div><<set $classing to 12>><<display "LastClass">> <<if $startsex == "male">><div class="indent">You see John Mckinney arrive on a bicycle, and wave to him, and he sits down with you to play jacks while you wait. He's nearly made Eagle Scout as well, and you and he have been competing for years to see who can get the most badges.</div> <div class="indent">A little while later, Dale Norton hops out of the back of his old man's beat-up farm truck and slouches over to greet you, slapping dust from his uniform. At least now you can understand why he always shows up looking so dirty.</div> <<elseif $startsex == "female">><div class="indent">You see Lorraine Cook ride up on her bicycle with the white basket, looking fresh and well preened. You've known her for years through the scout program, and you've always supported one another as you rack up the badges. Lorraine sits down beside you to wait, sanding at her nails with an emery board.</div> <div class="indent">Sylvia Todd arrives a little while later, trudging up the street with her face all red. She's always looked a little out of breath to you, which she puts down to asthma, but which her mother insists is baby fat, and not enough exercise.</div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">At last, the time for the scout meeting draws near, and you stand up, dust yourself off, straighten your uniform, and enter the house.</div> --[[continue|1948 Scouts Chat][$page to 2]] <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">You knock on the door and wait for $scout to answer. The noisy clatter of a vacuum cleaner is rattling around inside the house, so you knock harder. After a little while, the noise dies away, and $nom[$sgen] answers and peers out at you. "$name? You're a little early, but come on in."</div> <div class="indent">"I know you're still setting up," you say apologetically, "but I wanted to make sure to talk to you about ... the condition I told you about last night. On the phone."</div> <div class="indent">$nomcap[$sgen] looks at you blankly for a moment, then reacts. "Oh, right, yes," $scout says, glancing around as if searching for Communist spies lurking in the front garden. "Yes, I remember. You know ... why don't you come in for a moment?"</div> <div class="indent">You step inside into the front hallway, and $scout closes the door behind you. "To be honest, you're not the only one of my scouts who has had this problem recently," $nom[$sgen] admits in a low voice. "I don't want to name any names or anything, but we had an incident earlier this summer. We tried to keep it quiet, because we didn't want the poor ... the poor scout to be embarrassed or anything, at least any worse than — well, anyway," $scout says with an uncomfortable laugh. "We're not total strangers to this condition."</div> <div class="indent">"So do you know what it is?"</div> <div class="indent">"I'm afraid not," $scout says sadly. "The scout's mother was going to talk to a specialist, but I never heard anything."</div> <div class="indent">"So what am I going to do?" you ask. "I can't exactly stay in <<if $startsex == "male">>Boy<<else>>Girl<<endif>> Scouts if I'm a $girlboy[$gen], can I?"</div> <div class="indent">"No, the rules are pretty firm about that," $scout says. "But I've talked with <<if $startsex == "male">>$fscout, who runs a Girl Scout troop, and she<<else>>$mscout, who runs a Boy Scout troop, and he<<endif>> said there wouldn't be any problem taking on a new scout starting next week. You know, if your condition persists."</div> <div class="indent">"But how would I earn my <<if $startsex == "male">>Eagle Scout badges?"<<else>>Curved Bar badges?"<<endif>> you ask.</div> <div class="indent">"We're working something out between us," $scout says. "Some of the badges are similar, and you might not have to start completely from scratch. You'll be familiar with a lot of the things they do over there. And you're very bright, and maybe this won't last very long, and you'll be back over here before you know it."</div> <div class="indent">That doesn't sound all that promising, but you thank $scout for trying.</div> --[[wait for the meeting to start|1948 Scouts Chat][$page to 0]] <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 2>><div class="indent">The meeting is taken up by the last-minute organizing details of <<if $startsex == "male">>the fishing and camping trip<<else>>the cabin retreat<<endif>> coming up the following weekend.</div> <div class="indent">"If you haven't had your permission slips signed, be sure to bring them next week," $scout tells the group. <<if $startsex == "male">>"We're going to load up the packs on Friday night, and get an early start on Saturday, around seven o'clock. We'll arrive by ten and distribute the packs, one for each boy. We'll draw straws for who has to carry the Army tent, and we'll trade off carrying it: twice on the way in, and twice on the way out. It'll be a two-hour hike, so get plenty of rest."<<else>>"We're going to load up the car on Friday night, and get an early start on Saturday, around seven o'clock. We'll arrive by ten and unload everything into the cabin. There will be a list of chores at the cabin, and you'll all need to sign up for three of them: one meal, one chore inside, and one chore outside."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"Will there be badges we can earn?" asks one scout.</div> <div class="indent">"Of course," $scout smiles. "There's going to be lots to do, and I'll be checking people off for any badges you happen to earn while you're there. Now, I'm going to need two volunteers <<if $startsex == "male">>to be trail safety monitors. You'll carry the first-aid kits and the trail maps and you'll be in charge of making sure every scout makes it to the camping site. Anyone?"<<else>>to be house monitors. You'll be in charge of making sure the chores get done, making sure every girl has a place to sleep, and keeping an eye on the wood stoves so it doesn't get cold. Anyone?"<<endif>></div> <<if $sex == "male">>--[[volunteer|1948 Scouts Chat][$page to 3, $mheightbonus += 5, $shoulderbonus += 1, $superbonus.push("volunteer")]] --[[let someone else do it|1948 Scouts Chat][$page to 4, $superbonus.push("let someone else")]] <<elseif $sex == "female">>--[[volunteer|1948 Scouts Chat][$page to 3, $superbonus.push("volunteer")]] --[[let someone else do it|1948 Scouts Chat][$page to 4, $fheightbonus += 5, $hipbonus += 1, $superbonus.push("let someone else")]] <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 3>><div class="indent">You raise your hand to volunteer. One good thing about scouting is that leadership positions have never intimidated you.</div> <<if $path.includes("tell scouts")>><div class="indent">But $scout doesn't seem to be impressed, possibly because $nom[$sgen]'s still thinking about your condition. "Yes, excellent," $nom[$sgen] says, sounding slightly less than enthusiastic. "Very good. We can talk about it more this week. I'll tell <<if $startsex == "male">>$fscout<<else>>$mscout<<endif>> about your willingness to chip in, and maybe that'll be enough to put in a good word for you over there. Excellent," $scout says, pointing at you. "Thank you, $name. That's what I like to see. Who wants to be my second monitor? Anyone?"</div> <div class="indent">You feel a little guilty. Everybody's going to be relying on you next weekend, and you're not sure whether you're going to be capable of handling the job. You hope nobody finds out.</div> <<endif>>\ <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 4>><div class="indent">Leadership positions have never intimidated you. This is the kind of thing you'd normally be first in line for. There's always a distinct whiff of antiseptic about him, and possibly of gin. You're not sure how old he is, but Mom always says he was the doctor who helped her deliver you (and $sibnick), so he must be in his fifties.<<endif>> He smiles when he sees you and asks how you've been.</div> <div class="indent">When you've stammered out an answer, he asks you to be seated on his exam table, and then he conducts a brief exam: eyes, ears, mouth, and throat. Dixie assists him by taking your pulse, your temperature and your blood pressure, and making notes on a clipboard when he mutters things like "pupils equal and reactive to light" and "negative maxillary lymph nodes."</div> <<if $sex == $startsex>><div class="indent"><<if $path.includes("call doctor")>>"You were definitely $gender[$soppgen] when I came by and examined you on Wednesday,"<<else>>"I thought your mother said on the phone that you presented as $gender[$soppgen],"<<endif>> he says. "That seems to be no longer the case. Is that correct?"</div> <div class="indent">"Uh, yes," you say. "It happened <<if $path.includes("SO all the way") or $path.includes("friend all the way")>>on Friday night."<<else>>after I went to bed on Friday night."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"After your date on Friday?" he asks.</div> <div class="indent">"Yes. How did you know—"</div> <div class="indent">He looks at you pointedly over his spectacles. I'm your doctor, and I'm trying to get to the bottom of this. I won't tell her anything that isn't medically relevant. Privacy is our watchword." He adjusts his glasses, waiting expectantly. "Well?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes. We kissed, a little."</div> <div class="indent">He nods somberly. "That's good news. Yes, I said good news. That means we can definitely be sure that your condition is not completely unknown."</div> <div class="indent">"You know what I have?" you ask, with some relief. After a length telephone conversation in the other room, Dr Bennett returns. "Let me ask you a question. Did you happen to be spending any time on Tuesday with, let's say, <<if $startsex == "male">>a girlfriend<<else>>a boyfriend<<endif>> or someone like that?"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes," you say.
