When Mom is settled in a chair, Dr Bennett clears his throat. "I have a preliminary diagnosis for $name's current condition, and there's good news," he says. "At least we know what the condition //is.// It's called Diphormic Zeta Chromosome Syndrome. It's been seen in a couple of cases before, and we think we have established a vector of transmission."</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, thank heavens," Mom says. "Where did $nom[$sgen] get this from?"</div> <div class="indent">"$nomcap[$sgen] got it from you, actually," the doctor tells her.</div> <div class="indent">"Me? That's absurd. I've never — you've been my doctor for //years,// I've never had anything happen to me like this."</div> <div class="indent">"I'm afraid it's <<if $path.includes("call doctor")>>true," Dr Bennett says. "When $name called me on the phone and told me $poss[$sgen] symptoms, it put me in mind of a study I had read about. <<if $path.includes("polio newspaper")>>Then $nom[$sgen] reminded me about some strange side effects that have been resulted from the Kind vaccine trials. I pulled your file, Leah, and //you// were a participant in that vaccine trial when you were seventeen."<<else>>I couldn't remember where I'd seen it, but then I found an article in the newspaper that brought it all back to me. There have been some strange side effects as a result of the Kind vaccine trials. I pulled your file, Leah, just to check, and it turns out //you// were in that trial when you were seventeen."<<endif>><<else>>very likely," Dr Bennett says. "I'll have to pull your file to check, Leah," he says to your mother, "but this may be a side effect from the Kind vaccine trials. If I recall, //you// participated in that study when you were seventeen."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"Yes," she says, flustered. Maybe Mom finds it as strange as you do when people call her //Leah.// "I remember that. They lined us up and gave us an injection, and then they followed up with us for a year afterward. I didn't get polio myself, but some of the other kids in my class did."</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, the vaccine was a failure in that respect," Dr Bennett agrees. "But there was something else that happened. Either it created — or awakened, we don't know — a new kind of chromosome production in the subject's gametes. Sperm and egg cells," he adds, for clarity. "Normally, men and women have either an XY or an XX pair. The Kind vaccine stimulated a new kind of chromosome, which we call the Z chromosome. It has dimorphic properties, allowing it to take a form similar to an X or a Y chromosome. It can hide for years. So when you participated in that vaccine study, Leah, it affected only your egg cells, and it allowed the Z chromosome to pass along to your children."</div> <div class="indent">Mom's hand leaps to her throat. "Children? Then $sib has it, too?"</div> <div class="indent">"It seems that this is the case," Dr Bennett says, nodding gravely. "She may yet be too young for the Z chromosome to become activated, which is why her first transformation has not yet occurred. Dr Kind, who is still at the University of Washington, thinks it takes a surge of hormonal activity to first 'awaken' the Z chromosome, after which it becomes much more active. Every time the patient experiences a surge of hormones, the Z chromosome responds by changing shape. This causes the patient's body to rapidly transform from male to female, and vice-versa."</div> <<set $page to -1>><<display "1948 Doctor Chat">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 2>><div class="indent">"Not yet," Dr Bennett admits. "It's still very new. The vaccine trials went on from 1931 to 1938. After that, the trials were canceled when it was determined there was no protective effect against polio. And, of course, it's only just now that we're starting to see patients who are old enough and mature enough for the Z chromosome to manifest itself."</div> <div class="indent">"I hope somebody is working on it," Mom says.</div> <div class="indent">"I'm sure there is someone out there. I'm afraid there's still so much about the Z chromosome that we just don't know. It could be years."</div> <<set $page to -1>><<display "1948 Doctor Chat">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 3>><div class="indent">"No, there a number of patients in the Puget Sound area who have Dimorphic Zeta Chromosome Syndrome," the doctor assures you. "Most of the patients are in the Seattle area, with a few in the outlying areas, because the vaccine trials were done here through the University of Washington. And since people generally stay fairly close to where they were brought up, that's why you find many of those patients in this general region."</div> <div class="indent">"Like who?" you want to know. "Do any of them go to my school?"</div> <div class="indent">"I couldn't tell you that," he answers. "Remember our watchword is privacy."</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, I //see.// So that's why nobody has heard of it yet," Mom says in dawning realization. "You can't tell anyone."</div> <div class="indent">"That's right. We can try to publish our findings, of course, but the national medical journals are still skeptical it's a real syndrome at all. They probably assume we've all made clerical mistakes or something. I suppose in a few more months or years we'll start seeing more and more patients, and then they'll have to pay attention. The vaccine trial went on for seven years."</div> <div class="indent">"And then what happens?" Mom asks. "Is $name going to pass it on to $poss[$sgen] children, too? Am I supposed to expect grandchildren who just ... keep changing whenever they want?"</div> <div class="indent">"We don't know. This may not be an inheritable trait. Given the long delay before the Z chromosome becomes active, it could be fifteen or twenty years before we'll see a second wave of Dimorphic Zetas crop up."</div> <<set $page to -1>><<display "1948 Doctor Chat">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 4>><div class="indent">"Not as far as I know, no," Dr Bennett says. "This doesn't seem to be some kind of traditional disease process, like a bacterium or a virus. That means it's not like the common cold, which you have for a week and then you're over it. It also means — we //think// — that it can't be caught. At least not in any way we're familiar with."</div> <div class="indent">"So we're safe?" Mom asks.</div> <div class="indent">"The odds of that are good, yes."</div> <div class="indent">"So I don't have to worry about $name and $sib going to school," she goes on, exploring the limits of the horrors she must face. "We won't have their friends coming down with this, too. We won't have to pull $acc[$sgen] out of school."</div> <div class="indent">"No. No, I wouldn't recommend that. If you find that $name's school — it's Renton Comprehensive, yes? — if they give you any trouble, give them my number. There doesn't seem to be any physical danger posed by this condition. Not to students whose parents weren't in the trial, anyway."</div> <<set $page to -1>><<display "1948 Doctor Chat">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 5>><div class="indent">"Yes, absolutely," Dr Bennett says, and reaches for his notepad. "And feel free to have the school call my nurse if they have any questions. You //are// telling the school, yes?" he asks, looking up from his writing.</div> <div class="indent"><<if $path.includes("known zeta")>>"Yes, we already told them,"<<else>>"We haven't said anything,"<<endif>> Mom says.</div> <div class="indent">"As I said, I don't mind communicating with the school staff — in a general way, mind you, not about any patient in particular — and reassuring them that everything seems very safe. Awkward, perhaps, and a little bit peculiar for one's social life, but otherwise there isn't any danger."</div> <div class="indent">Mom takes the note and tucks it away into her purse.</div> <<set $page to -1>><<display "1948 Doctor Chat">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 7>><div class="indent">"So far, we find that Dimorphic Zetas start off fairly androgynous," Dr Bennett explains. "That means neither particularly male, nor particularly female. When the Z chromosome first awakens, it starts to exert a strong influence on your hormonal development. This can cause your male side to become bigger, taller, stronger, and more masculine, and your female side to become smaller, weaker, and more feminine. We're not entirely certain what causes this, but it may be psychosomatic in some fashion. That means it could be controlled by the subconscious mind. You turn into the kind of man, or woman, that you think that you //ought// to. And, of course, we have found that the longer you remain in one form or another, the more pronounced it will become over time."</div> <div class="indent">"Is there any way to make it stop?" you ask.</div> <div class="indent">"I'm afraid not," he answers. "You're at a time of your life when your body is producing a lot of hormones, and it's bound to cause your Z chromosome to trigger — on its own, even."</div> <div class="indent">"So if I stay a $girlboy[$sgen], it won't be as bad," you conclude.</div> <div class="indent">"I think you may be correct. But this effect will soon settle down. The Z chromosome only strongly affects your form for about the first thirty days. After that, your male and female sides will likely stop changing so much." He coughs lightly. "At least, that's what the literature says."</div> <<set $page to -1>><<display "1948 Doctor Chat">> <<endif>>\ALL THE PATH VARIABLES THAT CAN BE SET Alice and Arlene: English team admit dating: it's $finc on next transformation)<<endif>> * Height penalty: $fheightbonus * Strength penalty: $fstrengthbonus * Activity bonus: $cupsizebonus * Physique bonus: $hipbonus __ Technical __ * Save version: $version<<display "SetBack">><<if $page == 0>><<if $sex == "female">><<set $deltaf to $fem - $lastfem>><div class="indent">You climb out of bed to check yourself in the vanity mirror. Your face seems the same as it ever was, and certainly clearer than yesterday — no little wispy hairs on your upper lip, for starters. Your hands are small and delicate again. Your feet seem like they'll fit in your shoes.</div> <div class="indent">It's so hard to tell. Maybe it's just your imagination playing tricks on you. //Did I really just change back exactly as I was?// you ask yourself, peering at your reflection. //Or am I seeing things?//</div> <div class="indent"><<if $ht lt 172>>You've definitely shrunk a little. Your arms are shorter — you check by measuring your arm against the sleeve of your old nightgown, hanging in the closet. Even when you reached to open your closet door, your wrist barked painfully into the knob, like it was suddenly too high.<<else>>You're pretty sure you've shrunk a tiny bit, but maybe not quite enough to measure. The room just seems wrong, like it's a bit too large now.<<endif>> <<if $cupsize lt 2>>Maybe your breasts have grown a little bit, too. You heft them experimentally. They never really did develop the way other girls' boobs did. Maybe now they have, just a tiny bit?<<else>>You can clearly tell you've got a little more bounce going on up top. Your boobs never expanded beyond your basic AA-cup bra before, but now as you heft them experimentally in your hands, they do seem like they have more weight to them. An A cup, maybe?<<endif>></div> <<if $fhair lt 45 and $fhair gt 5>><div class="indent">And then there's the hair. Your mom cut it all off on Thursday to better disguise you as a boy, but it seems to have grown back <<if $unit == "imperial">>an inch<<else>>two centimeters<<endif>> longer than before. It's still //boyish,// sure, but it's definitely not your previous length.</div> <<endif>>\ <<elseif $sex == "male">><<set $deltam to $masc - $lastmasc>><div class="indent">You climb out of bed to check yourself in your little mirror by the door. Your face seems the same as it ever was — maybe a few more tiny whiskers on your upper lip, but that's about it. Your hands are a bit bigger and stronger, and your feet seem a bit more substantial.</div> <div class="indent">It's so hard to tell. Maybe it's just your imagination playing tricks on you.</div> <div class="indent"><<if $ht gt 170>>You've grown during the night. Your arms //definitely// longer, because you can compare them to the sleeves of the pajama top you were wearing on Tuesday night. Did it always fit this way? And when you reached for the knob on your closet door, your knuckles barked painfully into the knob, like somebody had moved it slightly lower.<<else>>It certainly //feels// like you've grown a tiny bit taller. You're almost positive that your shoulders are wider. It must be.<<endif>> <<if $strength gt 50>>And you seem to have more muscles than you had before. It's hard to explain. You feel //thicker.// Stiffer, maybe a little.<<else>>And you wonder if your muscles didn't grow just a little bit, too. You're not even sure if you can feel any difference, but isn't it possible there was, just a little?<<endif>></div> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 5>><div class="indent">Then you hear the sound of your mother rapping on your bedroom door. "Rise and shine!" she calls. "It's a big day today." She //always// says it's a big day, even when it's an ordinary weekend with no plans. Perhaps it's because she's averse to letting you sleep in. "Come on, get up! Breakfast is ready. After that, I'm taking you to your scout meeting."</div> <div class="indent">"I'm up, Mom," you reply.</div> <div class="indent">"Good!" Her voice is already fading down the hall. "Let's get moving. Lots to do today!"</div> <<set $cleanlink to "get dressed">><<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\ <<if $day == 8>><div class="indent">Mom is right. You're going to have to find some way to take care of this yourself.</div> <<set $cleanlink to "get dressed">><<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">You take the unfamiliar black razor and start applying it to your cheeks and chin. It is characterized by a rapid onset of muscle weakness resulting in an inability to move. Polio strikes quickly, on the order of hours or days.]</div> <div class="aside">[Many cases of polio (70%) display no symptoms. A quarter of infected patients have mild flu-like symptoms. Most debilitating are the symptoms of post-polio syndrome, which can last years after recovery from the initial infection.]</div> <div class="aside">[The virus which causes polio has been around for thousands of years, but was first identified in 1909 by the Austrian immunologist Karl Landsteiner. Major outbreaks occurred in both Europe and the U.S. during the late 19th and early 20th centuries.]</div> <div class="aside">[As of 2020, there is no known cure except prevention. The polio vaccine, developed by Dr Jonas Salk and deployed in 1955, remains the best defense, although many physicians and immunologists certainly did their best to test their own vaccines in the years leading up to it.]</div> <<back>> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 2>><div class="aside">[Swimming became part of the school curriculum around the U.S. during and after World War II. The Army and Navy discovered that many draftees were unable to swim, and this added to the burden of training soldiers for war.]</div> <div class="aside">[In addition, in many public schools in the United States, it was common for boys to swim naked and girls to be provided with a minimum cotton swimsuit by the school. These were the days before chlorinated pools, so it was thought that the excess fabric of a wet swimsuit would be a breeding ground for bacteria, possibly contaminating the pool.]</div> <<back>> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 3>><div class="aside">[Curiously, the 1940s were a good decade for fans of the frankfurter. Hot dogs were added to the presidential menu at the White House in 1939. The following year, hot dogs were first sold in pre-packaged bundles of 8 or 10 at the grocery store, rather than individually (or in strings) at the butcher shop. People started to put hot dogs in everything: in potato salad, in spaghetti, in casseroles, and even in soup. As a wartime food for busy families, hot dogs had everything: they were made from low-priority processed meats, they were cheap, and they were easy to heat up at home.] <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 4>><div class="aside">[The beginning of World War II changed the face of American education for at least a decade. As the Army drafted soldiers from all over the US, it discovered that the level of education varied greatly from one state to the next. Literacy rates varied. Some soldiers didn't have basic skills, which the Army was then compelled to teach during boot camp.]</div> <div class="aside">[Furthermore, the sudden national interest in patriotism and vigorous national defense put an end to ten years of progressive education priorities, where educators felt free to criticize American institutions and teach students about flaws in the American economy, culture and society. Instead, a robust program of civic pride was imposed on educators nationwide. Politicians felt it was vital that students //appreciated// America and supported American leadership. History and social studies were crafted to highlight American uniqueness. Dissent was suddenly (and not for the last time in history) an un-American pastime.]</div> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 5>><div class="aside">[The American education system had a very different view of high school in the 1940s. A high school diploma was often considered a terminal degree — that is, a complete education without any need to pursue further knowledge in college or at a university. Many high schools were labeled "comprehensive," meaning they were suitable for most Americans to become self-sufficient and to find gainful employment. Only about 30% of students graduated with a high school diploma, but there were many good jobs available in agriculture, road work, construction and repair that did not require one, and high school was tailored to these needs.]</div> <div class="aside">[Most high schools taught a range of vocational skills, trade skills, and home-life skills, in addition to a regimen of basic academics. Programs in Industrial Arts, such as auto shop and wood shop, were given heavy funding in order to produce mechanics and builders. Home Economics courses were taught, to give housewives practical skills in cooking, appliance repair and home budgeting. Practical business mathematics were elevated over denser texts on trigonometry and calculus. Literacy and public speaking were emphasized over literary critique. It was thought that anything more rigorous could be learned at college, for those few who required it.]</div> <div class="aside">[Throughout the 1940s and into the next decade, homework requirements were light. Most students at 10th-grade level did less than 2 hours per night. This light touch suited America's needs at the time, but it would all change in 1957 when Sputnik launched and America began to fear its students were falling behind.]</div> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 6>><div class="aside">Surprisingly, the chocolate chip cookie (or biscuit) dates to 1938. Also mentioned in this paragraph are thrift stores, which are not an anachronism. Goodwill Industries was founded in Boston in 1902.</div> <<endif>>\<<silently>> UPDATE ALL ACTIVITIES AND INCREMENT MINC/FINC DIRECTLY IF MALE The increase for being male is a flat 1 point per day. $mup += 2>> <<elseif _thism == "makeout">> <<set $mup += 8>> <<elseif _thism == "sex">> <<set $mup += 6>> <<endif>> <</for>> IF FEMALE Check for female activities. <<for _f to 0; _f lt $fact.length; _f++>> <<set _thisf to $fact[_f]>> <<if _thisf == "makeout">> <<set $fup += 11>> <<elseif _thisf == "sex">> <<set $fup += 6>> <<endif>> <</for>> The increase for being female depends how close the player is to the date of menses. <<set _weekfour = new Date($now)>> <<set _weekthree = new Date($now)>> <<set _weekonetwo = new Date($now)>> <<run _weekfour.setDate($menses.getDate() - 7)>> <<run _weekthree.setDate($menses.getDate() - 14)>> <<run _weekonetwo.setDate($menses.getDate() - 28)>> <<if $wakeupsex == "female" and $day gt 1>> <<if $now gt _weekfour>> <<set $fup to $fup + 4>> <<elseif "Eww, you kissed $acc[_cgen]?" bully asks.</div> <div class="indent">"Of course," you say. "I wasn't about to kiss //you.// I wouldn't want to make your <<if $bgen == 3>>girlfriend<<else>>boyfriend<<endif>> jealous. You do //have// one, I assume?"</div> <div class="indent">Your question is phrased so innocently that $bully can't respond with anything more than a mumble and a mutter. $posscap[$bgen] friends notice the needle buried in your kind question, and there are some sly looks among them.</div> <div class="indent">$bully looks disgruntled, and $poss[$bgen] knot of friends begins to break up and drift away from your table.</div> <<elseif $secret == true>><div class="indent">"That's very kind of you," you say. "I've always thought of myself more of a <<if $startsex == "male">>Gary Cooper,<<else>>Lauren Bacall,<<endif>> but I appreciate it."</div> <div class="indent">$bully stares at you, nonplussed. $posscap[$bgen] insult doesn't seem to have landed.</div> <div class="indent">You turn your attention back to _comp, and after a moment $bully's knot of friends breaks up and drifts away from your table.</div> <<else>>(This should only come up if the player is the original starting sex. This should be impossible on Cycle 3 of Day 4.) <<endif>>\ <div class="indent">"That was amazing," _comp says. "Sure takes care of them."</div> <div class="indent">"For now," you say.</div> <<set $seeing to [_sid, 2]>><<display "LastSeen">><<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 3>><div class="indent">"You want to fight tomorrow after school?" you ask, standing up. "Fine. I'll be there."</div> <div class="indent"><<if $startsex == "male">><<if $sex == "male" or $secret == true>>"Think you're //man// enough, do you?" $bully laughs. "Good. We'll see about that, won't we?"<<elseif $sex == "female">>"Oh, yeah, that's rich," $bully laughs. "Then we'll really see if you're //man// enough, girly-girl."<<endif>><<elseif $startsex == "female">><<if $sex == "male">>$bully laughs coldly. "Yes, that'll be amusing," she says. "We'll see if you're too much of a gentleman to hit a lady."<<elseif $sex == "female">>"Good," $bully laughs coldly. "We'll see if you're woman enough to fight your own battles."<<endif>><<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"Hit the road," you tell $acc[$bgen].</div> <div class="indent">When $bully walks away with $poss[$bgen] crowd of sycophantic friends, the rest of the crowd disperses, taking their murmurs of gossip with them.</div> <div class="indent">"I suppose you //have// to show up now," $fr says.</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 4>><div class="indent">"I'm not afraid of Zeta Chromosome Syndrome, and I'm not afraid of you," you tell $bully. "So what's your problem? Why are you attacking //me?// I didn't do anything to you. Are you really that afraid of this Zeta thing?"</div> <div class="indent">"//I'm// not afraid," $bully sneers. "I'm just afraid of freaks like you."</div> <div class="indent">"I'm sorry that you're afraid of me," you say in a kindly voice. "But that's no reason to flip out like this. I'm sure you'll be okay. It's not contagious, you know."</div> <div class="indent">"I said I'm not afraid!" $bully says, raising $poss[$bgen] voice. "You think I'm afraid of you? We'll see about that. Tomorrow, after school."</div> <div class="indent">$bully stomps off, taking $poss[$bgen] cadre of sycophantic friends with $acc[$bgen]. The crowd begins to disperse, murmuring urgently about what it had just witnessed.</div> <div class="indent">"That was a good try," $fr says. "But not quite."</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 5>><<silently>> Let us put together a list of people who are there. <<set _crowd to ["Doris"]>> English class: <<if $path.includes("meet Harold") or $path.includes("praise Harold")>> <<set _crowd.push("Harold")>> <<elseif $path.includes("meet Arlene") or $path.includes("praise Arlene")>> <<set _crowd.push("Arlene")>> <<endif>> Marching Band/Pep Squad: <<if $classlist.includes("1948 Marching Band")>> <<set _crowd.push("Alvin")>> <<elseif $classlist.includes("1948 Pep Squad")>> <<set _crowd.push("Phyllis")>> <<endif>> Geometry/Bookkeeping + Woodshop/Home Ec: <<if $path.includes("help Evelyn")>> <<set _crowd.push("Evelyn")>> <<if $classlist.includes("1948 Home Economics")>> <<set _crowd.push("Ruby", "Jo")>> <<endif>> <<elseif $path.includes("help Gerald")>> <<set _crowd.push("Gerald")>> <<if $classlist.includes("1948 Wood Shop")>> <<set _crowd.push("Ralph", "Marvin")>> <<endif>> <<endif>> <<if $startsex == "male" and $path.includes("girl schedule")>> <<set _crowd.push("Florence")>> <<elseif $startsex == "female" and $path.includes("boy schedule")>> <<set _crowd.push("Joe")>> <<endif>> <<set $fight to "none">> <<endsilently>>\ <div class="indent">The crowd of students in front of the school, just down the steps from the office, seems slightly thicker than normal. On a Friday it wouldn't be usual to see so many eager faces lining the wide, shallow steps. Most kids want to beat feet and get home as quick as they can. But not today.</div> <div class="indent">$bully is waiting there for you, halfway down the steps. Halfway to the sidewalk which leads to the safety of home.</div> <div class="indent">"There you are," $bully says, when $nom[$bgen] sees you. "I thought you might chicken out. "$nomcap[$sogen] thinks it's just //peachy.// Isn't that nice. Isn't that just the bees' knees."</div> <<elseif $path.includes("hide dating")>><div class="indent">"Oh, and telling everybody how //available// you are," $bully goes on, sneering. You'd pick on //other// people and tell them that //they're// weak, because you're a bully, and that's what you do, isn't it?"</div> <div class="indent">"Easy for you to talk," $bully drawls. You're going to have to do something.</div> --[["fight " + $acc[$bgen]|1948 Bully Chat][$page to 6, $superbonus.push("actual fight")]] --[["face " + $acc[$bgen] + " together with your " + $girlboy[$sogen] + "friend"|1948 Bully Chat][$page to 9, $superbonus.push("facedown")]] <<if $path.includes("oops")>>--[["flirt with " + $bully|1948 Bully Chat][$page to 10]] <<endif>>\ <<set $path.push("bully calls out SO", "bully calls out friend")>><<endif>><<endif>>\ <<if $page == 6>><div class="indent">There comes a time when someone is just asking to be socked in the kisser, and that time has come. <<if $startsex == "male">>You've been in a couple fights before and you've okay, <<if $sex == "male">>and you'll probably manage to hold your own here too.<<set $fight to "punch">><<elseif $sex == "female">>and even though you're a girl right now, you still remember how.<<set $fight to "scratch">><<endif>><<elseif $startsex == "female">>You've never been in a serious schoolyard fight, not like this, <<if $sex == "male">>but you're a boy now and you don't think $bully will be much of a challenge.<<set $fight to "grab">><<elseif $sex == "female">>but you're prepared to give it your all.<<set $fight to "slap">><<endif>><<endif>> <<if $strength lt 45>>Who cares if you've lost a little muscle? But this technique is clumsy, and you step left and plant one fist on the side of $poss[$bgen] head. $posscap[$bgen] eyes roll back, $poss[$bgen] goes limp, and $nom[$bgen] hits the deck face first. He opens his blurry eyes and crawls to the other rail, hoisting himself up woozily.<<elseif $fight == "grab">>You approach $bully with your hands open, prepared to use your masculine size as an advantage without intending to hurt $acc[$bgen]. $nomcap[$bgen] lunges at you, $poss[$bgen] a face a snarling mask, preparing to kick and pinch and scratch anything $nom[$bgen] can. This approach is clumsy, and you're able to seize hold of one of $bully's wrists <<if $strength gte 57>>without any difficulty at all. Her slender arm in your hand is completely captive.<<elseif $strength gte 53>>without much difficulty. She pulls at her slender arm in futility, and cannot free herself from your grasp.<<else>>with only a little difficulty. She wrenches her slender arm around, but you manage to keep your grip secure.<<endif>> You're able to use your leverage and turn her around in place, holding her with both arms from behind. $bully struggles, but can't break free. Finally, disgusted, you push her away, heaving her easily toward the opposite railing.<<elseif $fight == "slap">>You approach $bully, trying to stay wary. $nomcap[$bgen] lunges at you, $poss[$bgen] a face a snarling mask, preparing to kick and pinch and scratch anything $nom[$bgen] can. You manage to push away her grasping, claw-like hands and catch her a ringing slap across the face. Her eyes open wide, and she looks angry, but you push her backward against the rail. She hits it hard in the small of her back, then goes down on her hands and knees. Sniffing, she clings to the other stair railing and hauls herself to her feet.<<else>>You approach $bully, trying to stay wary, knowing he has an advantage of size and strength. However, as you leap at him with your hands formed into claws, it's easy to see he was unprepared for your ferocity. He might be able to bat your scratching nails away most of the time, but you still manage to slap him hard across the mouth, pinch his sensitive ear, and hit him once in the throat. He staggers away to the opposite railing and props himself against it.<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"Want to try again?" you ask, panting for breath.</div> <div class="indent">$bully tries to sneer and look superior. <<if $fight == "punch">>"I could've taken you."<<elseif $fight == "grab">>"You even //fight// like a boy."<<elseif $fight == "slap">>"I could've taken you."<<elseif $fight == "scratch">>"You even //fight// like a girl."<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">"You //lost,//" you say. "Now beat it, and leave me alone from now on."</div> <div class="indent">$bully glares at you, and hobbles down the school steps toward the sidewalk.</div> <<if $path.includes("bully calls out friend")>><div class="indent">"Way to go," $fr says, in a subdued voice.</div> <div class="indent">"Thanks!" you say, beaming. There are several intertwined triangles, their right angles marked with little squares.</div> <div class="indent">"All right," he says, "if we declare that side A has length of 3, and hypotenuse C has a length of 5, and angle alpha is congruent to angle theta, what is the length of side F?"</div> <div class="indent">The problem is easier than it looks, because $geom has drawn some unnecessary triangles, and you spot that the answer is just one Pythagorean Theorem and one ratio away. You already know the triangle formula by heart, so you know you can skip straight to the congruent triangles and cross-multiply for an answer.</div> <div class="indent">At your side, Gerald is struggling. He's worked out five squared minus three squared, and got the difference wrong.</div> <div class="indent">"Sixteen," you say under your breath. You can add the hundreds column up afterward.</div> <div class="indent">After about twenty two-digit numbers, $bkp stops reading from his list. You get to the bottom of the column, then start back up at the top and see how many extra digits you have to add into the hundreds place — and, oh, yes, the thousands place.</div> <div class="indent">"Well done!" $bkp says, pushing himself upright and reviewing your work. You spotted the trick right away: do the sums in your head. Writing down the numbers just slows you down."<<else>><<set $path.push("beat Evelyn")>>"You spotted the trick right away. Writing down the numbers just slows you down."<<endif>></div> <<display "NextClassLink">><<set $superbonus.push("win math race")>> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">$bkp leans on his desk and starts reading off numbers from a folded piece of paper, and you start copying them onto the board.</div> <div class="indent">But he talks //fast,// and soon you find you can't keep up. In fact, it's easier to add the numbers in your head and keep a running total of the last two digits. You can add the hundreds column up afterward.</div><<set $path.push("helped Evelyn")>><<if $sex == $startsex>><<set $path.push("helped Evelyn as self")>><<else>><<set $path.push("helped Evelyn as cousin")>><<endif>> <div class="indent">You glance to your right. Poor Evelyn is still copying down the numbers and hasn't begun adding anything yet. Under your breath, you murmur, "Add as you go. It's faster."</div> <div class="indent">"Ooh. Thanks," she replies.</div>\ <div class="indent">You still handily beat Evelyn to the bottom of the column of twenty numbers, going back later to fill in the hundreds digit and to place a one in the thousands place.</div> <div class="indent">"Well done!" $bkp says, pushing himself upright. "Oh, and Miss Cox has finished as well. <<if $openzeta == true and $sex == "male">>Both of you spotted the trick right away: do the sums in your head. Writing down the numbers just slows you down. "Why'd you do that?"</div> <div class="indent">"I didn't say who it was," you protest. "I just said yes. What's the problem?"</div> <div class="indent">"We always sit together, that's what's wrong," $fr says. "Someone's going to figure it out."</div> <div class="indent">"I thought you liked it."</div> <div class="indent">"I //did!// I mean, I do," $fr says, calming down a little. "I just don't want everybody to //know// about it, that's all."</div> <div class="indent"><<if $path.includes("open school interview")>>"Maybe nobody will guess."<<else>>"Nobody will. I kept my name out of it."<<endif>></div><<set $path.delete("kiss and tell")>><<set $path.push("kissed and told")>> <<set $page to 0>><<display "1948 Newspaper Talk">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 4>><div class="indent">"So you're not the only one at the school with Zeta Whatsitz," $fr says excitedly. "There's others!"</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, I saw that," you say. "At least two others. Maybe three, if they're not counting me."</div> <div class="indent">"I wonder who they are," $fr says. "Have you noticed anybody out there that's ... I don't know, acting strange? Missing lots of class?"</div> <div class="indent">"No, not really," you say, thinking. "Not that I've noticed."</div> <div class="indent">"Keep your eyes peeled," $nom[$fgen] suggests. "There could be a couple more around here, and it'd be swell to know who they are."</div><<set $path.delete("other zetas")>><<set $path.push("two other zetas")>> <<set $page to 0>><<display "1948 Newspaper Talk">> <<endif>>\<<if $page == 0>><div class="indent">After adjusting your clothes in the girls' bathroom, you return to the music room. Now that you're no longer concealing a girlish figure, you dispensed with some unnecessary layers. It's a welcome relief to feel more like yourself again. Marvin just nods at you as you get back in line with the other drummers.</div> <div class="indent">But the funny feeling doesn't go away.</div> <div class="indent"><<if $mlikesboys gte 0>>It doesn't help that you're surrounded by a variety of young men, standing tall and playing their instruments. All young and handsome. Musical. Talented hands.<<elseif $flikesboys gte 0>>It doesn't help that you're surrounded by a variety of young men, standing tall and playing their instruments. Girls are more your thing, as least while you're a boy yourself, but you remember what it was like only a few minutes ago. The members of the band are tall and broad-shouldered. Clean, handsome faces. With large hands.<<else>>It doesn't help that you're standing amid a crowd of handsome young men, and a few young women. You can practically smell the hormones in the room. <<endif>> You're in the back. There's nowhere for your eyes to look. And next week they'll be in uniforms.</div> <div class="indent">The heat in your body returns without warning, making you dizzy.</div> <div class="indent">//Wait, wait!// you think. //Oh no, not again.//</div> <div class="indent">Then it's surging through you again, making your skin blaze, making your bones creak, as if you're being compacted down into a smaller space, boiling away, being reduced. You can practically feel your hair growing and your manhood sizzling into nothingness.</div> <div class="indent">When the feeling subsides, you realize you're on your hands and knees, breathing hard. And you're a girl again.</div> <div class="indent">Tiny body. Long hair. Delicate little hands. Big bottom. And breasts poking through your shirt, because you ditched your heavy concealing sweater in your locker.</div> <div class="indent">$band is standing over you, with a look of surprise and horror. "What's this?" he demands.</div> <div class="indent">"Sir, look!" says Alvin Price, a senior. "He must have the Zeta!"</div> <div class="indent">"Zeta disease, huh?" $band asks, his look changing to a scowl. "I'm not having //that// infect my whole class. Get up, you. No, leave the drum. Come on, we're going to the principal's office. We'll call your parents and get this sorted out."</div> <div class="indent">In spite of his rough tone, he's quite gentle as he helps you to your feet. "Price?" he asks. "Keep them practicing. I'll be right back. Here's my baton."</div> <div class="indent">Alvin takes over the rehearsal, while $band leads you out of the music room.</div> --<<link "go to the principal's office" "1948 Principal">><<set $page to 3>><<set $path.push("oops marching band")>><</link>> <<display "SexSwitch">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">After changing clothes in the boys' bathroom, you return to the music room, walking tall. $band's eyes widen when he sees you, and he drops his baton without even noticing -- of course, he never loses the beat.</div> <div class="indent">When the band grinds to the end of the school fight song, $band nods in your direction. "I see that your condition is ... no laughing matter," he says. "I trust that will not happen when you are marching with the band next week?"</div> <div class="indent">"Hopefully not, sir," you answer, picking up the bass drum and slipping the strap around your neck.</div> <div class="indent">//So he's not going to hold that against me,// you think. //Thank goodness.//</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\<<if $page == 0>><div class="indent">After adjusting clothes in the restroom, you return to the gymnasium. Now that you're a girl again, you ditched those other layers and you look much more natural. $pep waves you back into your place in the choreography, and you resume your drills.</div> <div class="indent">But for some reason, the funny feeling doesn't go away.</div> <div class="indent"><<if $flikesgirls gte 0>>It doesn't help that you're surrounded by cute, petite girls with cheerful smiles and athletic bodies. Bobbing ponytails. Sparkling personalities. And you have to be //close// to them, and they're close to //you.// Touching. Lifting. Moving in unison.<<elseif $mlikesgirls gte 0>>It doesn't help that you're surrounded by cute, petite girls with cheerful smiles and athletic bodies. Shapely calves. Bouncing boobs. And you get to //touch// the girls, and they're touching //you.// You're not particularly attracted to them, at least not while you're a girl yourself, but you can remember what it was like only a few moments ago. Now the feeling is trying to surface.<<else>>It doesn't help that you're surrounded by cute, petite girls with cheerful smiles and athletic bodies. Boys are more your thing, really, but there's something about the super-charged atmosphere of a bunch of women like you.<<endif>> All the girls have one thing on their mind: the football game. Making themselves look happy and graceful and //pretty// for the boys.</div> <div class="indent">The heat in your body returns without warning, making you dizzy.</div> <div class="indent">//Wait, wait!// you think. //Oh no, not again.//</div> <div class="indent">Then it's surging through you, burning your skin, stretching your bones like someone is playing tug-of-war with your skeleton, and your muscles start to clench up like fists, and your head is breaking apart--</div> <div class="indent">When the feeling subsides, you realize you're on your hands and knees, breathing hard. And you're a boy again.</div> <div class="indent">Long legs. Strong bones. Big hands. Stubble on your face. Testing the limits of your pale blue dress.</div> <div class="indent">$pep is standing over you. "What the devil just happened to //you?//" she demands. "It's that Zeta disease, isn't it?"</div> <div class="indent">"No," you protest weakly. "I'm just--"</div> <div class="indent">$pep claps her hands briskly. "All right girls, stand back. We don't know if this is contagious and I'm not losing my whole squad. Come on, back away." When they have cleared a space around you, $pep grabs your arm and tries -- and fails -- to haul you to your feet. You're too big and solid now. "Get up," she tells you. "I'm taking you down to the principal's office. You can see the nurse, and we're going to call your parents and figure out what to do with you. Phyllis?"</div> <div class="indent">Phyllis Watson, captain of the Pep Squad, responds alertly. "Yes, ma'am?"</div> <div class="indent">"Take over while I'm gone. You know the steps. Keep them on task while I deal with this."</div> <div class="indent">"Yes, ma'am," says Phyllis, and turns at once to clap her hands together. "Let's start from the top! Who's going to step in for $name?"</div> <div class="indent">You don't see how the rehearsal goes, because $pep escorts you away from the gymnasium.</div> --<<link "go to the principal's office" "1948 Principal">><<set $page to 4>><<set $path.push("oops pep squad")>><</link>> <<display "SexSwitch">> <<endif>>\ <<if $page == 1>><div class="indent">After changing clothes in the restroom, you return to the gymnasium where the Pep Squad is still doing its drills. At first, $pep doesn't even blink when she sees you, and then she does a double-take. All the girls stop their synchronized march and goggle in your direction.</div> <div class="indent">"That's some condition you have, Miss $lastname," $pep says at last. "I assume you're not going to do that trick during our drill next week at the football game?"</div> <div class="indent">"I don't think I'd want to, ma'am," you say with a faint smile. "In front of everybody like that?"</div> <div class="indent">"That's good enough for me," $pep says, and claps her hands. "All right, girls. $name will be our second cheer king for this rehearsal and take over for Rhonda and Agnes. Next week -- well, we'll see how that goes when we get there."</div> <div class="indent">//At least she doesn't hold it against me,// you think. //I'm still on the squad.//</div> <<display "NextClassLink">> <<endif>>\<<if $page == 0>><div class="indent">You report to the principal's office and ask Mrs Decker, the secretary, what you were needed for.</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, yes," she says, rising from her desk. At the same time, a man stands up from the wooden chair opposite her desk. He's in his thirties, and has a rumpled brown suit and a dark hat, and in his hands he has a notebook. "Yes," Mrs Decker says, approaching the counter. "$currname, this is Mr Dahl of the West Seattle //Herald.// He asked to see you."</div> <div class="indent">"You can call me Elias," he says, shaking your hand. "You may know my daughter, Sophie. She goes to this same school, although she's a senior this year, so you may not. I saw the article in your little school paper the other day — Sophie brought it home, she's on the newspaper staff — and I was intrigued by your story. I made a few phone calls to some local doctors — wonderful people, of course, but there's confidentiality to think of — but they confirmed that this Zeta Chromosome Syndrome is really happening to people in this area, and I thought I'd come by to see if you'd mind doing an interview for the //Herald// as well."</div> <div class="indent">He talks very fast, as if trying to get every one of his thoughts into a single sentence so they can't escape. Nevertheless, he has an eager, sincere look about him, although slightly hunched over as he leans into the conversation.</div> <div class="indent">"Well, sure," you say. "What's the harm in that? I've told my story to Floyd, so it's already out there."</div> <div class="indent">"That's excellent," he says with a smile, and turns to the secretary. "You don't suppose I could just do the interview now? It would only take an hour or so, maybe a little longer."</div> <div class="indent">"Oh, $poss[$sgen] teachers won't mind," Mrs Decker says. "$nomcap[$sgen]'s a model student. A <<if $startsex == "male">>Boy<<else>>Girl<<endif>> Scout, you know."</div> <div class="indent">"Really?" Dahl asks, <<if $startsex == $sex>>impressed. "So<<else>>startled. "Oh, yes, I suppose — you don't look — ah, anyway, <<endif>> we can do the interview now?"</div> <div class="indent">"It'll be just ducky," Mrs Decker assures him. "I'll send one of my senior assistants around."</div> <div class="indent">The interview actually takes quite a bit longer than an hour. You spend the entirety of your last three periods talking about your experiences with the reporter. His questions are much more considered and attentive than Floyd's had been -- this is a real professional at work, after all -- and you are a little more guarded in your answers, particularly when it comes to $so. You're not about to make the same mistake again. When Dahl presses you on the subject of teenage romance, you tell him there's someone you're interested in, but you'd rather not discuss it for the newspaper.</div> <div class="indent">"Fair enough," Dahl says. "I imagime you've had some difficulty with the Scouts, as well. Tell me more about that."</div><<set _confident to true>> <<if $path.includes("new scout troop")>><div class="indent">You explain that you've had to move to a new scout troop for $girlsboys[$soppgen] in order to continue accruing merit badges, and you're going on your first group camping trip tomorrow.</div> <div class="indent">"First one, eh?" he asks. "I should try to attend, and bring a photographer along. We could include that as part of the story."</div> <div class="indent"><<if $sex == $startsex>>"I don't know about that, mister," you say dubiously. "I'm not sure I can go. I'm not exactly the right shape at the moment."<<set _confident to false>><<else>>"I can give you the troop leader's name, if you like," you say. "It's already been arranged."<<endif>></div> <<else>><div class="indent">You explain that you've had some difficulty figuring out how to pursue your scouting career, given everything that's happened to you.</div> <div class="indent">"Well, I shouldn't wonder," Dahl says, nodding. "I could talk to your troop leader and get $poss[$sgen] perspective."</div> <div class="indent"><<if $path.includes("tell scouts")>>"Sure, if you like," you say. "I've already explained what's happened."<<else>><<set _confident to false>>"I don't know about that, mister," you say dubiously. "I haven't exactly told them yet. It's all been so sudden."<<endif>></div> <<endif>>\ <div class="indent"><<if _confident == true>>Elias Dahl takes down the name of your scout leader and the troop number. "The article mentioned that you have had to change some of your classes. Tell me how that's going."<<else>>"Once the article goes in the paper, everybody's going to find out," the reporter says. "So tell me — you've had to change some of your classes around at school. How's that going?"<<endif>></div> <div class="indent">You cover a lot of the same ground as Floyd's article, but in much more depth and detail. Elias Dahl isn't satisfied with yes-or-no questions with easy answers.</div> <div class="indent">Eventually, the bell rings for the end of the last class, and you realize that school is over.</div> <div class="indent">"Already?" the reporter asks, and grins. "I suppose I lost track of time. All right, thank you very much. I'll see about ringing up your scout troop later on, and perhaps I'll ask around with some of your teachers as well. Good luck!"</div> <div class="indent">Elias Dahl shakes your hand again, and leaves.</div> <<display "CleanReturn">> <<endif>>\--[[go|1948 Bully Chat][$page to 5]] <<set $sex to "male">> <<set $startsex to "female">> <<set $path to ["dickgirl schedule", "admit dating"]>> <<set $openzeta to false>> <<set $secret to false>> <<set $newid to true>> <<set $oldid to false>> <<set $gen to 3>> <<set $oppgen to 4>> <<set $sgen to 4>> <<set $soppgen to 3>> <<set $bgen to $sgen>> <<set $bully to "Vera">> <<set $sogen to 7 - $sgen>> <<set $fgen to $sgen>> <<set $friend to "Joyce">> <<set $so to "Ronald">> <<set $classlist to ["1948 Pep Squad"]>>
